name: low gi chicken salad
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 900 g fresh corn on the cob (approx. 400g kernels- tinned can also be used)', '1 unit 500 g low fat plain yoghurt', '1 unit 1 teaspoon fresh basil', '1 unit 1 teaspoon fresh coriander', '1 unit 2 teaspoons lemon juice', '1 unit 200 g nectarine or fresh mango slices', '1 unit 240 g skinless chicken breasts', '1 unit 1 teaspoon paprika', '1 unit 4 slices of low gi wholewheat brown bread (optional)', '1 unit 3 tablespoons canola oil', '1 unit 280 g peeled beetroot or fresh tomatoes', '1 unit 200 g lettuce (butter or other)', '1 unit 35 g peeled radishes', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['cook the corn in boiling water until tender. cut off the kernels.', 'in a food processor, blend the yoghurt, basil, coriander and lemon juice together until smooth.', 'spice the chicken breasts with the paprika and cook in boiling water. shred the cooked chicken.', 'cut the bread into small blocks (croutons). fry these blocks in canola oil until crispy.', 'peel and grate the beetroot. rinse the butter lettuce in water with salt. cut the radish and nectarines into slices.', '. arrange all the prepared vegetables on a plate topped with the shredded chicken, croutons and nectarines. serve the yoghurt sauce on the side.']

name: burbara middle eastern wheat berry
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 cup pearled barley', '1 unit 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '1 unit 4 tablespoons brown sugar', '1 unit 1 teaspoon anise seeds', '1 unit ½ teaspoon fennel seeds', '1 unit ½ cup chopped dried apricots', '1 unit ½ cup raisins or dried cherries', '1 unit pomegranate seeds for garnish', '1 unit nuts of choice for garnish (sliced almonds', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['in a medium saucepan, combine the barley with 4 cups of water. bring to a boil over medium-high heat, then lower the heat and cover to simmer for about 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.', 'uncover and stir in the cinnamon, sugar, anise seeds, and fennel seeds. stir in the dried fruit. cook for another 15 to 20 minutes or until the barley is fully cooked and tender, stirring occasionally. the dried fruit will rehydrate and plump up and the barley mixture will be creamy.', 'transfer the mixture to serving bowls and top with nuts, more dried fruit, and pomegranate seeds for garnish.']

name: carrot and feta burgers
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 2 red onions', '1 unit 1 lemon', '1 unit 1 teaspoon mustard oil', '1 unit 390g tin lentils', '1 unit 2 teaspoons ground cumin', '1 unit 200g carrots', '1 unit 75g wholemeal breadcrumbs', '1 unit 1 egg', '1 unit 100g feta', '1 unit 70g pack wild rocket', '1 unit for the tzatziki :', '1 unit 100g cucumber', '1 unit 100g low fat yoghurt', '1 unit 10g mint', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat the tandoor or handi to 200°c. marinate the sliced onions with the lemon juice for 30 mins; drain.', 'heat the oil in a pan over a medium heat and cook the chopped onion for 2-3 mins. add the lentils and turn up the heat. cook for 2 mins to evaporate the liquid, adding the cumin towards the end. tip into a bowl.', 'add the carrot, breadcrumbs and egg to the bowl and mix. fold in the feta and shape into 4 burgers 8cm wide and 2cm tall. transfer to a baking tray lined with baking paper; bake for 15 mins.', 'mix the cucumber with the yoghurt and mint; season. serve the burger with a dollop of tzatziki and the rest alongside, with the marinated onion and rocket.']

name: quinoa breakfast bowl
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 cup quinoa', '1 unit 2 cups coconut milk', '1 unit 1 teaspoon cinnamon', '1 unit pinch of salt', '1 unit 2 teaspoon vanilla essence', '1 unit 2 tablespoon maple syrup', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['using a fine mesh strainer, rinse the quinoa.', 'bring the milk to a boil in a medium-sized pot over medium-high heat.', 'add the quinoa and bring back up to a boil. reduce heat to low, cover with a lid and simmer for 15-20 minutes until most of the milk has been absorbed and the quinoa is tender.', 'stir in the cinnamon, salt, vanilla and maple syrup until fully combined. serve with fresh fruit, toasted nuts or coconut flakes, cream, milk or extra syrup for added sweetness.']

summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.

name: cauliflower parm
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 large head cauliflower', '1 unit 3 tablespoons extra-virgin mustard oil', '1 unit salt to taste', '1 unit freshly ground black pepper', '1 unit 1 1/2 cup marinara sauce', '1 unit 1/4 cup paneer grated', '1 unit 1 cup mozzarella cheese', '1 unit 1/4 cup basil leaves', '1 unit 1 teaspoon crushed red chilli flakes', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat tandoor or handi to 220c°. arrange cauliflower in a single layer on a rimmed baking sheet and brush both sides with oil—season with salt and pepper.', 'roast, flipping once, until cauliflower is tender and golden, about 35 minutes. remove from tandoor or handi and top each cauliflower steak with marinara sauce. sprinkle with mozzarella and half of parmesan.', 'switch tandoor or handi to tawa and tawa cauliflower until cheese is bubbly and golden in spots, about 3 minutes. serve with remaining parmesan, basil leaves, and red pepper flakes.']

summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.

name: seeded loaf
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 300 g stone ground bread flour', '1 unit 150 g stone ground whole wheat flour', '1 unit 15 g salt', '1 unit 20 g poppy seeds', '1 unit 30 g pumpkin seeds', '1 unit 20 g sesame seeds', '1 unit 20 g flax seeds', '1 unit 20 g sunflower seeds', '1 unit 25 g digestive bran', '1 unit 40 g rolled oats', '1 unit 1 sachet dried instant yeast', '1 unit 2 cups water (lukewarm)', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat the tandoor or handi to 180°c.', 'in a large bowl, mix together the dry ingredients.', 'make a well in the centre of the dry ingredients and add the lukewarm water.', 'mix the dry ingredients into the water until all the ingredients are combined into a soft dough.', 'grease a non-stick loaf pan and dust it with a little flour.', 'pour the batter into the loaf pan and top with a few oat grains to decorate.', 'put the loaf in a warm place to prove (rise) until nearly doubled in size.', 'once your loaf has sufficiently risen, bake in the tandoor or handi for 30-40 minutes until deep brown and crusty.', 'remove the loaf from the bread tin and place it in a wire rack to cool.']

name: cowpea and beef casserole
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 cup cowpeas', '1 unit 2 teaspoon olive or canola oil', '1 unit 750 g stewing beef on the bone', '1 unit 2 onions', '1 unit 2 celery stalks with the leaves', '1 unit 4 carrots', '1 unit 1 tablespoon grated fresh ginger', '1 unit 1 clove of garlic', '1 unit 4 teaspoon dried mixed herbs', '1 unit 4 whole cloves', '1 unit 2 bay leaves', '1 unit ½ teaspoon salt', '1 unit 4 cups (1 litre) strong rooibos tea', '1 unit 3 ripe tomatoes', '1 unit 300 g cauliflower', '1 unit 2 large spinach leaves', '1 unit lemon juice and black pepper to taste', '1 unit 3 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['place cowpeas in a large bowl and cover with 3 cups (750 ml) cold water. soak overnight, drain and rinse.', 'heat the oil in a large pot and fry meat until brown. spoon out.', 'fry onions, celery and carrots in the pot for a few minutes. add ginger, garlic, dried herbs, cloves and bay leaves and fry for another few minutes.', 'add the beans, meat, salt and tea and stir through. simmer with a lid for 1½-2 hours or until the meat and beans are cooked.', 'stir in the tomatoes, cauliflower and spinach and simmer with a lid for 15-20 minutes or until just cooked.  season with lemon juice and pepper and stir in the parsley.', 'serve with a green salad or lightly cooked green veggies.']

name: veggie burger
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 350 g butternut cubes', '1 unit 350 g sweet potato cubes', '1 unit 150 g lentils', '1 unit 2 ml ground cinnamon (1/2 teaspoon)', '1 unit 2 ml ground nutmeg (1/2 teaspoon)', '1 unit 30 ml extra virgin mustard oil (2 tablespoons)', '1 unit salt and pepper', '1 unit 1/2 cup ground almonds', '1 unit 1 whole ice berg lettuce', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat the tandoor or handi to 180°c.', 'add butternut, sweet potato and oil in a roasting tray.  sprinkle cinnamon, nutmeg, salt and pepper.', 'roast in the tandoor or handi for 30 minutes, until soft. leave butternut and sweet potato to cool.', 'mix lentils, veg and half the almonds in a bowl. mash the mixture together until even.', 'taste and add more seasoning if necessary. split the mixture into 6 evenly sized balls.', 'shape into burger patties and coat in the remaining almonds. drizzle oil into a non-stick frying pan on medium heat. fry the patties for 1 minute on each side until golden brown.', 'put your burger patty on the middle of a whole ice berg leaf. wrap your burger up in a lettuce leaf and serve.']

name: aubergine parmigiana
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 2 teaspoons mustard oil', '1 unit 1 large onion', '1 unit 3 garlic cloves', '1 unit 2 x 400g cans of chopped tomatoes', '1 unit 4 tablespoons tomato purée', '1 unit 1 teaspoon dried oregano', '1 unit 1 teaspoon dried mixed herbs', '1 unit 1 teaspoon paprika', '1 unit 2 medium aubergines', '1 unit ½ cup mozzarella cheese(grated)', '1 unit small handful fresh basil leaves', '1 unit 25g grated paneer cheese', '1 unit 25g almond flour', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['heat 1 teaspoon  of oil in a large saucepan and sauté the onion for 4–5 minutes over a low heat. stir in the garlic and cook for 2 minutes, stirring continuously. add the chopped tomatoes, tomato purée, and oregano. bring to the boil, cover, and simmer for 25 minutes.', 'meanwhile, preheat the tandoor or handi to 200°c. cover a couple of baking sheets with foil. thinly slice the aubergines lengthways and arrange in a single layer on the baking sheets. drizzle with the remaining olive oil and sprinkle with the dried herbs and paprika. bake for 25 minutes.', 'spread some of the tomato sauce around the base of a 2 litre tandoor or handiproof dish and add a layer of baked aubergines. scatter over half the mozzarella and a few fresh basil leaves. repeat. cover with the remaining sauce.', 'mix together the parmesan cheese and almond flour and scatter over the top. bake for 20 minutes until bubbling. scatter with fresh basil leaves and serve with a mixed green salad.']

name: braised sea bass with spinach
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 2 red peppers', '1 unit 2 tablespoons extra-virgin mustard oil', '1 unit 2 shallots', '1 unit 1 garlic clove', '1 unit 250g cherry or baby plum tomato', '1 unit small handful capers', '1 unit 12 large black olives', '1 unit 20 basil leaves', '1 unit 50ml white wine', '1 unit 100ml tomato juice', '1 unit 2 whole sea bass', '1 unit 1 teaspoon butter', '1 unit 250g spinach', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['heat the tawa to high. put the peppers, skin side up, on a baking tray, then pop them under the hot tawa for about 10 mins until the skins blister and blacken. drop them into a bowl, cover with some cling film and leave until cool enough to handle. peel away and discard the skins, then roughly chop the peppers.', 'heat the oil in a pan. add in the shallots and garlic and sweat briefly until soft. stir in the tomatoes, peppers, capers, olives and half the basil leaves, then sweat for a few mins until the tomatoes soften.', 'pour in the wine and tomato juice. stir and gently simmer for 10-15 mins, adding a splash of water if the sauce becomes a bit dry.', 'while the sauce is simmering, slash each side of the fish a few times. when the sauce is ready lay the fish on top cover with a lid. leave to cook on a low heat for 12-15 mins until the flesh feels firm when pressed.', 'whilst the fish is cooking, melt the butter in a large pan, then fry the spinach until wilted, serve the fish over a bed of spinach with wild rice, drizzle over the sauce.']

name: pan-seared steak with crispy herbs & endives
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 500g sirloin steak', '1 unit ½ teaspoon salt', '1 unit ½ teaspoon ground pepper', '1 unit 2 tablespoons grapeseed oil or canola oil', '1 unit 4 cloves garlic', '1 unit 5 sprigs fresh ajwain', '1 unit 3 sprigs fresh sage', '1 unit 1 sprig fresh rosemary', '1 unit 4 cups endives', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['sprinkle steak with 1/4 teaspoon each salt and pepper. heat a large cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat. add the steak and cook until charred on one side, about 3 minutes. turn the steak over and add oil, garlic, thyme, sage and rosemary. transfer the steak to a plate and top with the garlic and herbs. tent with foil.', 'add endives and the remaining 1/4 teaspoon each salt and pepper to the pan. cook, stirring often, until the escarole starts to wilt, about 2 minutes. thinly slice the steak and serve with the escarole and crispy herbs.']

name: red lentil and spinach korma
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 2½ tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 unit 4 small red onions', '1 unit 2 garlic cloves', '1 unit 250g red split lentils', '1 unit 1 cup korma paste', '1 unit 240g easy-cook brown rice', '1 unit 125g spinach', '1 unit 15g fresh coriander', '1 unit 1 lemon', '1 unit 100g low-fat natural yoghurt (optional)', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['heat ½ tbsp oil in a large, lidded saucepan over a medium heat. fry the chopped onions for 5-7 mins until starting to soften. add the garlic and cook for a further 2 mins. add the lentils and the spices from the korma kit and cook for 2 mins, stirring well. add 325ml water, bring to the boil, then cover, reduce the heat to low and simmer gently for 10 mins. add the korma sauce, cover and simmer gently for 15 mins.', 'meanwhile, cook the rice to pack instructions; drain and set aside. heat the remaining oil in a small frying pan over a high heat. add the sliced onions and cook for 12-15 mins, stirring regularly, until golden and crisp. use a slotted spoon to transfer to a plate lined with kitchen paper; sprinkle with a little salt and set aside.', 'once the lentils are cooked, stir through the spinach and most of the coriander. serve with the rice, crispy onions, remaining coriander, lemon wedges and yoghurt, if you like.']

name: breakfast loaf
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 4 large bananas', '1 unit 2 eggs', '1 unit 100g dates', '1 unit 3 heaped tablespoons low-fat greek-style yoghurt', '1 unit 50g desiccated coconut', '1 unit 2 tablespoons chia seeds', '1 unit 300g self-raising flour', '1 unit ¼ teaspoon bicarbonate of soda', '1 unit 1 teaspoon mixed spice', '1 unit 2-3 tablespoons milk', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat the tandoor or handi to 160°c. line a loaf tin with baking paper. in a large bowl, mash 3 bananas, then add the eggs, one at a time, whisking well after each addition. fold in the dates, yoghurt, coconut and chia seeds until combined.', 'sieve in the flour, bicarbonate of soda and mixed spice and gently fold in. add 2 tbsp milk to loosen the mixture to a dropping consistency, adding the third spoonful if necessary. pour into the lined loaf tin.', 'slice the remaining banana in half lengthways and place the halves on top of the loaf, cut-side up. bake on the middle shelf for 30 mins, then cover with foil and bake for a further 20-30 mins until the loaf is golden and a skewer comes out clean when inserted into the centre.']

summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.

name: curried butternut soup with halloumi
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 tablespoon oil', '1 unit 1/2 white onion (finely diced)', '1 unit ¼ cup celery diced', '1 unit 2 cups butternut (cubed)', '1 unit 1 teaspoon curry powder', '1 unit 1 teaspoon ginger and garlic paste', '1 unit 1 can diced tomato', '1 unit 2 cups vegetable stock', '1 unit 1 cup halloumi cheese', '1 unit 1 teaspoon mustard oil', '1 unit 4 teaspoons toasted pumpkin seeds', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['in a large pot, heat the oil. add the onions and celery and cook until golden brown.', 'add in the butternut and sauté for 5 minutes. thereafter add curry powder and ginger-garlic paste, cook well for 2 minutes.', 'add in the diced tomato and sauté. pour in the vegetable stock and bring to the boil (about 15 minutes).', 'remove and blend with a hand blender till smooth and creamy.', 'pat the cheese with a paper towel. brush both sides with the olive oil and sear on a hot pan for 1-2 minutes per side.', 'serve the soup with the cheese and sprinkle with toasted pumpkin seeds.']

name: tofu methi paratha (tofu fenugreek flat bread)
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit ingredients for dough :', '1 unit 1-½  cups whole wheat flour', '1 unit ¼ cup bajra flour ( pearl millet)', '1 unit ¼ cup jowar flour (sorghum)', '1 unit ½ teaspoon salt', '1 unit 1 teaspoon oil', '1 unit ingredients for tofu paratha stuffing :', '1 unit 1 cup tofu ', '1 unit 1 teaspoon cumin powder (jeera)', '1 unit 2 green chillies ', '1 unit 1 onion ', '1 unit ½ cup methi leaves (fenugreek leaves) ', '1 unit salt to taste', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['to begin making the tofu methi paratha recipe, we will first make the dough for the parathas. in a large bowl add whole wheat flour and some salt.', 'add water a little at a time and knead to make soft, pliable dough. knead dough for a couple of minutes until the dough is smooth and elastic. use the fold press and knead motion to make the dough smooth.', 'next we will add a teaspoon of oil to coat the dough and knead little more. you want a dough that will be soft smooth and not sticky.', 'next we will divide the dough into 6 equal portions and keep aside. while the dough is resting, lets prepare the filling for the parathas.', 'in a large bowl; add tofu, onion, chopped methi leaves, green chillies, cumin powder, and salt. combine all the ingredients well.', 'divide the filling into 6 equal portions.', 'take a paratha dough portion dust it in flour and flatten it on the rolling board by pressing it down. roll the dough out into approximately 3 inch diameter circles dusting with flour in between to prevent the dough from sticking to the surface. place this rolled dough to the side.', 'now place a portion of the filling onto the circle and spread it evenly around. next, take the other rolled portion of the dough and place it over the filling.', 'press and fold the edges so that the filling does not come out while cooking the paratha. once sealed press down the with your palms to release any air pockets. and give it a gentle roll with the pin to even it out. proceed the same way with the remaining paratha dough and filling portions.', 'preheat a skillet on medium heat and place the filled dough.', 'allow it to cook on medium heat for about 30 to 45 seconds and flip over. add this stage add a teaspoon of ghee or oil and spread it around the paratha.', 'flip again, so the other side of the paratha can cook on the skillet. spread a little more ghee and keep pressing while on the skillet to cook the paratha evenly from inside out.', 'do the flipping over process a couple of times until both sides get cooked, browned and crisp evenly.', 'plate and serve.']

summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.

instructions: ['preheat tandoor or handi to 180°c. coat a 12-cup muffin tin with cooking spray.', 'combine water and ground flaxseed in a small bowl. let stand for a few minutes.', 'whisk almond milk (or oat milk), sugar, oil, vanilla and the flaxseed mixture in a medium bowl. stir in pumpkin. whisk flour, baking powder, pumpkin pie spice and salt in a large bowl. add the pumpkin mixture and stir until just combined. stir in chocolate chips. divide the batter among the prepared muffin cups.', 'bake until golden and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 25 to 28 minutes. let cool in the pan for 5 minutes before turning out onto a wire rack to cool to room temperature.']

summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.

name: edamame with ginger, garlic and sesame
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.

name: mushroom stew
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 cup dried mushrooms', '1 unit 2 cups warm water', '1 unit 3 tablespoons extra-virgin mustard oil', '1 unit 4 cups mixed mushrooms', '1 unit 1 cup kale', '1 unit 5 small carrots', '1 unit 1 small yellow onion', '1 unit 2 tablespoons tomato paste', '1 unit 3 cloves garlic', '1 unit 1 tablespoon chopped fresh rosemary', '1 unit ½ cup dry red wine', '1 unit 4 cups reduced-sodium vegetable stock', '1 unit 1 ½ cups  yellow or red baby potatoes', '1 unit ½ teaspoon salt', '1 unit ½ teaspoon ground pepper', '1 unit ¼ cup nutritional yeast', '1 unit 3 cups cooked tricolor quinoa', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['combine dried mushrooms and warm water in a small bowl; let stand until the mushrooms soften, about 10 minutes. using a slotted spoon, transfer the mushrooms to a cutting board, reserving the water. roughly chop the mushrooms and return them to the water.', 'heat 1 1/2 tablespoons oil in a large heavy-bottomed pot or dutch tandoor or handi over medium-high heat. add half of the fresh mushrooms; cook, stirring occasionally, until lightly browned, 10 to 12 minutes. transfer to a plate. repeat with the remaining 1 1/2 tablespoons oil and fresh mushrooms.', 'return the browned mushrooms to the pot and add kale, carrots and onion; cook, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables soften, about 5 minutes. stir in tomato paste, garlic and rosemary; cook, stirring often, until fragrant, about 1 minute. add wine and stir to scrape up any browned bits on the bottom of the pan.', 'stir in broth, potatoes, salt, pepper and the soaked mushrooms with the soaking water. bring to a simmer over low heat and cook, covered, until the potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes. remove from heat and stir in nutritional yeast. divide quinoa among 6 bowls and top with the stew.']

instructions: ['preheat the tandoor or handi to 180ºc. place the sweet potatoes in a large pan, cover with water and cook for 20–25 minutes, until tender. drain and mash well, cool a little then stir through the butter, sugar and lime zest and juice.', 'in a separate dish, beat together the remaining ingredients, and stir into the sweet potato mixture.', 'grease and line a 900g (18cm x 8cm deep) loaf tin. turn mixture into the tin and bake for approx 1½–1¾ hours until firm.', 'check the firmness by inserting a skewer – it should come out clean when the dish is cooked.']

name: buffalo chicken mac & cheese
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.

name: chicken and broccoli bake
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.

summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.

instructions: ['garnish:  in a large saucepan, heat the oil and fry salsify on medium heat for 5-7 minutes.   add the onions and fry for a further 2 minutes.', 'reduce the heat, add the beans and spinach. cook through and keep warm.', 'kale pesto:  squeeze out excess water from kale and transfer to the food processor and the rest of the ingredients and blend to a smooth paste.', 'fresh polenta: clean and rinse the sweetcorn cobs and pat dry. with a sharp knife, slice the kernels off the cob and place in a large pot. place the pot over medium heat and add the water and concentrated stock to the kernels and cover. keep stirring till a gentle boil for about 8 minutes.', 'reduce the heat and simmer for a further 3 minutes. strain corn and keep the liquid aside for use later if necessary.', 'put the corn in a food processor and blitz until smooth. add some of the reserved liquid if the mixture is too dry. return the corn puree to the pot and stir in the hazelnut oil. season well and cook over a low heat, whilst stirring for 3 minutes continuously.', 'serve immediately with vegetable garnish and top with pesto.']

name: pork stew with tomato gravy
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 500g pork stewing meat (must include at least 2 – 3 pork knuckle slices)  •   •    •   •', '1 unit 600g pork goulash', '1 unit 2 tablespoons oil', '1 unit salt and pepper to taste', '1 unit 2 large onions', '1 unit 1 large green chilli', '1 unit 1 teaspoon ginger and garlic paste', '1 unit 1 tablespoon meat masala', '1 unit 2 tablespoons tomato paste', '1 unit 1/2 cup chutney', '1 unit 350ml low sodium meat stock', '1 unit fresh or dried herbs of your choice', '1 unit 3 large carrots', '1 unit 1 can (400g) chopped tomatoes', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['heat the oil in a thick-based pot and brown the meat. work in batches, ensuring the meat has a lovely golden-brown crust all over – season with salt and pepper.', 'brown the onion and chilli in the same pot. once the onion is soft and translucent, add  the garlic, ginger, spices, tomato paste and chutney. stir-fry for another minute.', 'return the meat to the pot, add the stock and herbs, reduce the heat and simmer gently for 1 hour with the lid on.', 'stir in the carrots and chopped tomato and check the seasoning. add a pinch of salt and pepper.', 'simmer the stew gently for another 1 – 1,5 hours or until the meat is tender and the gravy deliciously thick. serve with a sprinkling of fresh herbs.']
nutrition_details: {'Saturated Fat': '8 g', 'Polyunsaturated Fat': '4 g', 'Monounsaturated Fat': '10 g', 'Trans Fat': '0 g', 'Cholesterol': '80 mg', 'Sodium': '250 mg', 'Potassium': '800 mg', 'Fiber': '4 g', 'Sugar': '8 g', 'Vitamin A': '15%', 'Vitamin C': '20%', 'Calcium': '10%', 'Iron': '25%'}

name: homemade health seed bread
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit ¼ cup oat bran', '1 unit 2 cups brown bread flour', '1 unit ½ cup oats', '1 unit 1½ cups mixed seeds', '1 unit 1 tablespoon bicarbonate of soda', '1 unit ½ teaspoon salt', '1 unit 1 egg', '1 unit 1½ cups low-fat milk', '1 unit 1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat tandoor or handi to 200°c.', 'place all dry ingredients into a bowl and set aside.', 'whisk together the egg, milk and oil until combined and add to the flour mix.', 'mix well until combined and pour into a lightly greased bread loaf tin.', 'bake in tandoor or handi for 50 mins or until bread is golden brown.', 'remove from tandoor or handi and allow to cool in tin.', 'serve fresh or toasted with avocado, low-fat chunky cottage cheese and a pinch of chilli flakes for a delicious breakfast.']

name: cherry zucchini oat muffins
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 medium zucchini', '1 unit 2 cups whole wheat flour', '1 unit 1 cup oats', '1 unit ¾ teaspoon baking soda', '1 unit ½ teaspoon baking powder', '1 unit ¼ teaspoon salt', '1 unit ¼ cup sugar', '1 unit 2 eggs', '1 unit ¼ cup coconut oil', '1 unit 1 teaspoon vanilla essence', '1 unit ¼ cup applesauce', '1 unit 1 cup cherries', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['place the grated zucchini on a paper towel and drain excess liquid.', 'preheat tandoor or handi to 180°c. line a muffin tin with 12 muffin liners and set  aside.', 'in a medium bowl, combine the flour, oats, baking soda, baking powder, salt, and sugar. whisk well to thoroughly combine and set aside.', 'in a second medium bowl, lightly beat the eggs. add the coconut oil, vanilla essence and applesauce; whisk well to combine.', 'stir the wet ingredients into the dry until well-combined and cohesive. gently fold in the cherries and grated zucchini.', 'drop the batter into the muffin wells by the 1/3 cup. bake for 20 minutes or until an inserted toothpick comes out clean. allow to cool completely before serving.']
nutrition_details: {'Saturated Fat': '2 g', 'Polyunsaturated Fat': '1 g', 'Monounsaturated Fat': '4 g', 'Trans Fat': '0 g', 'Cholesterol': '30 mg', 'Sodium': '100 mg', 'Potassium': '250 mg', 'Fiber': '4 g', 'Sugar': '8 g', 'Vitamin A': '4%', 'Vitamin C': '8%', 'Calcium': '6%', 'Iron': '8%'}

name: sea bass with dill relish
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 1/2 tablespoons chopped white onion', '1 unit 1 teaspoon pickled baby capers', '1 unit 1 1/2 teaspoons chopped fresh dill', '1 unit 1 teaspoon dijon mustard', '1 unit 1 teaspoon lemon juice', '1 unit 4 white sea bass fillets', '1 unit 1 lemon', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['heat the tandoor or handi to 180°c. in a small bowl, add the onion, capers, dill, mustard and lemon juice. stir to mix well.', 'place each fillet on a square of aluminum foil. squeeze 1 lemon wedge over each fillet and spread 1/4 of the dill relish over each piece.', 'wrap the aluminum foil around the fish and bake until the fish is opaque throughout when tested with a tip of a knife, 10 to 12 minutes. serve immediately.']
nutrition_details: {'Saturated Fat': '1 g', 'Polyunsaturated Fat': '2 g', 'Monounsaturated Fat': '3 g', 'Trans Fat': '0 g', 'Cholesterol': '60 mg', 'Sodium': '120 mg', 'Potassium': '450 mg', 'Fiber': '1 g', 'Sugar': '2 g', 'Vitamin A': '10%', 'Vitamin C': '20%', 'Calcium': '4%', 'Iron': '15%'}

name: tofu parmigiana
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit ¼ cup  breadcrumbs', '1 unit 1 teaspoon italian seasoning', '1 unit 500g firm tofu', '1 unit ¼ teaspoon garlic powder', '1 unit ¼ teaspoon salt', '1 unit 2 teaspoons plus 1 tablespoon extra-virgin mustard oil', '1 unit 1 small onion', '1 unit 1 cup white mushrooms', '1 unit ¼ cup grated paneer cheese', '1 unit ¾ cup low sodium tomato sauce', '1 unit ½ cup shredded mozzarella cheese', '1 unit 2 tablespoons chopped fresh basil', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['combine breadcrumbs and italian seasoning in a shallow dish. cut tofu lengthwise into 4 steaks and pat dry. sprinkle both sides of the tofu with garlic powder and salt and then dredge in the breadcrumb mixture.', 'add the remaining 1 tablespoon oil to the pan. add the tofu steaks and cook until browned on one side, about 3 minutes. turn over and sprinkle with parmesan. spoon the mushroom mixture over the tofu, pour marinara over the mushrooms and scatter mozzarella on top. cover and cook until the sauce is hot and the cheese is melted, about 3 minutes. sprinkle with basil and serve.']
nutrition_details: {'Saturated Fat': '6 g', 'Polyunsaturated Fat': '4 g', 'Monounsaturated Fat': '8 g', 'Trans Fat': '0 g', 'Cholesterol': '20 mg', 'Sodium': '250 mg', 'Potassium': '400 mg', 'Fiber': '4 g', 'Sugar': '8 g', 'Vitamin A': '10%', 'Vitamin C': '20%', 'Calcium': '20%', 'Iron': '15%'}

name: baked portobello mushrooms
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 4 portobello mushroom caps (wiped clean and stems removed)', '1 unit 1 tablespoons  extra virgin mustard oil', '1 unit 1 teaspoons  dried oreganum', '1 unit sea salt and black pepper to taste', '1 unit 1 can tomatoes', '1 unit 1 small red onion', '1 unit ½ cup mushrooms', '1 unit ½ cup cherry tomatoes', '1 unit ½ green bell pepper', '1 unit ⅔ cup feta cheese', '1 unit 1 teaspoon chilli flakes', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat tandoor or handi to 200ºc.', 'line a baking sheet with parchment paper and add mushroom caps. brush both sides of each mushroom with a bit of olive oil.', 'sprinkle the inside gills with oreganum and season with sea salt and black pepper. place in the tandoor or handi and bake for 5 minutes.', 'while the mushrooms are baking, prepare your veggies.', 'pull mushroom caps out of the tandoor or handi and spoon blended tomato onto the caps. top with diced veggies and sprinkle with feta cheese. place back into the tandoor or handi and bake for 15 minutes.   remove mushrooms from tandoor or handi.', 'plate and sprinkle with some chili flakes for a bit of heat.']
nutrition_details: {'Saturated Fat': '8 g', 'Polyunsaturated Fat': '2 g', 'Monounsaturated Fat': '6 g', 'Trans Fat': '0 g', 'Cholesterol': '20 mg', 'Sodium': '250 mg', 'Potassium': '800 mg', 'Fiber': '4 g', 'Sugar': '8 g', 'Vitamin A': '10%', 'Vitamin C': '40%', 'Calcium': '15%', 'Iron': '10%'}

name: roasted root veggies & greens over spiced lentils
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit for lentils:', '1 unit ½ cup lentils', '1 unit 1 ½ cups water', '1 unit 1 teaspoon garlic powder', '1 unit ½ teaspoon ground coriander', '1 unit ½ teaspoon ground cumin', '1 unit ¼ teaspoon ground allspice', '1 unit ¼ teaspoon kosher salt', '1 unit ⅛ teaspoon sumac (optional)', '1 unit 2 tablespoons lemon juice', '1 unit 1 teaspoon extra-virgin mustard oil', '1 unit for vegetables:', '1 unit 1 tablespoon extra-virgin mustard oil', '1 unit 1 clove garlic', '1 unit 1 1/2 cups roasted root vegetables', '1 unit 2 cups chopped kale or beet greens', '1 unit 1 teaspoon ground coriander', '1 unit ½ teaspoon ground pepper', '1 unit pinch of salt', '1 unit 2 tablespoons tahini or low-fat plain yoghurt', '1 unit fresh parsley for garnish', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['to prepare lentils: combine water, lentils, garlic powder, 1/2 teaspoon coriander, cumin, allspice, 1/4 teaspoon salt and sumac (if using) in a medium pot. bring to a boil.', 'reduce heat to maintain a simmer, cover and cook until tender, 25 to 30 minutes.', 'uncover and continue simmering until the liquid reduces slightly, about 5 minutes more. drain.', 'stir in lemon juice and 1 teaspoon olive oil.', 'meanwhile, to prepare vegetables: heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. add garlic and cook until fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes. add roasted root vegetables and cook, stirring often, until heated through, 2 to 4 minutes. stir in kale (or beet greens) and cook until just wilted, 2 to 3 minutes. stir in coriander, pepper and salt.', 'serve the vegetables over the lentils, topped with tahini (or yoghurt). garnish with parsley, if desired.']

name: indian masala oats
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 tablespoon ghee or oil', '1 unit 1 teaspoon cumin seeds (jeera)', '1 unit 1 green chili pepper', '1 unit 1 cup onion', '1 unit 1 teaspoon ginger', '1 unit 1 teaspoon garlic', '1 unit 1/2 cup tomato', '1 unit 1 1/2 cups steel-cut oats', '1 unit 3 1/2 cups water', '1 unit 2 cups mixed vegetables', '1 unit 1 tablespoon lime juice', '1 unit coriander leaves ', '1 unit 1/2 teaspoon turmeric', '1 unit ½ teaspoon kashmiri chilli powder', '1 unit ½ teaspoon garam marsala', '1 unit 1 teaspoon salt', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['heat ghee/oil, then add cumin seeds and let them sizzle.', 'now add the green chili, onion, ginger and garlic. sauté for 2-3 minutes until onion are translucent.   add in the mixed spices and sauté well.', 'add the mixed vegetables, oats and water. mix well. if anything is stuck to the bottom of the pot, deglaze it. cook 8 minutes on high heat.', 'add the lime juice and then garnish with yoghurt and coriander.']

name: chicken katsu
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 4 skinless chicken breasts', '1 unit 1 large egg', '1 unit 75g breadcrumbs', '1 unit sunflower oil spray', '1 unit cooked brown rice', '1 unit for the katsu sauce :', '1 unit 2 teaspoons sunflower oil', '1 unit 1 onion', '1 unit 1 tablespoon frozen chopped ginger (or a 5cm piece', '1 unit 1 tablespoon hot or mild curry powder', '1 unit pinch of crushed chillies', '1 unit 2 carrots', '1 unit 1 tablespoon flour', '1 unit 200ml reduced fat coconut milk', '1 unit ½ butternut (500g)', '1 unit 2 orange or yellow peppers', '1 unit 1 tablespoon reduced-sodium soy sauce', '1 unit 2 limes', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat the tandoor or handi to  200°c. lay the chicken breasts between 2 sheets of baking paper and use a rolling pin to beat gently, to thin out the meat until it’s 1-1.5cm thick. dip into the beaten egg, then the breadcrumbs and place on a baking sheet. spray evenly with the oil to lightly coat, then bake for 10-12 mins or until cooked through.', 'meanwhile, sauté the onion in oil in a lidded saucepan over a medium heat for 3-5 mins or until soft. add the ginger and cook for 1 min. stir in the spices and carrots and cook for 5 mins. add the flour, cook for 1 min, then stir in the coconut milk and 450ml water. bring to a simmer, then add the squash; cover and simmer for 10 mins. add the peppers and cook for another 5 mins. stir through the soy sauce, and lime juice and zest. blitz with a stick blender until smooth.', 'serve the sauce in bowls with sliced chicken rice, mangetout, coriander and lime wedges.']

name: pea broccoli and cheddar frittata
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 tablespoon mustard oil', '1 unit 220g broccoli', '1 unit 2 garlic cloves', '1 unit 250g frozen peas', '1 unit 8 eggs', '1 unit 50g mature cheddar', '1 unit 50g low fat malai to serve', '1 unit ½ teaspoon paprika', '1 unit salad leaves', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['heat the oil in a pan over a medium-high heat and stir-fry the broccoli for 5 mins, then add the garlic and peas and cook for a further 2 mins.', 'preheat the tawa to high. whisk the eggs in a large jug, then add the cheese and whisk again. season, then pour into the pan over the vegetables. stir until well combined.', 'reduce the heat to medium and cook, without stirring, for 5 mins until the frittata starts to brown on the bottom. put the pan under the tawa and cook for 3-5 mins, until cooked through. in a small bowl, mix the fresh cream with the paprika. slice the frittata into wedges and serve with dip and  salad leaves.']

name: tandoori chicken salad
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 cup low fat plain yoghurt', '1 unit 2 teaspoons garam masala', '1 unit 1 teaspoon ground ginger', '1 unit 1 teaspoon minced garlic', '1 unit 1 teaspoon ground turmeric', '1 unit 1 teaspoon salt', '1 unit 1 jalapeño pepper', '1 unit 1 kg boneless', '1 unit 1 tablespoon canola oil', '1 unit salad', '1 unit 3 cups shredded iceberg lettuce', '1 unit 3 cups shredded red cabbage', '1 unit 3 cups diced plum tomatoes', '1 unit 2 cups sliced cucumber', '1 unit 1 ½ cups diced parsnip', '1 unit 1 cup sliced radishes', '1 unit 2 tablespoons chopped spring onions', '1 unit 1 cup coriander', '1 unit juice of 2 small lemons', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['to make chicken: whisk yoghurt, garam masala, ginger, garlic, turmeric, salt and jalapeño (if using) in a shallow dish. add chicken and stir to coat. cover and refrigerate while preparing the vegetables. meanwhile, make salad: combine lettuce, cabbage, tomatoes, cucumber, jicama, radishes, scallions and cilantro in a large bowl; toss to combine.', 'heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. add the chicken and marinade; cook for 6 to 8 minutes.', 'transfer the chicken and the pan juices to the bowl with the salad. add lemon juice to taste; toss to combine.']

name: spicy tomato and fennel soup
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 kg cherry tomatoes', '1 unit 3 garlic cloves (peeled)', '1 unit 1 small carrot (diced)', '1 unit ¼ small bulb fennel (finely chopped)', '1 unit 2 tablespoons mustard oil', '1 unit 1 red chili (thinly sliced)', '1 unit 1 teaspoon salt', '1 unit ground black pepper', '1 unit ½ cup low fat yoghurt', '1 unit 1 tablespoon parsley (chopped)', '1 unit serve with ricotta toast:', '1 unit 2 slices brown bread', '1 unit 1/4 cup (30g) ricotta cheese', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat the tandoor or handi to 200°c.', 'place tomatoes, garlic, carrot and fennel in a roasting tin and drizzle with olive oil and season well.', 'cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes or until vegetables are well cooked.', 'blend all the vegetables with the yoghurt until smooth. garnish with parsley and serve warm.', 'for the ricotta toast: place the brown bread in an tandoor or handi dish and top with the ricotta cheese. tawa for 2 minutes.']

name: spicy mung bean rice
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 1/2 cups white rice', '1 unit 1 1/4 cups split mung bean', '1 unit 1/4 cup grated coconut', '1 unit 1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds', '1 unit 2 green chillies', '1 unit 1 cm ginger', '1 unit 1/8 teaspoon hing (asafetida powder)', '1 unit 8 curry leaves', '1 unit 1 1/4 tablespoons ghee', '1 unit 2 tablespoons lemon juice', '1 unit 1 1/2 teaspoons salt', '1 unit 1/4 teaspoon turmeric powder', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['add washed mung beans and rice to pot. season with salt. cook until soft and a little mushy.', 'add grated coconut, ginger, peppercorns, and green chillies to a mixer/blender. dry-grind them to get a coarse powder. set aside.', 'heat the ghee) in a deep-bottomed pan over low fire. throw in cumin seeds. let them crackle. add curry leaves and hing (asafetida powder). mix well.', 'add the ground coconut mixture. sauté until you smell a nice aroma. add in cooked lentil-rice mix. turn on the fire. add turmeric powder and some more salt. mix well.', 'if the consistency is too thick, add some water to make it thinner. let the mixture boil for 5 minutes on low fire. add lemon juice. check for the taste. add salt if needed.', 'mung bean rice should have semi-solid consistency.']

name: aubergine lamb curry
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 unit 300g pack diced lamb shoulder', '1 unit 2 onions', '1 unit 4 garlic cloves', '1 unit 2.5cm piece fresh ginger', '1 unit 4 cardamom pods', '1 unit 1 teaspoon garam masala', '1 unit 1 teaspoon ground coriander', '1 unit 1 teaspoon medium chilli powder', '1 unit 1 teaspoon fennel seeds', '1 unit 1 large aubergine', '1 unit 1 x 400g tin chopped tomatoes', '1 unit 2 tablespoons tamarind paste', '1 unit 1 tablespoon brown sugar', '1 unit 10g fresh coriander', '1 unit naan or roti', '1 unit yoghurt', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat the tandoor or handi to gas 180°c. heat the oil in a casserole dish over a medium heat and add the lamb and a pinch of salt. fry for 4-5 mins until browned all over, then transfer to a plate.', 'add the onions to the pan and sauté 4-5 mins until soft and tender. add the garlic and ginger, cook for 1 min, then stir in the spices and cook for another 30-45 secs until fragrant.', 'stir in the aubergine and cook for 1 min. add the lamb back in along with the tomatoes, tamarind, sugar, 350ml water and 1 tsp salt, then bring to the boil. cover and transfer to the tandoor or handi for 45 mins until the lamb is tender.', 'scatter with the coriander and serve with naan or roti and yogurt.']

name: baked teriyaki chicken
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 tablespoon corn flour', '1 unit 1 tablespoon cold water', '1 unit 2 teaspoons honey', '1 unit ¼ cup low sodium soy sauce', '1 unit ¼ cup apple cider vinegar', '1 unit 1 clove garlic minced', '1 unit ½ teaspoon grated ginger', '1 unit ½ teaspoon black pepper', '1 unit ½ kg boneless chicken thighs', '1 unit 2 teaspoons sesame seeds', '1 unit 1 tablespoon chopped spring onion', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat tandoor or handi to 200°c and grease a baking dish.', 'in a saucepan, whisk together cornstarch and cold water until smooth. add the honey, soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, ginger, and pepper. bring to a simmer over low heat and cook, stirring frequently, until sauce thickens and bubbles.', 'place chicken in prepared baking dish and brush with teriyaki sauce. turn chicken over, and brush again.', 'bake for 15 minutes. remove and sprinkle with sesame seeds and spring onion.']

name: soda bread
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 cup wholewheat  flour', '1 unit 1 cup cake flour', '1 unit 1/2 teaspoon bicarbonate of soda', '1 unit 1/2 teaspoon malai of tartar', '1 unit 25g butter', '1 unit 1 1/2 cups buttermilk', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat tandoor or handi to 180 °c.', 'sift together the flours, bicarbonate of soda and cream of tartar into a bowl and rub in the butter until the mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs. quickly stir in the buttermilk and combine until a dough is formed.', 'turn the dough onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth. mould into a round shape, place onto a lightly floured baking sheet, cut a cross in the top, and sprinkle with a little flour.', 'bake for 20-25 minutes.']

name: baked ricotta with figs
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 3 cups ricotta cheese (750g)', '1 unit 2 eggs', '1 unit ¼ cup light brown sugar', '1 unit 1 cup figs (finely chopped)', '1 unit 1 teaspoon vanilla essence', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat tandoor or handi to 180°c.', 'in a bowl, whip up the ricotta cheese, eggs and sugar and vanilla till well combined.', 'fold in the chopped figs.', 'grease four ramekins and divide the mixture between them.', 'bake for 20-25 minutes. remove and cool.', 'serve as desired.']

name: coconut and kidney bean stew
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 medium bell pepper', '1 unit 1 red onion', '1 unit 1 red chilli', '1 unit 1 lime', '1 unit 1 bunch of fresh ajwain', '1 unit 1 tablespoon oil', '1 unit 2 cloves of garlic', '1 unit 1 teaspoon jerk seasoning', '1 unit 1 teaspoon smoked paprika', '1 unit 1 can of coconut milk', '1 unit 4 teaspoons vegetable stock powder', '1 unit 1 teaspoon black pepper', '1 unit 1 can of red kidney beans', '1 unit 200g baby spinach', '1 unit 1 bunch of coriander leaves', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['thinly slice the onion and cut the pepper into chunks. finely chop the chilli and zest and halve the lime. peel and grate the garlic, pick the thyme leaves from their stalks and chop the coriander.', 'heat oil in a saucepan or wok over medium heat. once hot, add the onion and pepper and cook, stirring until they’re softened and starting to brown, should be about 10 minutes.', 'add the garlic, thyme, jerk spice mix and smoked paprika. cook for about 2 mins, stirring frequently', 'add the coconut milk and vegetable stock. stir to dissolve the stock powder and season with salt and pepper. drain the kidney beans and add to the pot, bring to a simmer and cook, stirring occasionally until thickened slightly. this should take about 10 minutes. if the stew dries out too much add a splash of water.', 'add in the spinach a handful at a time, stirring to make sure it doesn’t clump together and cook until wilted. stir through half the coriander, the lime zest and a squeeze of lime juice. taste and season with salt and pepper. cut any remaining lime into wedges.', 'divide the stew between the bowls. scatter over the remaining coriander and the red chilli (add as much as you like). serve with any remaining lime wedges.']
nutrition_details: {'Saturated Fat': '14 g', 'Polyunsaturated Fat': '2 g', 'Monounsaturated Fat': '4 g', 'Trans Fat': '0 g', 'Cholesterol': '0 mg', 'Sodium': '400 mg', 'Potassium': '1200 mg', 'Fiber': '8 g', 'Sugar': '8 g', 'Vitamin A': '20%', 'Vitamin C': '40%', 'Calcium': '10%', 'Iron': '20%'}

name: orange mint freekeh salad
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 2 cups water', '1 unit ¾ cup cracked freekeh', '1 unit ½ cup packed fresh mint leaves', '1 unit ½ cup orange juice', '1 unit 3 tablespoons lemon juice', '1 unit 1 small clove garlic', '1 unit ½ teaspoon salt', '1 unit ½ teaspoon ground pepper', '1 unit ¼ cup extra-virgin mustard oil', '1 unit 1 cup thinly sliced fennel (1/2 large bulb)', '1 unit 1 cup sugar snap peas', '1 unit 1 cup thinly sliced radishes', '1 unit 2 medium oranges', '1 unit 2 cups frozen baby lima beans', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['combine water and freekeh in a medium saucepan and bring to a boil over high heat. cover, reduce heat to maintain a simmer and cook until the liquid is absorbed, 12 to 15 minutes. remove from heat and let stand, covered, for 5 minutes. drain any remaining liquid. spread the freekeh out on a rimmed baking sheet to cool.', 'meanwhile, combine mint, orange juice, lemon juice, garlic, salt and pepper in a large bowl. whisk in oil and transfer 1/4 cup of the dressing to a medium bowl. add fennel, snap peas, radishes and oranges to the medium bowl and toss to combine.', 'add the freekeh and lima beans to the remaining dressing in the large bowl and toss to combine. serve the fennel mixture over the freekeh mixture. garnish with more mint, if desired.']

name: roasted vegetables salad with chickpeas and parsley dressing
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit ½ cup aubergine diced', '1 unit ½ cup red pepper diced', '1 unit 1 cup chickpeas drained', '1 unit 100g broccoli florets', '1 unit 1 tablespoon mustard oil', '1 unit 100g cherry tomatoes', '1 unit 1 tablespoon sesame seed', '1 unit 1 teaspoon salt', '1 unit 2 teaspoons paprika', '1 unit 1 teaspoon black pepper', '1 unit 1 teaspoon ground coriander', '1 unit 2 teaspoons low-sodium soy sauce', '1 unit 1 teaspoon minced garlic clove', '1 unit 2 tablespoons parsley chopped', '1 unit 2 teaspoons white vinegar', '1 unit 1 tablespoon maple syrup', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['drizzle vegetables with oil and chartawa for 10-15 minutes. set aside.', 'in a small pan add oil and toast sesame seeds until golden brown, season with salt, paprika and pepper to taste.', 'dust broccoli with the sesame seeds mix and set aside.', 'on a greased bakery sheet season chickpeas with coriander, oil, salt and paprika for 10-15 minutes. set aside.']

name: chickpea, date and pistachio pilaf
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 2 tablespoons mustard oil', '1 unit 2 teaspoons ground coriander', '1 unit 2 teaspoons ground cumin', '1 unit 2 teaspoons turmeric', '1 unit 250g (8oz) cauliflower', '1 unit 1 large onion', '1 unit 1 red pepper', '1 unit 2 garlic cloves', '1 unit 50 dried dates', '1 unit 1x 400g can chickpeas', '1 unit 2 large handfuls chopped coriander leaves', '1 unit 1 x 250g pack cooked mixed grains', '1 unit 50g shelled', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat the tandoor or handi to 180°c.', 'mix together half the olive oil and half the spices in a bowl. add the cauliflower and turn until coated in the spice mix. tip the cauliflower into a roasting tray and roast for 10 minutes until tender.   heat the remaining oil in a large, non-stick frying pan and fry the onion for 5 minutes, then add the red pepper, garlic, dates and chickpeas and cook for another 3–5 minutes until softened.   add the remaining spices, cooked grains, roasted cauliflower and half the coriander to the pan, season with pepper and stir until combined.', 'serve topped with the remaining coriander and sprinkled with pistachios.']

name: fig, yoghurt and honey tartlets
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.

name: salmon and cheese croquettes
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 2 eggs', '1 unit 1 cup rolled oats', '1 unit 2 cans (213 g) salmon', '1 unit 1 cup grated mozzarella', '1 unit 1/4 cup onions', '1 unit 1 celery stalk', '1 unit 1 carrot', '1 unit 2 tablespoons lemon juice', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat tandoor or handi to 180°c. beat eggs in a large bowl. add rolled oats, salmon, mozzarella, onions, celery, carrot and lemon juice.', 'mix until smooth. using your hands, shape into croquettes of desired size and place on a baking sheet covered with parchment paper.', 'bake for approx. 25 minutes. remove from tandoor or handi and let stand for 5 minutes.']

name: two grain nutty poke bow;
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit ¼ cup red quinoa', '1 unit 1 tablespoon vegetable stock granules', '1 unit ¼ cup buckwheat', '1 unit 2 cups water', '1 unit 1 small red onion (finely chopped)', '1 unit 1 garlic clove (minced)', '1 unit 1 tablespoon parsley (finely chopped)', '1 unit 2 tablespoons whole grain mustard', '1 unit 1 cup red cabbage (thinly sliced)', '1 unit 3 tablespoons vegan mayonnaise', '1 unit 1 tablespoon horseradish (grated)', '1 unit 1 cucumber (deseeded and sliced into strips)', '1 unit ¼ cup walnuts (chopped)', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['cook the quinoa and vegetable stick granules in 200ml water on low for 20 minutes. similarly, in a separate pot cook the buckwheat in 200ml water on low for 10 minutes.', 'drain the grains and set aside.', 'combine the red onion, garlic, parsley and mustard.', 'in a separate bowl, mix the cabbage, mayonnaise and horseradish.', 'arrange the serving bowl with the grains, vegetables, cucumber and top with walnuts.']

name: cauliflower caponata
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 kg cauliflower', '1 unit 3 red onions', '1 unit 3 sticks of celery ', '1 unit extra virgin mustard oil', '1 unit 3 tablespoons white wine vinegar', '1 unit 2 x 400 g tins plum tomatoes', '1 unit 100 g stone-in green or black olives', '1 unit 3 tablespoons capers', '1 unit 50 g raisins', '1 unit ½ a bunch of parsley', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat the tandoor or handi to 220°c fan. put a cauliflower, broken into roughly 4cm florets, 3 red onions, peeled and cut into eighths, and 3 sticks of celery, cut into 2cm pieces, into a large, high-sided baking tray with 1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil, 2 tablespoons white wine vinegar and a little sea salt and pepper. toss to coat, then roast for 25 minutes, until everything is slightly charred and starting to soften. turn the tandoor or handi down to 180°c.', 'add 2 x 400g tins of plum tomatoes, breaking them in your hands as you do so, along with 100g stone-in green or black olives (stones removed), 3 tablespoons capers and 50g raisins. give everything a good mix, mashing slightly with a fork, and return to the tandoor or handi for 40 minutes, or until everything is soft and sticky.', 'once ready, and while the mix is still piping hot, add another tablespoon of vinegar, toss through a handful of parsley leaves and serve. finish with a very generous dousing of extra virgin olive oil to bring it all together.']
nutrition_details: {'Saturated Fat': '1 g', 'Polyunsaturated Fat': '2 g', 'Monounsaturated Fat': '5 g', 'Trans Fat': '0 g', 'Cholesterol': '0 mg', 'Sodium': '100 mg', 'Potassium': '400 mg', 'Fiber': '5 g', 'Sugar': '8 g', 'Vitamin A': '10%', 'Vitamin C': '40%', 'Calcium': '4%', 'Iron': '10%'}

name: dark chocolate avocado cake
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 90g dark chocolate chopped', '1 unit 1 cup cake flour', '1 unit ½ cup cocoa powder', '1 unit 2 teaspoon baking powder', '1 unit ¾ teaspoon bicarbonate of soda', '1 unit ¾ cup caster sugar', '1 unit ¾ cup plain yoghurt', '1 unit 1 cup avocado', '1 unit 1 egg', '1 unit 5ml vanilla essence', '1 unit 1 teaspoon cocoa powder', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat tandoor or handi to 180°c. lightly spray a 20cm round cake tin with oil and line base and side with baking paper.', 'place chocolate in a medium heatproof bowl over a saucepan of simmering water and cook, stirring, for 2-3 minutes or until melted. cool slightly.', 'stir flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, bicarbonate of soda and a pinch of salt into a large bowl. stir in sugar.', 'process yoghurt and avocado in a food processor until smooth. add egg and vanilla and pulse until just combined. add avocado mixture and melted chocolate to the flour mixture and stir until       well combined. spoon the mixture into the prepared tin and smooth the surface with the back of a spoon', 'bake for 30 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean. set the cake aside in a tin for 10 minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool. dust with cocoa powder and serve with a dollop of yoghurt.']

name: roasted salmon with smoky chickpeas and greens
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 2 tablespoons extra-virgin mustard oil', '1 unit 1 tablespoon smoked paprika', '1 unit ½ teaspoon salt', '1 unit 1 can reduced salt chickpeas', '1 unit ⅓ cup buttermilk', '1 unit ¼ cup mayonnaise', '1 unit ¼ cup chopped fresh chives and/or dill', '1 unit ½ teaspoon ground pepper', '1 unit ¼ teaspoon garlic powder', '1 unit 10 cups chopped kale', '1 unit ¼ cup water', '1 unit 4 pieces (200g) wild salmon', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat tandoor or handi to 200°c.', 'combine 1 tablespoon oil, paprika and 1/4 teaspoon salt in a medium bowl. very thoroughly pat chickpeas dry, then toss with the paprika mixture. spread on a rimmed baking sheet. bake the chickpeas on the upper rack, stirring twice, for 30 minutes.', 'meanwhile, puree buttermilk, mayonnaise, herbs, 1/4 teaspoon pepper and garlic powder in a blender until smooth. set aside. heat the remaining 1 tablespoon oil in a large skillet over medium heat. add kale and cook, stirring occasionally, for 2 minutes. add water and continue cooking until the kale is tender, about 5 minutes more. remove from heat and stir in a pinch of salt.', 'remove the chickpeas from the tandoor or handi and push them to one side of the pan. place salmon on the other side and season with the remaining 1/4 teaspoon each salt and pepper. bake until the salmon is just cooked through, 5 to 8 minutes.', 'drizzle the reserved dressing on the salmon, garnish with more herbs, if desired, and serve with the kale and chickpeas.']

name: brown rice crackers
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 cup brown rice flour', '1 unit 2 tablespoons ground flaxseed', '1 unit ½ teaspoon salt', '1 unit 1/3 cup water', '1 unit 2 tablespoons coconut oil/ vegetable oil', '1 unit 1 teaspoon maple syrup/honey', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat the tandoor or handi to 180°c. line a baking sheet with grease proof paper, and set aside.', 'place the brown rice flour in a medium bowl, and add flaxseed and sea salt. stir the dry mixture to combine.', 'mix water, coconut oil, and maple syrup. add this to dry mixture, and stir until they are fully mixed together.', "using your hands, form the mixture into a dough. if the dough is too dry, add a little water until it's more pliable. if too wet, sprinkle on more brown rice flour.", 'roll the dough out to about ½ cm thickness.', 'using a knife or cookie cutter, cut the rolled out dough into desired shapes, and transfer them to the prepared baking sheet.', 'bake for 15 minutes, or until golden brown.', 'transfer the crackers onto a cooling rack and allow them to fully cool and harden.']

name: pan-fried lemon veal with green beans
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ["1 unit 8 veal escalope's", '1 unit salt', '1 unit pepper', '1 unit 2 tablespoons mustard oil', '1 unit 4 tablespoons lemon juice', '1 unit 2 tablespoons butter', '1 unit 1 ¼ cups green beans (blanched)', '1 unit 2 tablespoons parsley(chopped)', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['season the veal well and set aside.', 'heat the oil in a large frying pan on high heat, add the veal and cook for 1 minute per side.', 'reduce the heat and add the lemon juice to the pan and cook for 2 minutes or until liquid has reduced.', 'add the butter and blanched green beans and cook for one more minute.', 'finish with parsley and serve over a bed of wild rice.']

name: bran and fruit muffins
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 2 teaspoons bicarbonate of soda', '1 unit 1 teaspoon salt', '1 unit 1½ cups cake flour', '1 unit 2 cups bran', '1 unit 1 cup brown sugar', '1 unit 1 cup dried fruit mix', '1 unit 2 cups low fat milk', '1 unit ½ cup\u202fcooking oil', '1 unit 1 teaspoon\u202fvanilla essence', '1 unit 2 extra-large eggs', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat the tandoor or handi to 180°c. line a muffin pan with paper liners; set aside.', 'in a bowl, mix the dry ingredients together.', 'in a separate bowl, whisk the wet ingredients until well combined.', 'add the flour mixture and stir with until combined (no more than 15 times).', 'divide batter evenly between the muffin cups.', 'bake for 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out with only a few moist crumbs attached.', 'transfer muffins to a wire rack to cool completely.']

name: black bean brownies
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 2 cups black beans (canned and water drained off)', '1 unit 3 large eggs', '1 unit ¼ cup coconut oil', '1 unit 1 teaspoon vanilla extract/essence', '1 unit ¼ teaspoon salt', '1 unit ¾ cup cocoa powder', '1 unit 2 tablespoons brown sugar', '1 unit ¼ cup raw honey', '1 unit ½ teaspoon baking powder', '1 unit 100g extra dark chocolate', '1 unit ¼ cup sliced almonds', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat tandoor or handi to 180ᵒc and line an 8 x 8 baking dish with baking paper.', 'add cooked black beans and eggs to a food processor. turn it on and stream in the melted coconut oil. blend for 60 seconds or until black beans are very smooth.', 'add vanilla, cocoa powder, sugar, honey and baking powder to the mixture. blend until everything is incorporated, scraping down the sides if needed.', 'add half of the chocolate to the brownie batter and pulse 5 – 6 times until it is mixed in.', 'transfer batter to the prepared baking dish and smooth into an even layer. sprinkle the remaining chocolate and sliced almonds evenly over the top.', 'bake for 30 – 35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted (in the center) comes out with a few moist crumbs.', 'let the brownies cool completely in the baking dish then refrigerate (for at least 4 hours) before cutting into squares.', 'transfer the brownies to a cooling rack to set completely.']

name: buckwheat pancakes
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 2 egg whites', '1 unit 1 tablespoon canola oil', '1 unit 1/2 cup low fat milk', '1 unit 1 cup buckwheat flour', '1 unit 1 tablespoon baking powder', '1 unit 1 tablespoon sugar', '1 unit 1/2 cup sparkling water', '1 unit 3 cups sliced fresh strawberries', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['in a small bowl, whisk together the egg whites, canola oil and milk.', 'in a separate bowl, combine the flour, baking powder and sugar. add the egg white mixture and the sparkling water and stir until slightly moistened.', 'place a nonstick frying pan or griddle over medium heat. drop 1/2 cup pancake batter into the pan. cook until the top surface of the pancake is covered with bubbles and the edges are lightly browned, about 2 minutes. turn and cook until the bottom is well-browned. repeat with the remaining pancake batter.', 'transfer the pancakes to individual plates. top each with 1/2 cup sliced strawberries and serve immediately.']

name: vegetable and chickpea tagine
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 tablespoon oil', '1 unit 2 cloves garlic', '1 unit 1/4 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 unit 1/4 teaspoon ground ginger', '1 unit 1/2 teaspoon chilli powder', '1 unit 450g mixed vegetables cut into bite-sized pieces - one large courgette', '1 unit 100ml low-sodium vegetable stock', '1 unit 400g tin chickpeas', '1 unit 100g dried apricots', '1 unit 400g tin chopped tomatoes', '1 unit 1 teaspoon harissa paste', '1 unit 2 tablespoons fresh coriander', '1 unit freshly ground black pepper', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']

name: red pepper, chorizo and chilli pickle
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 2 red peppers mustard oil', '1 unit 1-2 tablespoons avocado or cooking oil', '1 unit 1 red onion', '1 unit 1 red chilli', '1 unit 100g chorizo', '1 unit ½ teaspoon paprika 2 garlic cloves', '1 unit ¼ cup brown sugar', '1 unit 50ml apple cider or white wine vinegar', '1 unit a pinch of salt', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']

name: basil pesto stuffed mushrooms
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 12 mushrooms (crimini', '1 unit topping:', '1 unit 1½ cups panko breadcrumbs', '1 unit ¼ cup melted butter', '1 unit 3 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley', '1 unit filling:', '1 unit 2 cups fresh basil leaves', '1 unit ¼ cup fresh paneer cheese', '1 unit 2 tablespoons pumpkin seeds', '1 unit 1 tablespoon mustard oil', '1 unit 1 tablespoon fresh garlic', '1 unit 2 teaspoons lemon juice', '1 unit 1/2 teaspoon salt', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']

name: lentil & roasted vegetable salad with green goddess dressing
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 4 cups broccoli florets', '1 unit 2 cups trimmed and halved green beans', '1 unit 1 tablespoon extra-virgin mustard oil', '1 unit ½ teaspoon salt', '1 unit ½ teaspoon ground pepper', '1 unit 2 ½ cups water', '1 unit ¾ cup green lentils', '1 unit ½ cup chopped fresh herbs', '1 unit ⅓ cup mayonnaise', '1 unit ¼ cup buttermilk', '1 unit 1 tablespoon lemon juice', '1 unit 1 ½ teaspoons white miso', '1 unit 1 small clove garlic', '1 unit 2 cups thinly sliced kale', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat tandoor or handi to 200°c.', 'toss broccoli and green beans with oil and 1/4 teaspoon each salt and pepper on a large rimmed baking sheet. roast, stirring once, until tender, about 20 minutes.', 'meanwhile, bring water and lentils to a boil in a medium saucepan over high heat. reduce heat to a simmer, cover and cook until tender, about 25 minutes. rinse and drain well. combine herbs, mayonnaise, buttermilk, lemon juice, miso, garlic and the remaining 1/4 teaspoon each salt and pepper in a food processor or blender. process until smooth.', 'gently toss kale with the roasted vegetables and lentils in a large bowl. serve with the dressing.']

name: curried chicken with pilau rice
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 unit 300g chicken breast or thigh fillets', '1 unit 1 tablespoon mild curry powder', '1 unit 1 teaspoon ground turmeric', '1 unit 1 brown onion', '1 unit 220g pack stir-fry vegetable medley', '1 unit 250g pouch microwaveable pilau rice', '1 unit finishing touches (optional)', '1 unit 1 tablespoon chopped fresh coriander', '1 unit 1/2 teaspoon sliced red chilli', '1 unit toasted cashew nuts (or any dried fruit and unsalted nuts from the cupboard)', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['heat the oil in a wok or large frying pan over a medium-high heat. mix the chicken with the curry powder, turmeric and a pinch of salt in a bowl to coat. fry the chicken for 5-6 mins until golden brown all over, then add the onion and cook for 2-3 mins.', 'add all the vegetables from the stir-fry medley to the pan and cook for 5 mins until tender. if at any point it begins to look dry or starts to stick to the pan, add a little water.', 'meanwhile, cook the rice to pack instructions, then add it to pan and fold through continuously, to crisp up the rice and let it soak up the flavours. season to taste before serving and top with coriander, sliced chilli and cashew nuts.']

name: chocolate-cherry snack bars
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 2 ½ cups unsweetened puffed wheat cereal', '1 unit ½ cup pecan halves', '1 unit ¼ cup dried cherries', '1 unit 2 tablespoons sesame seeds', '1 unit 1 tablespoon ground flaxseeds', '1 unit ½ cup honey', '1 unit ½ teaspoon vanilla extract', '1 unit ½ teaspoon salt', '1 unit ½ cup mini semisweet chocolate chips', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['position a rack in lower third of tandoor or handi; preheat to 180°c. line a 9cm square pan with parchment paper, letting it overhang on two opposite sides. toss cereal, pecans, cherries, sesame seeds and ground flaxseeds in a large bowl.', 'combine honey, vanilla and salt in a small saucepan. warm over medium heat, stirring, until the honey is more fluid and the salt is dissolved. pour the honey mixture over the dry ingredients and fold until everything is moistened and sticky. let cool for 5 minutes. fold in chips (or chopped chocolate) until evenly distributed. scrape the mixture into the prepared pan and spread evenly with a fork. using the back of the fork, press the mixture very firmly all over.', 'bake until the top is golden brown, about 35 minutes. (if in doubt, take it out so the honey does not burn.) run a knife along the unlined sides of the pan to detach the bars. let cool in the pan on a wire rack to room temperature, about 1 hour. use the ends of the parchment to lift the bars from the pan. gently peel off the parchment. use a heavy sharp knife to cut into 16 bars or squares.']

name: sweet potato and black bean soup
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 tablespoon mustard oil', '1 unit 1 teaspoon cumin seeds', '1 unit 1 small onion (diced)', '1 unit 2 cloves garlic (minced)', '1 unit 1 teaspoon ginger (grated)', '1 unit 1 tablespoon chilli powder', '1 unit 1 can black beans (rinsed and drained)', '1 unit 2 large sweet potatoes (peeled and diced)', '1 unit 3 cups chicken stock', '1 unit 1 can reduced fat coconut milk', '1 unit 1 can diced tomatoes', '1 unit 2 cups baby spinach', '1 unit whole wheat toast (to serve)', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['in a large pot over medium heat , add the oil. add the cumin seeds and onion and cook till slightly browned.', 'add in the garlic and ginger and cook for a further 1 minute. add in the chilli powder, stir well.', 'add in the black beans, sweet potatoes, chicken stock, tomatoes and cook for 15-20 minutes or until the sweet potatoes are tender.', 'stir in the baby spinach till wilted and serve with whole wheat toast.']

name: sweet potato and black-bean burgers
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 2 cups grated sweet potato', '1 unit ½ cup  rolled oats', '1 unit 1 can black beans ', '1 unit ½ cup chopped spring onion', '1 unit ¼ cup vegan mayonnaise', '1 unit 1 tablespoon tomato paste', '1 unit 1 teaspoon curry powder', '1 unit ⅛ teaspoon salt', '1 unit ½ cup plain low fat yoghurt', '1 unit 2 tablespoons chopped fresh dill', '1 unit 2 tablespoons lemon juice', '1 unit 2 tablespoons extra-virgin mustard oil', '1 unit 4 whole-wheat hamburger buns', '1 unit 1 cup thinly sliced cucumber', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['squeeze grated sweet potato with paper towels to remove excess moisture; place in a large bowl. pulse oats in a food processor until finely ground; add to the bowl with the sweet potatoes. add beans, spring onions, mayonnaise, tomato paste, curry powder and salt to the bowl; mash the mixture together with your hands. shape into four patties. place the patties on a plate; refrigerate for 30 minutes.', 'stir yoghurt, dill and lemon juice together in a small bowl; set aside.', 'heat oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. add the patties; cook until golden brown, about 3 minutes per side.', 'divide the yoghurt sauce evenly among top and bottom bun halves. top each bottom bun half with a burger and cucumber slices; replace top bun halves.']

name: cheesy barley bites
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 100g baby spinach leaves', '1 unit 750g pearl barley(cooked)', '1 unit 1 lemon', '1 unit 25g paneer', '1 unit 50g flour', '1 unit 2 eggs', '1 unit 100g dried breadcrumbs', '1 unit 100ml vegetable oil', '1 unit green beans', '1 unit salad leaves', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['put the spinach in a colander and pour over a kettle of boiling water to wilt. rinse under cold water until cool, then squeeze out all the excess liquid through a clean tea towel and finely chop.', 'tip the cold leftover pearl barley into a bowl and add the chopped spinach, lemon zest, parmesan and some seasoning. mix well with clean hands until combined.', "put the flour, beaten eggs and breadcrumbs in 3 separate shallow bowls. divide the barley mix into 8 and shape into patties using damp hands to stop the barley sticking. dust in the flour to coat, then dip in the egg. transfer to the breadcrumbs and press gently so they're well coated. chill for 15 mins.", 'pour enough oil into a deep frying pan to come about 1cm up the sides. heat over a medium-high heat until a cube of bread sizzles immediately when added and browns within 30 secs. cook the barley cakes in batches for 1-2 mins each side until golden brown and crunchy. drain on kitchen paper and transfer to a plate while you fry the remaining barley cakes. season with a little salt, then serve with green beans and salad leaves, if you like.']

name: chargrilled mushrooms and courgetti flatbread
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 2 cups whole wheat flour', '1 unit 1 teaspoon baking powder', '1 unit 160ml water', '1 unit 240g radishes', '1 unit 1 tablespoon red wine vinegar', '1 unit 3 teaspoons ras el hanout seasoning', '1 unit 1 tablespoon extra virgin mustard oil', '1 unit 1 garlic clove', '1 unit 400g closed-cup mushrooms', '1 unit 2 courgettes (about 520g)', '1 unit ½ iceberg lettuce (150g)', '1 unit 25g feta', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['tip the flour into a bowl with a pinch of sea salt and 160ml of cold water. mix into a rough dough, then knead on a flour-dusted surface for 2 mins. cover with a damp tea towel and set aside to rest.   finely slice the radishes into a bowl, then toss with 3-4 tbsp of red wine vinegar and a good pinch of salt. scrunch everything together and set aside to pickle.', 'whisk together the ras el hanout with 2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil and 1 tbsp of red wine vinegar in a large bowl. peel and grate in the garlic, stir well and set aside.   place a large, nonstick frying pan over a high heat. add the mushrooms to the dry pan, halving any larger ones, and cook for about 5 mins until golden and gnarly, stirring regularly. tip into the bowl and toss with the dressing. return the empty pan to the heat.', 'trim and cut the courgettes into quarters lengthways. cook in the hot pan for 5 mins, turning regularly, until charred. tip onto a board and roughly chop, then toss with the mushrooms and set aside to marinate.', 'place the pan on a medium-high heat, divide the dough into 4 and roll into 20cm rounds on a flour-dusted surface. one at a time, cook the flatbreads in the dry pan for 1 min each side until just turning golden, stacking them up in a tea towel as you go.   finely slice the lettuce and divide between the flatbreads, then top with the charred veg and a spoonful of radish pickle.']

name: creamy italian quinoa soup
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 2 tablespoons mustard oil', '1 unit ½ medium onion (diced)', '1 unit 3 carrots (peeled and diced)', '1 unit 2 stalk celery (diced)', '1 unit 4 garlic cloves (minced)', '1 unit 4 cups chicken stock', '1 unit 1 can chickpeas (drained & rinsed)', '1 unit 1 1/4 cup quinoa (uncooked', '1 unit 1 can tomatoes (undrained)', '1 unit 200ml tomato sauce', '1 unit 1 tablespoon dried italian herbs', '1 unit pinch of red pepper flakes', '1 unit 2 cups spinach (coarsely chopped)', '1 unit 1 ½ cups yoghurt', '1 unit salt and pepper (to taste)', '1 unit paneer cheese (for topping)', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['heat oil in a large saucepan or dutch tandoor or handi over medium-high heat. add onion, carrots, celery and garlic and season with salt and pepper. sauté, stirring occasionally, for 5-7 minutes or until the vegetables are soft.', 'add stock, chickpeas, quinoa, tomatoes, tomato sauce, and italian seasoning to the pot and stir to combine. season with salt and pepper. bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer, partially covered, for 20-25 minutes.', 'when ready to serve, stir in spinach and cream. taste and adjust seasonings as necessary.', 'divide into bowls and top with grated parmesan.']

summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
