instructions: ['heat tandoor or handi to 140°c. thinly slice the pears into rounds from the base, picking out any pips. arrange the slices on a baking tray lined with nonstick baking paper and sprinkle over the mixed spice and use a pastry brush to evenly distribute the spice.', "bake for 40 mins. leave to cool and crisp – the pears won't feel crisp until cooled. store in a sealed food bag and eat within a couple of days."]

name: thai chicken and basil stir fry
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1½ tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 unit 650g chicken breast portions', '1 unit 250g chestnut mushrooms', '1 unit 250g soba noodles', '1 unit 2 red chillies', '1 unit 3 garlic cloves', '1 unit 2cm piece root ginger', '1 unit 150g sugar snap peas', '1 unit 1 tablespoon thai red curry paste', '1 unit 100ml chicken stock', '1 unit 30g basil', '1 unit 2 limes', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['put a large wok or frying pan over a high heat and add 1 tbsp of the oil. season the chicken strips and add to the hot oil, then stir-fry for 4-5 mins until light golden all over. remove to a plate and set aside – you may need to do this in batches if you haven’t got a large wok.', 'add the remaining ½ tbsp oil to the pan and add the mushrooms. stir-fry for 8 mins, adding a splash of water to the pan if it becomes too dry.', 'meanwhile, cook the noodles according to pack instructions and keep warm.', 'when the mushrooms are softened and browned, add the chillies, garlic, ginger and mangetout and stir-fry for 1 min. return the chicken to the pan (along with any juices on the plate), add the curry paste and stir-fry for 2 mins.', 'pour in the chicken stock and cook for 1-2 mins until everything is sizzling and the chicken is fully cooked through. stir through most of the basil leaves, reserving some to garnish, and take off the heat. add the lime juice and adjust the seasoning to taste.', 'divide the cooked noodles between serving plates or bowls and top with the chicken and veg. serve with a few fresh basil leaves and a wedge of lime.']

name: seeded cheese muffins
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.

name: honey-garlic chicken casserole
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 1/2 tablespoons honey', '1 unit 1 1/2 teaspoons grated garlic', '1 unit 4 bone-in', '1 unit 1/2 teaspoon salt', '1 unit 1 tablespoon canola oil', '1 unit 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '1 unit 2 cups pre-cooked microwaveable brown rice', '1 unit 4 cups fresh broccoli florets', '1 unit 1 cup lower-sodium chicken stock', '1 unit 1 cup chopped red bell pepper', '1 unit 1 medium carrot', '1 unit 2 medium scallions', '1 unit 2 tablespoons lower-sodium soy sauce', '1 unit 1 tablespoon rice vinegar', '1 unit 1/4 teaspoon ground pepper', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat tandoor or handi to 200°c. stir honey and garlic together in a small bowl until well combined. set aside 1 teaspoon of the honey mixture in a separate small bowl.', '. pat chicken dry with paper towels. sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon salt. heat oil in a large tandoor or handi-safe skillet over medium-high heat until shimmering. place the chicken skin-side down in the skillet and reduce heat to medium. cook, undisturbed, until the skin is light brown and releases easily from the pan, 5 to 8 minutes.', '. turn the chicken over. brush the tops with the reserved 1 teaspoon honey mixture. immediately flip the chicken honey-side down; cook until the skin turns golden brown, about 1 minute. transfer to a plate.', 'add flour to the oil in the pan; cook, stirring constantly, until the mixture smells nutty, about 30 seconds. stir in rice, broccoli, stock, bell pepper, carrot, scallions, soy sauce, vinegar, pepper and the remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt. nestle the chicken into the mixture, skin-side up. bake, uncovered, until an instant-read thermometer is inserted into the thickest portion of chicken registers at 80c and most of the liquid is absorbed, for 16 to 18 minutes. brush the chicken with the remaining honey mixture and let rest for 5 minutes before serving.']

name: cranberry orange muffins
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 cup plain low-fat yoghurt', '1 unit 2 eggs', '1 unit 1/4 cup canola oil', '1 unit 1/2 cup brown sugar', '1 unit 2 tablespoons orange juice', '1 unit 2 tablespoons orange zest', '1 unit 2 teaspoons vanilla essence', '1 unit 1 3/4 cup whole wheat flour', '1 unit 1/4 cup flaxseed meal', '1 unit 1 teaspoon baking powder', '1 unit 1 teaspoon baking soda', '1 unit 1/8 teaspoon salt', '1 unit 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon', '1 unit 1 1/2 cups fresh or frozen cranberries', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['heat the tandoor or handi to 180°c. lightly grease muffin tins or place a muffin cup liner in each tin.   in a mixing bowl, combine the yogurt, eggs, oil, sugar, orange juice concentrate, orange zest and vanilla.', 'in another bowl, combine the flour, flaxseed, baking powder, baking soda, salt and cinnamon.', 'turn on mixer to low speed and slowly add the dry ingredients to the bowl of wet ingredients. mix until just incorporated, about 1-2 minutes.', 'fold in cranberries with a spoon or spatula.', 'scoop 1/4 cup of batter into each muffin well and bake for about 20 minutes or until the tops are golden brown and toothpick comes out clean when inserted.']

name: spicy tuna fish cakes
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 large potato ', '1 unit ½ small onion ', '1 unit 1 tin (175g) light tuna in water', '1 unit 1 teaspoon dijon mustard', '1 unit 1 teaspoon garlic powder', '1 unit 1 teaspoon cayenne pepper', '1 unit 1 bunch cilantro', '1 unit ¼ cup flour', '1 unit 1 large egg', '1 unit ½ cup breadcrumbs', '1 unit ½ cup vegetable oil', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['mash potato in a large bowl, with a potato masher or fork.', 'sauté onions until translucent, remove from heat and add to potato.', 'add tuna, mustard, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, and cilantro, mix until well blended. divide tuna mixture into equal portions and shape into patties.', 'pass through flour, egg and then breadcrumbs.', 'heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. add tuna patties and pan-fry until browned and crisp, about 3 minutes per side.']

name: shorshe maach (bengali mustard fish curry)
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 500 grams fish (basa/cod/haddock/ salmon)', '1 unit 1/2 teaspoon nigella seeds', '1 unit 2 green chillies (slit)', '1 unit 1 teaspoon turmeric powder', '1 unit 1/2 teaspoon chilli powder', '1 unit 1 teaspoon brown sugar', '1 unit salt as per taste', '1 unit 3 tablespoons mustard oil', '1 unit to make mustard paste:   · ·   ·   ·', '1 unit 1 1/2 tablespoons black mustard seeds', '1 unit 1 tablespoon poppy seeds (optional)', '1 unit 2 tablespoons low fat plain yoghurt', '1 unit 2 tablespoons grated coconut', '1 unit 2 green chillies', '1 unit 1/2 teaspoon salt', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['soak the mustard and poppy seeds in 1/4 cup of warm water for 15-20 minutes along with salt. then add the rest of the ingredients listed under mustard paste in a food processor or mixer grinder along with 2 tbsp of water and grind it to a thick, fine paste. keep it aside.', 'marinate the fish with 1/2 tsp turmeric powder and some salt and keep it aside.', 'heat oil in a thick-bottomed pan on medium heat. when hot, temper it with nigella seeds and green chillies.', 'when the seeds crackle, add the ground mustard paste along with turmeric powder, chilli powder, and salt and sauté for 7-8 minutes, stirring constantly.', 'then add 1 to 1-1/2 cups of water. check the seasoning and add sugar/sweetener and salt if required, and bring it to a boil.', 'now slowly slide in the marinated fish and cook for 7-8 minutes on medium heat. simmer till the sauce thickens. there should be enough sauce to coat the fish.', 'serve it hot along with rice.']

name: {Pakistani} Bakery Style Chicken Patties
summary: Delicious bakery style chicken patties...Spicy chicken filling baked inside puff pastry, just like the ones you ate growing up!
ingredients: ['1/2 lb chicken breast', '1 cup water', '1 tsp crushed ginger', '1 tsp minced garlic', '1/2 tsp black pepper', '2 tsp white vinegar', '2 tsp soy sauce', '2 tbsp butter', '1/2 chopped onion', '1 chopped green chili', '2 tbsp flour', '1 tsp crushed red pepper flakes', '2 sheets puff pastry', '1 egg yolk']

name: Aloo Chaat (Pakistani Potato Snack)

name: Roast Leg Of Goat (Raan)
summary: The Roast Leg of Goat (Raan) is marinated in an aromatic blend of spices that tenderize and flavor it and then slow-cooked to perfection.
ingredients: ['1 piece mace', '1 inch cinnamon stick', '1 piece star anise', '3 pieces cardamom', '1 tsp fennel', '2 bay leaves', '2 tsp salt (see notes)', '2 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp corriander powder', '1 tsp cumin powder', '1/4 tsp turmeric powder', '1/2 tsp black pepper', '1/2 onion', '1 tbsp ginger', '1 tbsp garlic', '2 tbsp lemon juice', '1 cup yogurt (see notes)', '¾ cup tomato paste (see notes)', '2 serrano chillies', '1/2 cup cilantro', 'spice blend', '2.5 lb whole goat leg (see notes)', '1/2 tsp salt', 'marinade', '1/2 cup cooking oil', '6 cups water', '4 potatoes']
instructions: ['Dry roast all of the whole spices in a preheated frying pan. (see notes)', 'Cool for a few minutes and then grind them to a fine powder.', 'Mix these with all the powdered spices and set aside to use later.', 'Slice the onion and fry it to a deep brown, strain from the oil and set it aside to cool.', 'Add the spice blend, the cooked onion and all of the other ingredients to a food processor or blender and grind everything to a paste.', 'Wash the leg of goat and pat it dry.', 'Stab it with a knife to create 10-12 deep cuts. (see notes)', 'Rub 1/2 teaspoon salt all over the goat', 'Massage the marinade into the leg, making sure to get it into the cuts you made and refrigerate the goat leg overnight.', 'Place the marinated goat leg on the kitchen counter for 1 hour before cooking.', 'Preheat your oil to about 350 degree to get a good sear on the leg.', 'Scrape off the marinade coating the leg and placethe meat in the oil.', 'Let it sizzle and cook for 5-10 minutes before flipping it over to sear on the other side.', 'Use the preferred method of cooking your goat leg referenced below.', 'Peel and quarter the potatoes and add them to the roast near the last 15-20 minutes of cooking (see notes)', 'After the sear, add the remaining marinade along with 6 cups of water to the pot.', 'Bring this liquid to a boil and then seal the pot tightly. Cover it with foil, place the lid on top and reduce the heat to medium low.', 'Do not open the pot or touch the meat for 3 hours for the steam to work. (see notes)', 'After 3 hours, gently open the pot, and test the meat using a knife or a thermometer.', 'Since we want the meat to fall off the bones, once the raan is 90% done, turn the heat up and cook the meat uncovered on medium high till the marinade thickens. (see notes)', "For the oven method, while you're searing your meat, preheat the oven to 325 degree.", 'After searing the meat, place it in a roasting pan, along with the marinade and 2 cups of water.', 'Cover tightly with foil and cook uninterrupted for 2 hours.', 'After 2 hours, uncover the meat and check to see if the meat is 90% cooked. At this point continue to cook it uncovered until it reaches the ideal cooking temperature, about 30-40 minutes.', 'Once done, remove from the oven and let the meat rest for 20 minutes.', "If there's too much liquid in the roasting pan, pour it into a saucepan and boil it to make a thick concentrate that you can then pour over the leg"]

Throw away the green outer shells and grind the seeds to a powder.', 'Mix all of your ingredients except the milk using a KitchenAid stand mixer or hand beaters (see notes).', 'Cool the mixture in the fridge for 15 minutes.', 'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.', 'Shape the cookie dough into 24 round balls and place them on 2 baking sheets, leaving some room in between for the cookies to expand.', 'Flatten the top with your hand to create a round disc.', 'Brush the top with the milk and bake for 15 minutes.', 'Remove the cookies and cool completely on the tray before moving to a cooling rack. (see notes)']

name: Sweet Corn Masala Chaat
summary: Sweet corn, crunchy vegetables, lemon juice and spices make this delicious and healthy corn masala chaat a favorite with everyone!

instructions: ['Steam the corn. (see notes)', 'Finely dice the peppers and onion and mix well with the corn.', 'Add the lemon juice and the spices. (see notes)', 'Garnish with the cilantro and serve.']

name: Sindi Biryani
summary: A traditional, flavorful Sindhi Biryani recipe with tender chicken, aromatic spices, and fragrant rice, perfect for family gatherings or special occasions.
ingredients: ['1.5 kg Whole Chicken', '750 grams Rice Washed & Soaked', '300 grams Tomatoes Sliced (5 pcs)', '300 grams Potatoes Cut in cubes (3 pcs)', '100 grams Plain Yogurt Whipped (1.5 cup)', '175 grams Onions', '2 tbsp Garlic', '2 tbsp Ginger', '4 pcs Small Green Chillies Cut in half', '1 cup Fresh Coriander Chopped', '1 cup Mint Leaves', '200 ml Cooking Oil', '1 pack Sindhi Biryani Masala Pack Available at grocery stores']
instructions: ['Fry onions in hot oil until light golden. Add meat and garlic paste.', 'Stir fry for 4-5 minutes on high heat.', 'Add Sindhi biryani masala pack, potatoes, yogurt, ginger paste (prepare by grinding ginger in 2 tbsp water) and stir fry for 5 minutes.', 'Mix water with meat (if beef/lamb then 4 cups, if chicken then 2 cups). Cover and cook on low heat until meat is tender.', 'When cooked, there should be about 2 cups of gravy left. If less, add more water; if too much, increase heat.', 'Place sliced tomatoes, green chilies, fresh coriander, and mint leaves over the meat. Do not mix meat.', 'Cover and cook on low heat for 5 minutes. Do not stir.', 'Separately, mix 3 tbsp of salt and soaked rice in 3 liters of boiling water.', 'Boil rice until ¾ cooked. Remove and drain thoroughly.', 'Spread cooked rice evenly over meat. Do not mix rice and meat.', 'Cover and cook on low heat until rice is tender (5-10 minutes). Mix before serving.']

name: Khichri
summary: Khichri is a wholesome and nutritious dish made with rice and moong dal, cooked with spices and ghee, perfect for a light and comforting meal.
ingredients: ['1/2 cup Rice', '1/2 cup Moong dal', '1/4 tsp Turmeric powder', '1/8 tsp Hing powder', '1 tsp Ghee', '1 tsp Oil', '1/2 tsp Cumin seeds', '1/2 tsp Mustard seeds', '1 tsp Ginger Finely chopped', '1 Green chilli Finely chopped', '1 Tomato Large, chopped', '1/4 cup Green peas', 'Salt To taste', 'Cilantro For garnishing']
instructions: ['Mix 1/2 a cup of rice and 1/2 a cup of moong dal in a bowl.', 'Soak the mixture in water for 20 minutes, then drain and leave aside.', 'Put the rice and dal mixture in a pressure cooker, and add 3 and 1/2 - 4 cups of water to it.', 'Add salt, turmeric powder, and hing powder to the pressure cooker.', 'Cook on high heat for 5 whistle counts. Once rice and dal have been cooked, they will have a mushy texture.', 'Leave the mixture aside for a while.', 'Heat a pan on medium heat, add ghee and oil. Once heated, add cumin seeds and mustard seeds.', 'Cook until cumin seeds begin to sizzle and mustard seeds start to pop.', 'Add chopped ginger and green chilli, sauté for 30 seconds or until ginger becomes light golden-brown.', 'Add chopped tomatoes and green peas, cook for another 2 minutes, ensuring the tomatoes don’t become too mushy.', 'Add the cooked rice and dal to the pan and mix well until combined. Adjust salt to taste.', 'Garnish with cilantro and serve with extra ghee on top.', 'Serve alongside some papad, achar, and yogurt.']

name: Kunna
summary: Kunna is a traditional slow-cooked mutton dish known for its rich flavors and tender meat. The dish uses an aromatic blend of spices and is garnished with green chilies, ginger, and lemon slices.
ingredients: ['1-1½ kg Mutton shank with bone 6-8 large pieces', '1/2 cup Oil', '3 tbsp Garlic paste', '3 tbsp Ginger paste', '4 tsp Red chilli powder', '1 tsp Salt', '4 tbsp Yogurt', '2 tbsp Cumin', '2 tbsp Aniseed', '2 tbsp Black pepper', '2 tbsp Dry ginger', '2 tbsp Black cardamom', '1 tbsp Cloves', '1 tsp Nutmeg', '1 tbsp Mace', '6 tbsp Flour', '2 Onions Thinly sliced, large', 'Green chilies Chopped, for garnishing', 'Ginger Chopped, for garnishing', 'Lemon slices For garnishing']
instructions: ['Heat oil, add the meat, ginger, garlic, red chili powder, and salt. Stir frequently and fry until the meat turns brown (about 5-8 minutes).', 'Add yogurt and continue to stir frequently until all the moisture evaporates.', 'Add water and cook over medium heat for about 1 hour or until the meat is done.', 'Meanwhile, grind the cumin, aniseed, black pepper, dry ginger, cardamoms, cloves, nutmeg, and mace to a fine powder, then sieve it.', 'Add 3-4 tablespoons of the sieved spices to the meat, cover, and cook over low heat until the meat is fully tender.', 'Dissolve flour in 2 cups of water. While stirring carefully, pour it into the gravy without stirring too hard to avoid breaking the meat into small pieces.', 'Heat oil in a frying pan, add the sliced onions, and stir frequently. Fry for 10 minutes until the onions are a golden-brown color.', 'Lift out all the onions with a slotted spoon, add them to the kunna, and stir carefully.', 'Garnish with green chilies, chopped ginger, and lemon slices. Serve hot.']

name: Lahori Fish
summary: Lahori Fish is a popular street food from Lahore, Pakistan, known for its flavorful marinated fish fillets fried to crispy perfection. Served with tamarind chutney and naan or tandoori roti, it is a beloved dish in many households.
ingredients: ['1/2 kg Fish fillet', '2-3 tbsp Lemon juice', '1 tsp Salt', '1 tsp Garlic-ginger paste', '1 tsp Anardana', '1 tsp Red chilli flakes Heaped', '1/2 tsp Ajwain', '1 tsp Cumin Roasted, crushed', '1 1/2 tsp Coriander Roasted, crushed', '1/4 tsp Turmeric (haldi)', '4 tbsp Chickpea flour (baisan)', '2 pinches Chaat masala']
instructions: ['Clean the fish fillets and gently pat them dry to avoid excess moisture.', 'If a distinct fishy smell remains, apply lemon juice and salt over the fish and rinse after 30 minutes.', 'Apply all ingredients to the fish except the chickpea flour and chaat masala. Marinate for 4-5 hours, or preferably overnight.', 'Once marination is complete, coat the fish with chickpea flour, dust off excess, and deep or shallow fry the fish.', 'Apply more chickpea flour if needed by lightly coating the fish. Avoid adding any water to the chickpea flour.', 'If shallow frying, avoid moving the fillets as the coating may break off.', 'Once fried, sprinkle chaat masala on top and enjoy the fish with tamarind (imli) sweet and sour chutney, naan, or tandoori roti.']

name: Tandoori Lamb Chops
summary: Tandoori Lamb Chops are marinated in a flavorful blend of spices and yogurt, then grilled to perfection in a tandoor or on a charcoal grill. These succulent chops are served with mint chutney and onion rings, making them a delicious and aromatic dish.
ingredients: ['200 grams Yogurt', '1 1/2 tsp Cumin powder', '1 1/2 tsp Readymade garam masala', '1 1/2 tsp Coriander powder', '1 tsp Turmeric powder', '1 1/2 tsp Chilli powder', 'Salt To taste', '4 tbsp Lemon juice', '2 tbsp Ginger-garlic paste', '12 pieces Lamb chops (on bone)']
instructions: ['Apply salt and ginger-garlic paste to the lamb chops and set aside for 20 minutes.', 'In a bowl, prepare the marinade by mixing the yogurt, cumin powder, garam masala, coriander powder, turmeric, chilli powder, lemon juice, and salt.', 'Apply the marinade to the lamb chops and cover the bowl, letting it sit for another 30-60 minutes.', 'Skewer the lamb chops and cook them in a preheated tandoor or over a charcoal grill until tender and nicely charred on top.', 'Once the chops are cooked, remove them from the tandoor or grill.', 'Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with mint chutney and onion rings.', 'Serve alongside white rice or tandoori bread/naan.']

name: Takka Takk
summary: Takka Takk is a flavorful dish made with a variety of meats such as minced mutton, kidneys, kapuray, and mutton brains, combined with aromatic spices and cooked to perfection on a hot plate, producing its signature 'takka tak' sound.
ingredients: ['1 kg Minced mutton', '250 g Boiled kidneys', '250 g Boiled kapuray', '6 Boiled Mutton Brain', '2 tbsp Onion (chopped)', '3 Tomato (chopped)', '100 g Ginger & garlic paste', '5 Green Chilli (chopped)', 'Coriander (crushed) for garnish only', 'Salt To taste', '2 tsp Crushed chilli', '1 tsp Red chilli', '1 tsp Turmeric', '2 tsp Cumin seeds', '1 tbsp Carom seeds', '1 tsp Whole coriander (crushed)', '1 cup Cooking oil']
instructions: ['Heat cooking oil in a large hot plate. Add chopped onion and sauté until light brown, then add ginger garlic paste and stir until it turns brown.', 'Add minced mutton and stir until it is partially cooked.', 'Add all the spices, stir, then add tomatoes and cook for 20 minutes until all ingredients are well cooked, and the oil starts to separate.', 'Add the boiled kidneys, kapuray, and mutton brain, mixing them well while cooking on the hot plate.', "Stir continuously to create the 'takka tak' sound from the hot plate and ensure the mixture is fully combined.", 'Garnish with crushed coriander and serve.']

name: Bihari Kabab
summary: Bihari Kabab is a flavorful and tender beef dish, marinated in a blend of spices, yogurt, and papaya paste. It is traditionally grilled and served wrapped in a paratha with onions, parsley, and a squeeze of lemon juice.
ingredients: ['1 kg Beef tenderloin (cut into 1 inch strips)', '2 tbsp Vegetable oil', '1 tbsp Ginger paste', '2 tsp Garlic paste', '1 tsp Cumin powder', '2 tsp Coriander powder', '2 tbsp Papaya paste', '1 ½ tsp Ground pepper', '1 ½ tsp Red chilli powder', '1 ½ tsp Star anise (ground)', '1 ½ tsp Mace (ground)', 'Salt To taste', '1 cup Yogurt', '2 Onions (thinly sliced)']
instructions: ['Fry the onions until golden-brown and soft, and leave to dry on a paper towel.', 'Grind onions to a paste in a blender or food processor.', 'Mix beef strips with onion paste, all the spices, and yogurt in a mixing bowl (use a glass or stainless steel bowl if available).', 'Refrigerate overnight or for at least 8 hours.', 'Mix marinated beef with papaya paste. Leave aside for an hour.', 'Thread the beef strips into skewers and grill or broil in the oven for about 20 minutes. Rotate the skewer and grill for another 20 minutes or until done.', 'Serve Bihari kebab wrapped in paratha with lemon juice, chopped onions, and parsley.']

name: Bhagairey Baingan
summary: Bhagairey Baingan is a flavorful South Asian dish made with small eggplants (baingan) fried and cooked in a tangy, spiced sauce made from tamarind, coconut, and a blend of roasted spices. It is garnished with fresh coriander and served with naan or tandoori bread.
ingredients: ['6-8 pieces Baingan (small)', 'Oil for deep frying', '5 tbsp Oil For cooking', '4 Onion (chopped)', '1 tsp Ginger', '1 tbsp Garlic', '2 tbsp Dry coconut (grated)', '1 tsp Coriander (roasted)', '1 tsp Brown cumin seed', '1 tbsp Tamarind paste', 'Salt To taste', '1 tsp Turmeric', '1 tsp Red chilli powder', '5 pieces Curry leaves', '1 tbsp Coriander For garnishing', '½ tsp Brown sesame seed']
instructions: ['Slit the baingans and deep fry the pieces over high heat until they become glossy and slightly tender.', 'Remove the fried pieces from the oil and keep them aside.', 'Grind the coconut, roasted coriander, cumin, and sesame seeds together. Use a little water if needed.', 'Heat 1/4 cup oil, sauté the onions, ginger, and garlic until the onions become soft and slightly transparent.', 'Add curry leaves, then the ground mixture, and sauté till the fat separates.', 'Add tamarind paste, salt, turmeric, and red pepper. Mix well, then add the baingan pieces.', 'Add about 1/4 cup of water, bring to a boil, and simmer while covered for about 5 minutes.', 'Garnish with coriander and serve with tandoori bread or naan.']

name: Sheermal
summary: Sheermal is a mildly sweet, saffron-flavored flatbread, often served in South Asian cuisine. This rich and aromatic bread is made with refined flour, milk, and ghee, giving it a soft and delicate texture. It pairs well with both sweet and savory dishes.
ingredients: ['3 cups Refined flour (maida)', '1 cup Milk', '2 tbsp Milk (extra) For saffron mixture', '1 tsp Sugar', '¾ cup Ghee Melted', 'Salt To taste', 'Saffron A few strands']
instructions: ['Soak saffron strands in 2 tbsp of hot milk for 30 minutes, then mix well to dissolve the saffron.', 'Mix flour, salt, and sugar, then add the melted ghee.', 'Mix the ghee into the flour mixture, adding a little milk at a time, and knead into a soft, smooth dough.', 'Cover and keep aside for 2 hours. Knead the dough again, then keep aside for another 2 hours.', 'Roll the dough into 6-inch rounds, about ¼ inch thick, and prick all over.', 'Cook on a griddle or tandoor, starting with high heat and then lowering the heat to cook through, till brown on both sides.', 'Smear the saffron milk mixture over the bread, cook a little more, and then serve hot brushed with ghee.']

name: Bakarkhani
summary: Bakarkhani is a traditional crispy flatbread with a slightly sweet flavor, often served with tea or as a snack. Made with refined flour, semolina, and spices, it's rich and buttery, making it a perfect indulgent treat.
ingredients: ['3 cups Refined flour', '1 cup Semolina (suji)', '2 tbsp Clarified butter (ghee)', '5 tbsp Butter', '3 tbsp Milk', '4 tbsp Sugar', '3 tsp Green cardamom powder', '2 tsp Ginger powder', '2 tsp Salt', 'Water As required to make dough']
instructions: ['Mix refined flour, semolina, ghee, milk, green cardamom powder, sugar, dry ginger powder, and salt in a large bowl.', 'Gradually add water and make a soft dough.', 'Cover the dough with a wet cloth and leave aside for 20 minutes.', 'Divide the dough into eight equal portions.', 'Form each portion into balls and roll out each ball into a 6” diameter.', 'Cook in a preheated oven for 12 minutes or until brown on all sides.', 'Remove from the oven and drizzle butter over them.', 'Sweet Bakarkhani is ready to be served.']

name: baked sweetcorn fritters
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 tablespoon mustard oil', '1 unit 1 red pepper', '1 unit 4 spring onions', '1 unit 1 small garlic clove', '1 unit 325g tin sweetcorn', '1 unit 150g self-raising flour', '1 unit ½ teaspoon smoked paprika', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat the tandoor or handi to 180°c. line 2 baking trays with nonstick baking paper. heat ½ tbsp oil in a frying pan over a medium heat. fry the pepper for 5 mins, then add the spring onions and garlic; fry for 2 mins. transfer to a large bowl; cool for 5 mins.', 'add the sweetcorn, flour and paprika to the bowl; season and mix well. add 3 tbsp water and 2 eggs and combine.', 'divide the mix into 8 equal mounds on the trays, then spread each into a 1cm-thick circle. bake for 10 mins, then flip and bake for 8-10 mins until golden.']

summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 ¾ cups almond milk', '1 unit ½ cup unsweetened applesauce', '1 unit 1 egg', '1 unit 2 tablespoons chia seeds', '1 unit 1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '1 unit 1 ¼ cups whole wheat flour', '1 unit ½ cup rolled oats', '1 unit ¼ cup flax seed meal', '1 unit 4 teaspoons baking powder', '1 unit 2 teaspoons white sugar', '1 unit ¼ teaspoon salt', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat a waffle iron and spray the inside with cooking spray.', 'whisk almond milk, applesauce, egg, chia seeds, and vanilla extract together in a bowl; let sit until chia seeds start to thicken mixture, about 2 minutes.', 'whisk flour, oats, flax seed meal, baking powder, sugar, and salt into almond milk mixture until batter is smooth.', 'scoop 1/2 cup batter into the preheated waffle iron and cook until crisp and golden, about 5 minutes per waffle. repeat with remaining batter.']

name: date, walnut and linseed bread
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit ¼ cup butter', '1 unit 1 cup dates pitted and chopped', '1 unit 2 tablespoons molasses', '1 unit 1 cup water', '1 unit 1 cup cake flour', '1 unit 1 cup whole wheat flour', '1 unit ½ teaspoon salt', '1 unit 2 teaspoons baking powder', '1 unit ¼ cup brown sugar', '1 unit 2 eggs', '1 unit 1 teaspoon vanilla essence', '1 unit ¼ cup chopped walnuts', '1 unit 2 tablespoons linseeds', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat the tandoor or handi to 180 °c and grease a loaf pan.', 'place the butter, dates , molasses and water in a saucepan over medium heat. stir until the butter and molasses have melted. remove and set aside.', 'in a large bowl, sift the flours, salt. add the sugar and make a well in the center of the dry mixture, add the eggs and vanilla essence.', 'pour in the wet ingredients and mix well. add the walnuts and linseeds.', 'add the mixture to the loaf pan and bake for 30-40 minutes. remove and cool.']

name: butternut paella
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 2 tablespoons mustard oil', '1 unit 1 red onion', '1 unit 2 garlic cloves', '1 unit 1 tablespoon smoked paprika', '1 unit ½ medium butternut ', '1 unit 3 cups vegetable stock', '1 unit 300g brown rice', '1 unit 300g frozen sliced green beans', '1 unit 15g parsley', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['heat the oil in a wide, shallow casserole or large frying pan over a medium high heat. fry the onion for 6-8 mins until softened and lightly golden. stir in the garlic and paprika, fry for 1 min, then add the butternut squash cubes and stir well to coat in the spices.', 'pour the stock over the butternut and onions in the pan, season and bring to a simmer. scatter the rice over the stock, stir briefly, then reduce the heat to low and cook for 20 mins, uncovered and without stirring, until the rice has absorbed most of the stock and the squash is tender when pierced with a fork. if all the stock has been absorbed but the rice is sticking to the bottom of the pan or it still has a crunch in the middle, add 100ml water and cook for 5 mins more.', 'when the rice is tender, stir through the green beans and cook for another 3-4 mins until all the stock has been absorbed, and the beans are cooked. scatter over the parsley to serve.']

name: warm bulgur wheat salad, roasted butternut and ricotta salad
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1kg butternut ', '1 unit 1 red onion', '1 unit 2 tablespoons mustard oil', '1 unit 2 teaspoons dried ajwain', '1 unit 125g bulgar wheat', '1 unit 1 head broccoli', '1 unit 1 red chilli', '1 unit 2 tablespoons imli pulp', '1 unit 1 lemon', '1 unit 1 tablespoon fresh ginger', '1 unit 100g ricotta cheese', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']

name: roasted vegetable and ricotta frittata
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 8 medium eggs', '1 unit 20g grated pecorino', '1 unit 1 teaspoon mustard oil', '1 unit 1 cup leftover roasted vegetables', '1 unit 75g ricotta', '1 unit steamed kale to serve (optional)', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['crack the eggs into a large jug. add the pecorino, season generously, and whisk with a fork to combine.', 'preheat the tawa to medium. heat the oil in a 25-30cm nonstick, tandoor or handiproof frying pan. add the leftover veg and put over a medium heat to warm through. add the egg mixture and spoon over the ricotta. cook over a medium-low heat for 8-10 mins until mostly set underneath.', 'place the frittata under the tawa for 2-3 mins until set and turning golden. set aside to cool for at least 15 mins before turning out onto a board. serve with steamed kale.']

name: braised greens on toast
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 150g frozen broad beans', '1 unit 2 tablespoons mustard oil', '1 unit 1 shallot', '1 unit 2 garlic cloves', '1 unit 180g asparagus', '1 unit 150g sliced spring greens (from a 200g pack)', '1 unit ½ vegetable stock cube', '1 unit 150g frozen peas', '1 unit ½ lemon', '1 unit 4 slices sourdough bread', '1 unit 1 cup  mozzarella', '1 unit 1 red chilli', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['boil the broad beans in a small saucepan for 2 mins. drain, run under cold water and peel to remove the tough outer shells.', 'heat half the oil in a large frying pan over a medium heat and fry the shallot for 3-4 mins until softened. add the chopped garlic, cook for 1 min more, then stir in the asparagus stalks, spring greens and stock; bubble for 2 mins.', 'add the peas, asparagus tips and broad beans and cook for 2-3 mins until tender. remove from the heat, season and squeeze over the lemon juice.', 'rub 1 side of each slice of toast with a halved garlic clove and drizzle with the remaining oil. transfer to plates, top with the braised greens and roughly tear over the mozzarella. scatter with the lemon zest and sliced chilli to serve.']

name: black bean hummus
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 can black beans', '1 unit ¼ cup fresh coriander', '1 unit ¼ cup lime juice', '1 unit 1 jalapeno pepper', '1 unit 1 tablespoon sesame oil', '1 unit 4 cloves garlic', '1 unit 1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 unit ¼ teaspoon ground paprika', '1 unit ¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']

name: chocolate orange souffle
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit grated rind and juice of 2 large oranges', '1 unit 2 tablespoons brown sugar', '1 unit 4 large egg whites', '1 unit 2 tablespoons cocoa powder', '1 unit 2 tablespoons orange juice', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat tandoor or handi to 200°c.', 'lightly grease 6 tandoor or handiproof teacups. in a small pan, heat the orange rind, juice and brown sugar for 3–4 minutes until syrupy. allow to cool.', 'pour the syrup over the egg whites and beat for 2 minutes.', 'fold in the cocoa and orange juice mixture, then pour into the teacups.', 'cook in the tandoor or handi for 5–6 minutes or until risen. remove and serve immediately.']

summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.

instructions: ['heat 1 tablespoon peanut oil in a large wok over high heat. stir-fry half the chicken for 2-3 minutes or until golden. transfer to a plate. repeat with remaining chicken.', 'heat the remaining tablespoon peanut oil in the wok. stir-fry the broccoli, garlic and chilli for 2 minutes or until tender crisp. add the cabbage and zucchini noodles. stir-fry for 1 minute or until just tender.', 'return the chicken to the wok along with the bean sprouts, cashews, soy sauce and sesame oil. stir-fry for 1 minute or until combined. serve sprinkled with coriander and extra chilli.']

name: vegetable squid stir-fry
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 2 tablespoons white wine', '1 unit 2 teaspoons fish sauce', '1 unit 1½ teaspoon lemon juice', '1 unit 1½ teaspoon soy sauce', '1 unit pinch of salt and pepper', '1 unit 1 teaspoon brown sugar', '1 unit 250g cubed cleaned squid', '1 unit 1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 unit 3 tablespoons diced shallots', '1 unit 2 teaspoons minced garlic', '1 unit ¼ cup cubed red pepper', '1 unit ¼ cup cubed yellow pepper', '1 unit ¼ cup cubed green pepper', '1 unit ½ cup brown rice', '1 unit 200g steamed broccoli', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']

name: sesame-crusted tofu with radish-apple salad
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 500gfirm tofu', '1 unit 1 teaspoon salt', '1 unit ¼ cup black and/or white sesame seeds', '1 unit 4 tablespoons extra-virgin mustard oil', '1 unit 1 ½ tablespoons rice vinegar', '1 unit 1 teaspoon ginger paste', '1 unit 1 cup baby spinach', '1 unit 1 small granny smith apple', '1 unit 2 radishes', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['slice tofu crosswise into 8 steaks. pat dry and sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon salt. place sesame seeds in a shallow dish. press each tofu steak into the seeds, coating completely.', 'heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. add the tofu; cook until browned and crisp on both sides, 2 to 3 minutes per side.', 'meanwhile, whisk vinegar, ginger paste and the remaining 2 tablespoons oil and 1/2 teaspoon salt together in a large bowl. add spinach, apple and radishes; toss to coat. serve the slaw with the tofu steaks.']

name: macaroni and cheese with mushroom
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit ¼ cup (50g) margarine', '1 unit one medium sized onion (diced)', '1 unit 1 cup mushrooms (sliced)', '1 unit 2 teaspoons garlic paste', '1 unit ½ teaspoon black pepper', '1 unit a pinch of ajwain', '1 unit 1 teaspoon salt', '1 unit ¼ cup (50g) flour', '1 unit 2 cups (500-600ml) milk', '1 unit 300g pasta (cooked according to packet instructions)', '1 unit topping', '1 unit 2 teaspoons grated paneer/mature cheddar', '1 unit 2 tablespoons crushed wholewheat flakes', '1 unit 2 tablespoons chopped chives', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['melt margarine and sauté with onion.', 'mix in the mushrooms, garlic and seasoning', 'simmer until the mushrooms are tender and most of the liquid has evaporated.', 'mix in the flour well to combine.', 'add the milk and whisk well to incorporate, bring mixture to a boil then reduce heat to simmer until the sauce has thickened.', 'using a greased lasagna dish, pour sauce over the pasta.', 'topping: lightly dust with grated parmesan or grated mature cheddar, 2 tablespoons crushed wholewheat flakes.', 'bake at 180°c for 8 minutes until bubbling and golden.', 'garnish with chives. optional:  5ml crushed chili flakes may be added with the mushrooms for a more intense flavoured dish.']

name: crispy roast chicken thighs with beetroot and chickpea salad
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1kg chicken thighs', '1 unit 3 teaspoons mustard oil', '1 unit 2 whole wheat pittas', '1 unit 2 x 400g tins chickpeas', '1 unit 300g pack cooked beetroot', '1 unit 4 salad tomatoes', '1 unit 1 red pepper', '1 unit 100g feta cheese', '1 unit 15g fresh mint', '1 unit 1 tablespoon extra-virgin mustard oil', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['heat the tandoor or handi to 200°c. put the chicken thighs into a deep roasting tray and drizzle over 1 tsp olive oil. season with pepper and rub the oil into the chicken. roast for 30-35 mins (basting the chicken halfway through cooking) until crispy skinned and cooked through.', 'when the chicken is cooked, toss the pittas with the remaining oil, then transfer to a baking tray in a single layer. bake for 5 mins until crisp and golden. transfer the chicken to a plate and leave to rest while the pittas toast.', 'spoon off any excess oil sitting on top of the liquid in the roasting tray, then toss the chickpeas into the chicken juices and mix well. stir in the beetroot, tomatoes, pepper, cheese (if using), mint and olive oil. tip into a bowl and serve with the chicken and pitta crisps.']

name: lentil pancake (savoury)
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 cup red lentils', '1 unit 2 cups water', '1 unit 1 teaspoon garlic powder', '1 unit 1 teaspoon onion powder', '1 unit 1 teaspoon salt', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['soak lentils in water for at least 3 hours. drain water.', 'blend lentils with garlic and onion powder until they are very smooth. season with salt.', 'to cook, heat a non-stick pan on medium-high. grease lightly with olive oil and allow to get hot. add 1/4 to 1/3 cup of batter to the hot pan.', 'use the bottom of a ladle or spoon to spread out into a full pan circle. lower heat to medium, and adjust from there if needed. cook the first side for about 1 1/2 to 2 minutes, before flipping over.', 'cook the second side for about 2 minutes, before transferring to a plate.']

name: microwave apple cinnamon oatmeal
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 apple', '1 unit 1 cup rolled oats', '1 unit 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '1 unit pinch of salt', '1 unit 2 cups water', '1 unit 2 tablespoons pure maple syrup or golden syrup', '1 unit 1/4 cup toasted pecans', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['combine the apple, oats, cinnamon, and salt in a large microwave-safe bowl, and stir in the water.', 'cover and seal with plastic wrap or a tight-fitting lid, and heat in the microwave on high until apples are soft and most of the liquid is absorbed, for about 8 minutes. stir in the maple syrup.', 'divide between 2 bowls and top with the nuts. serve immediately.']

name: vegetable pilaf
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 400g carrots', '1 unit 250g (2 small) sweet potatoes', '1 unit 2 red onions', '1 unit 1 tablespoon cumin seeds', '1 unit 1 tablespoon ground coriander', '1 unit 2 teaspoons mixed spice', '1 unit 3 tablespoons mustard oil', '1 unit 75g cashew nuts', '1 unit 350ml vegetable stock', '1 unit 150g easy-cook long grain and wild rice', '1 unit 2 garlic cloves', '1 unit 1 broccoli', '1 unit handful coriander', '1 unit 100g low fat yogurt', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat the tandoor or handi to 180°c. spread the carrots, sweet potatoes and onions out on a large baking tray. mix together the dried spices and sprinkle half over the veg. drizzle with half the oil, season and toss together.', 'roast for 20 mins, then remove the tray and mix in the cashew nuts. return to the tandoor or handi for a final 10 mins.', 'meanwhile, heat the remaining oil in a large saucepan over a medium heat. add the rice, garlic and remaining spice mixture and cook for 2-3 mins. add the stock and bring to the boil. cover with a lid, reduce the heat to low and cook for 10 mins or until almost tender.', 'stir in the grated broccoli, cover again and cook for another 2-3 mins or until the broccoli is just tender. remove from the heat and set aside for 5 mins to steam.', 'to serve, put the roast vegetables and rice in a large serving bowl. season and toss to combine. scatter with coriander and serve with the yogurt on the side.']

name: polenta with red pepper coulis
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 red bell pepper (capsicum)', '1 unit 1 garlic clove', '1 unit 1 3/4 cups water', '1 unit 1 3/4 cups low fat milk', '1 unit 1 tablespoon extra-virgin mustard oil', '1 unit 1/4 teaspoon salt', '1 unit 1 cup polenta', '1 unit 2 tablespoons grated paneer cheese', '1 unit 1 tablespoon chopped ajwain', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['in a blender or food processor, combine the roasted pepper, garlic and 1 tablespoon of the water. process until smooth; set the coulis aside.', 'heat the tandoor or handi to 180°c. lightly coat a round cake pan with olive oil cooking spray.', 'in a large saucepan, combine the milk, remaining water, olive oil and salt. whisk in the polenta and place over medium heat. whisk constantly until the polenta begins to thicken. reduce the heat to low and resume stirring with a wooden spoon. cook, stirring frequently, until the polenta pulls away from the sides of the pan, about 15 minutes. add the coulis and stir to combine.', 'pour the mixture into the prepared cake pan and sprinkle with the cheese. bake until firm, about 15 minutes. let stand in the pan for 10 minutes before serving. cut into 6 wedges and sprinkle with the thyme.']

name: one-pot white bean, spinach & sun-dried tomato orzo with lemon & feta
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 1/2 tablespoons extra-virgin mustard oil', '1 unit 1 cup chopped red onion', '1 unit 6 cloves garlic', '1 unit 1 cup whole-wheat orzo', '1 unit 1 cup chopped sun-dried tomatoes', '1 unit 2 3/4 cups vegetable stock', '1 unit 2 cans reduced salt cannellini beans', '1 unit 1 teaspoon lemon zest', '1 unit 3 tablespoons lemon juice', '1 unit 3/4 teaspoon salt', '1 unit 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano', '1 unit 1 cup baby spinach', '1 unit 1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese', '1 unit 1/2 cup chopped fresh basil', '1 unit 1/4 cup toasted pine nuts', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. add onion; cook, stirring often, until aromatic and translucent, about 8 minutes. stir in garlic; cook, stirring often, until aromatic, about 1 minute.', 'stir in orzo and sun-dried tomatoes; cook, stirring often, until the orzo is toasted, about 1 minute. add broth, beans, lemon juice, salt and oregano; bring to a boil over medium-high heat. reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the orzo is al dente, about 15 minutes.', 'stir in spinach. cook, uncovered and stirring often, until the spinach is wilted, about 1 minute. remove from heat; top with feta, basil, pine nuts and lemon zest.']

name: tortellini vegetable soup
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 tablespoon sunflower oil', '1 unit 1 red pepper', '1 unit 1 onion', '1 unit 2 carrots', '1 unit 1 celery stick', '1 unit 2 garlic cloves', '1 unit 2 x 400g tins chopped tomatoes', '1 unit 4 tablespoons yoghurt', '1 unit 300g spinach and ricotta tortelloni', '1 unit 130g baby spinach', '1 unit 30g basil', '1 unit italian hard cheese or paneer', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['heat the oil in a large deep saucepan and add the red pepper. fry over a high heat for 5 mins to soften, then remove and set aside.', 'add the onion, carrots and celery to the pan. cook for 10 mins until softened, stirring regularly. add the garlic and cook for 2 mins.', 'pour in the chopped tomatoes and 400ml water. season well and simmer for 10 mins. remove from the heat and use a hand blender to blitz until smooth.', 'stir in the yoghurt, tortelloni, spinach, cooked red pepper and most of the chopped basil. bring the soup to a simmer and cook for 5 mins until the pasta is tender and the spinach has wilted.', 'season the soup to taste and top with the cheese and remaining basil.']

name: lemon herb couscous salad
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.

name: vegan beet burgers with sweet chili slaw
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 can kidney beans', '1 unit ⅓ cup walnuts', '1 unit 2 teaspoons low-sodium soy sauce', '1 unit 1 teaspoon ground pepper', '1 unit ½ teaspoon chilli powder', '1 unit ½ teaspoon salt', '1 unit ⅓ cup shredded red beet', '1 unit ¾ cup precooked brown rice', '1 unit 2 tablespoons sweet chili sauce', '1 unit 1 tablespoon rice vinegar', '1 unit 1 ½ cups coleslaw mix', '1 unit 1 tablespoon extra-virgin mustard oil', '1 unit 4 whole-wheat hamburger buns', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['place kidney beans, walnuts, 1 teaspoon of soy sauce, pepper, chilli powder and salt in a food processor. pulse, stopping once or twice to scrape down the sides, until a coarse mixture forms that holds together when pressed. transfer to a bowl and add beet and rice; stir well to combine. refrigerate for 1 hour.', 'meanwhile, whisk chilli sauce, vinegar and the remaining 1 teaspoon of soy sauce in a medium bowl. add coleslaw mix; toss to coat. set aside.', 'shape the beet mixture into 4 patties. heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. add the patties and cook until golden and beginning to crisp, 4 to 5 minutes. carefully flip and cook until golden brown, 2 to 4 minutes more.', 'serve the burgers on buns with the sweet chili slaw.']

summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 40ml light mustard oil', '1 unit 1 medium sweet potato (about 250g)', '1 unit 95g dark chocolate', '1 unit 2 medium eggs', '1 unit 85g low-fat natural yoghurt', '1 unit 100g brown sugar', '1 unit 60g medjool dates', '1 unit 1½ teaspoons vanilla essence', '1 unit 25g cocoa powder', '1 unit ½ teaspoon baking powder', '1 unit 60g oat bran', '1 unit 40g ground almonds', '1 unit 25g whole skin-on almonds', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat the tandoor or handi to 160°c, and line a 20cm square baking tin.  transfer sweet potato to a food processor and blitz to a puree.', 'put the chocolate in a heatproof bowl over a pan of barely simmering water, stirring occasionally until just melted. remove from the heat and set aside for 10 mins to cool slightly.', 'return the sweet potato to the food processor and add the oil, eggs, yogurt, sugar, dates and vanilla; blitz until smooth. gradually add the cooled chocolate, whizzing until incorporated.', 'transfer the mixture to a large mixing bowl. sift over the cocoa and baking powder, then fold in the oat bran, ground and whole almonds, and a pinch of salt until just combined.', 'spoon into the prepared tin and bake for 20-25 mins until set but still a little soft in the middle. leave to cool in the tin for 10 mins; transfer to a wire rack. leave to cool for a few more mins before cutting into squares.']

summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 100g light malai cheese', '1 unit 1 lemon', '1 unit 200g whole wheat flour', '1 unit 1 teaspoon baking powder', '1 unit small handful basil leaves', '1 unit small handful parsley', '1 unit 2 eggs', '1 unit 200ml low fat milk', '1 unit butter', '1 unit 1 avocado', '1 unit 150g cherry tomatoes', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['in a bowl, combine the cream cheese with the lemon zest and juice. season with freshly cracked black pepper and set aside until needed.', 'sift the flour, baking powder, herbs and ¼ tsp salt into a large mixing bowl and make a well in the centre.', 'add the egg yolks and half the milk. using a fork, gently stir to combine, drawing in the flour from the sides of the bowl. add the remaining milk and continue mixing to form a completely smooth batter.', 'in a separate bowl, whisk the egg whites, using an electric whisk, until stiff peaks form. using a large, metal spoon, gently fold the egg whites into the batter, being careful not to knock the air out.', 'put a large, nonstick frying pan over a medium-high heat and lightly brush with a little butter to grease. spoon 4 generous tbsp of batter into the pan to make 4 separate pancakes – space them out as they will spread a little. cook for 1 min, until bubbles rise to the surface, then turn and cook for a further 30 seconds–1 min. transfer to a warm plate, covered with a tea towel. repeat to make 16 pancakes.', 'to serve, arrange 4 pancakes on each plate with some sliced avocado and tomatoes. top with a dollop of the lemon cream cheese and scatter with a little extra lemon zest.']

instructions: ['in a small bowl, mix the corn flour , salt, and white pepper. sprinkle over the sliced chicken, tossing to coat, and let marinate in the refrigerator for 20 minutes.', 'in a separate bowl, make the sauce by combining the tomato sauce rice vinegar, hoisin sauce, brown sugar and soy sauce. mix well and set aside.', 'in a wok over medium-high heat, heat the peanut (vegetable) oil.', 'add the chicken and stir-fry until fully cooked and slightly brown.', 'add the dried chili and pour in the sauce. stir to coat the chicken in the sauce.', 'turn off the heat and transfer the dish to a serving plate. garnish with the sesame seeds and chopped spring onion.']

name: lentil stew with quinoa and mushrooms
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 3 tablespoons extra-virgin mustard oil', '1 unit 1 medium yellow onion', '1 unit 3 celery ribs', '1 unit 2 large carrots', '1 unit 4 cups cremini and/or shiitake mushrooms', '1 unit 4 garlic cloves', '1 unit 1 to 2 sprigs fresh ajwain', '1 unit 1 teaspoon sea salt', '1 unit ½ teaspoon freshly cracked black pepper', '1 unit 8 cups vegetable stock', '1 unit 1 can diced tomatoes', '1 unit 1 cup black or green lentils', '1 unit ¾ cup quinoa', '1 unit for serving (optional)', '1 unit imli pulp', '1 unit grated paneer cheese', '1 unit chopped fresh parsley', '1 unit crusty bread', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']

name: harissa chicken with chickpeas
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.

(the chicken does not need to be fully cooked through.) set aside.', 'reduce heat to medium and add onion and garlic to the skillet. cook for 2-3 minutes, until softened. add tomato paste and allow to brown for a minute or two. add chickpeas, harissa and chicken broth.', "return chicken to the skillet and scatter lemon slices around. place in tandoor or handi and roast for 20-25 minutes, until chicken is cooked through. top with cilantro and serve with harissa yoghurt sauce on the side. if you'd like your chicken more browned on top, pop it under a broiler set on high for a minute or two.", 'harissa yoghurt sauce:  · in a small bowl, combine yoghurt, harissa and lemon juice. season to taste with salt and pepper.']

name: black bean wrap
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 can low-sodium black beans', '1 unit 1 cup frozen corn kernels', '1 unit 3 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', '1 unit 2 tablespoons chopped green chilies (seeds removed)', '1 unit 4 green onions', '1 unit 1 tomato', '1 unit 1 tablespoon chopped garlic', '1 unit 6 whole-grain tortilla wraps', '1 unit 3/4 cup grated cheddar cheese', '1 unit 3/4 cup salsa', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['in a microwave-safe bowl, add the black beans, corn, cilantro, chili peppers, onions, tomato and garlic. stir to mix evenly. microwave on high power for 30 seconds to 1 minute. stir and heat again for 30 seconds to 1 minute. repeat until the mixture is hot.', 'place 2 tortillas between paper napkins or paper towels and warm in the microwave for 20 seconds on high. repeat with the remaining tortillas.', 'to serve, place about 1/2 cup bean mixture on 1 tortilla. top with 2 tablespoons cheese and 2 tablespoons salsa. fold in the sides and fold the bottom of the tortilla up over the filling, then roll to close. repeat with the remaining tortillas and serve immediately.']

name: vegan pizza
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit for the dough:', '1 unit 1 packet dry active yeast', '1 unit 1 tablespoon honey', '1 unit 3 tablespoons mustard oil', '1 unit 1 teaspoon salt', '1 unit ½ cup whole wheat flour', '1 unit ½ cup cake flour', '1 unit 1½ cups warm water', '1 unit for the topping:', '1 unit 1 cup brussels sprouts', '1 unit 1 spring onion ', '1 unit 250 g vegan mozzarella cheese', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['for the dough: in a large bowl, mix together all the dry ingredients. add the wet ingredients and knead well.', 'transfer the dough to a large bowl, brush with olive oil, and cover with a clean kitchen towel. set aside in a warm place for 1 hour and let rise.', 'to make the topping, using a food processor , pulse the brussels sprouts and shallot until nicely shredded. set aside.', 'preheat the tawa \u202fof your tandoor or handi and arrange a rack in the upper third section of the tandoor or handi. grease a baking sheet with olive oil.', 'divide the dough into 4 equal portions and roll each portion into a ball in your hands. roll out 1 portion into a circle.', 'transfer the dough to the prepared baking sheet. sprinkle over a quarter of the brussels sprout–shallot mix, and finish with the vegan mozzarella cheese.', 'bake for 3–4 minutes, remove and serve.']

name: seeded honey loaf
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 2 teaspoons dried instant yeast', '1 unit 225g whole wheat flour', '1 unit 225g cake flour', '1 unit 1½ teaspoons salt', '1 unit ¼ cup mixed seeds (poppy', '1 unit 11/4 cup water', '1 unit 3 tablespoons mustard oil', '1 unit 2 tablespoons honey', '1 unit 2 teaspoons milk (to brush)', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['grease a large loaf pan.', 'in a large bowl, add the yeast, and sift in the flours and salt. add the mixed seeds.   make a well in the center of the dry ingredients and add the water, olive oil and honey. mix well to form a soft dough.', 'remove from the bowl and knead the dough for 5-10 minutes until soft and pliable.', 'place the dough in a lightly oiled bowl. cover with clingfilm and place in a warm place for 1 hour.', 'preheat the tandoor or handi to 170°c.', 'punch out the dough and then place into the greased pan. cover and allow to rest for another hour until doubled in size.', 'brush the dough with milk and bake for 20-30 minutes until golden brown in colour. remove and cool.']

name: pho
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit soup ingredients:', '1 unit 1 cup beef sirloin', '1 unit 1½ tablespoons canola oil', '1 unit 1 small onion', '1 unit 4 cups sodium-reduced beef stock', '1 unit 2 cups water', '1 unit 1 tablespoon freshly grated ginger', '1 unit 1 stalk lemongrass chopped', '1 unit ½ teaspoon whole black peppercorns', '1 unit 1 cinnamon stick', '1 unit ½ cup rice vermicelli noodles', '1 unit 2 cups bean sprouts', '1 unit garnish ingredients:', '1 unit 1 lime', '1 unit ¼ cup fresh basil', '1 unit ¼ cup mint', '1 unit ¼ cup coriander', '1 unit 1 small jalapeno pepper', '1 unit 1 tablespoon fish sauce', '1 unit 1 cup sprouts', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['in large saucepan, heat 1 tablespoon canola oil over medium heat. add beef and cook for about 2-3 minutes.  set aside.', 'add ½ tablespoon canola oil to a saucepan. add onions and cook for about 3 minutes. add beef stock, water, ginger, lemongrass, peppercorns and cinnamon stick, simmer for about 1 hour.', 'meanwhile, place rice vermicelli in bowl and cover with boiling water. place lid on top and allow to sit for about 3 minutes.', 'prepare garnish plate: arrange limes, basil, mint, coriander, jalapeno and small bowl of fish sauce on a plate.', 'add beef to stock mixture and cook to desired doneness.', 'to serve: divide rice vermicelli and sprouts evenly in 4 bowls. pour hot broth-beef mixture over top. garnish as desired from the garnish plate.']

name: chicken and butternut pilaf
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 2 teaspoons sunflower oil', '1 unit 2 cups brown rice', '1 unit 2 teaspoons mild curry powder', '1 unit 1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 unit 1 teaspoon ground coriander', '1 unit 1/2 teaspoon ground turmeric', '1 unit 3 cups boiling water', '1 unit 1 courgetti', '1 unit 2 large skinless chicken breasts (400g)', '1 unit 3 cups butternut (peeled', '1 unit 2 tablespoons flaked almonds', '1 unit 1/2 lemon', '1 unit 2 tablespoons chopped coriander leaves', '1 unit freshly ground black pepper', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat the tandoor or handi to 180°c.', 'heat the sunflower oil in an tandoor or handiproof casserole or baking dish set over a medium heat.', 'stir in the rice and sauté in the oil for 2 minutes, stirring frequently. sprinkle over the spices and cook for a further 2 minutes until fragrant.', 'cover with the water, stirring well. bring to the boil before arranging the butternut and chicken on top of the rice.', 'cover the dish and transfer to the tandoor or handi, baking for about 30 minutes until the rice has absorbed the water and the chicken is cooked through.', 'remove from the tandoor or handi. sprinkle almonds on top and return the dish to the tandoor or handi for 7-10 minutes until the almonds are golden-brown.', 'top with chopped coriander leaves and black pepper.']

summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.

name: veggie frittata
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 6 large free-range eggs', '1 unit salt and pepper', '1 unit 1 tablespoon mustard oil', '1 unit 1/2 a medium onion', '1 unit 1/2 red pepper', '1 unit 2 courgettes', '1 unit 100 g mushrooms', '1 unit 100 g mozzarella', '1 unit 50 g feta', '1 unit 5g italian parsley', '1 unit 5 g fresh coriander', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat tandoor or handi to 200°c.', 'beat the eggs together, season and set aside.', 'drizzle the olive oil into a large tandoor or handiproof, non-stick frying pan and set over medium heat on the stove.', 'slice up the onion, red pepper, courgettes and mushrooms. add the sliced vegetables to the pan and fry until they begin to get a little colour.', 'add the beaten eggs and the cheese and mix slightly. turn the heat down to medium-low and cook for three to five minutes until a crust   begins to form on the bottom (do not stir the mixture).', 'place the pan in the tandoor or handi and bake for 10 minutes until the mixture   has set.', 'remove the pan from the tandoor or handi and allow the frittata to cool slightly (five minutes).', 'tip the frittata out upside down onto a board or platter, sprinkle with the chopped parsley and coriander and serve warm.']

name: tomato, zucchini, goat cheese and basil clafoutis
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 tablespoon mustard oil', '1 unit 1/2 cup fresh goat cheese', '1 unit 1 cup zucchini', '1 unit 2 green onions', '1 unit 2 tablespoon fresh basil', '1 unit 3 eggs', '1 unit 1/2 cup malai', '1 unit 1 tablespoon wholewheat flour', '1 unit grated nutmeg', '1 unit a few drops of tabasco', '1 unit pinch salt', '1 unit 12 cherry tomatoes', '1 unit 2 teaspoons panko crumbs', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat tandoor or handi to 165°c. brush 4 tartlet moulds or 1 tart tin with olive oil.', 'crumble goat’s cheese into the bottom of each mould.', 'grate the zucchini onto a clean cloth and wring out the water. mix zucchini, green onions and basil in a bowl. sprinkle over goat’s cheese. in a bowl, whisk together eggs, cream, flour, nutmeg and tabasco for 1 minute. season with salt. carefully pour into each mould.', 'divide the cherry tomatoes evenly between the moulds. sprinkle with panko. bake on the top rack for around 20 minutes (depending on the size of the moulds) or until a knife inserted into the clafoutis comes out clean.']

summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.

name: vegan moussaka
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ["1 unit 2 tablespoon's mustard oil", '1 unit 1 onion', '1 unit 400g tin chopped tomatoes', '1 unit 1 teaspoon dried oregano', '1 unit 1 large aubergine', '1 unit 1 large courgette', '1 unit 390g tin green lentils in water', '1 unit 1tomato', '1 unit 70g pack rocket', '1 unit for the topping:', '1 unit 350g frozen butternut', '1 unit 25g plant-based spread', '1 unit 25g whole wheat flour', '1 unit 300ml cashew milk', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat the tawa to high and line a large baking sheet with foil. brush the aubergine and courgette on both sides with the remaining oil and put on the baking sheet. tawa for 3-5 mins each side until tender and golden.', 'preheat the tandoor or handi to 170°c. stir the lentils into the tomato sauce; simmer for 10 mins. spoon half the sauce into a deep baking dish and cover with the courgette, followed by the sliced tomato; season. spoon the rest of the sauce on top and cover with the aubergine. set aside.', 'for the topping, steam the butternut for 10-12 mins until tender, then blitz in a food processor until smooth. make a roux by melting the dairy-free spread in a saucepan over a medium heat; stir in the flour to make a paste. remove from the heat and whisk in the cashew milk. return to the heat, bring to the boil, then simmer, stirring, for 2 mins. stir in the butternut and season, then spoon the sauce over the aubergines. bake for 25 mins. serve with the rocket.']

summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.

name: ginger biscuits
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 ¼ cups whole wheat flour', '1 unit 1 cup cake flour', '1 unit 4 teaspoons ground ginger', '1 unit 1 ½ teaspoons baking soda', '1 unit 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '1 unit ¾ teaspoon salt', '1 unit ¼ teaspoon ground cloves', '1 unit ½ cup coconut oil', '1 unit ½ cup brown sugar', '1 unit 1 large egg', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat tandoor or handi to 150°c.', 'beat coconut oil and brown sugar in a large bowl with an electric mixer on medium speed until combined, about 3 minutes. add the egg; beat until combined, about 1 minute, stopping to scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed. reduce mixer speed to low; gradually beat in the flour mixture until combined, about 1 minute. cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes.', 'shape the chilled dough evenly into balls (about 1 heaped tablespoon each). bake until browned and edges are set, about 12 minutes, rotating the baking sheets between the top and bottom racks halfway through cook time. let cool on the pans for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely, about 30 minutes.']

name: vegan jerk chili
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 2 tablespoons mustard oil', '1 unit 3 cloves of garlic', '1 unit 2 celery stalks', '1 unit 1 onion', '1 unit 1 red bell pepper', '1 unit 2 teaspoons jamaican jerk seasoning or chili sauce', '1 unit 1 cup coconut milk', '1 unit 3 tablespoons tomato sauce', '1 unit 1 can red or kidney beans', '1 unit 2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', '1 unit 1 mango', '1 unit 2 tablespoons coriander', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['heat the olive oil in large saucepan over medium heat. add the garlic, celery, onion, and bell pepper and sauté. for 5–6 minutes, until the onion is translucent.', 'add the jerk seasoning or chili sauce and cook for 2–3 minutes.', 'stir in the coconut milk, tomato sauce , beans, and fresh lime juice, and season to taste with salt and freshly ground black pepper, if needed.', 'cover the saucepan with a lid, reduce the heat to low, and simmer for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.', 'stir in half of the mango and half of the coriander, then cover the saucepan and simmer for another 10 minutes.', 'serve the chili over rice, garnished with the remaining mango and coriander.']

name: one pot garlic shrimp and broccoli
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 3 tablespoons extra-virgin mustard oil', '1 unit 6 medium cloves garlic', '1 unit 4 cups small broccoli florets', '1 unit ½ cup diced red bell pepper', '1 unit ½ teaspoon salt', '1 unit ½ teaspoon ground pepper', '1 unit 1 kg peeled and deveined raw shrimp', '1 unit 2 teaspoons lemon juice', '1 unit 1 tablespoon coriander ', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large pot over medium heat.', 'add half the garlic and cook until beginning to brown, about 1 minute.', 'add broccoli, bell pepper and 1/4 teaspoon each salt and pepper.', 'cover and cook, stirring once or twice and adding 1 tablespoon water if the pot is too dry, until the vegetables are tender, 3 to 5 minutes. top with chopped coriander and serve.']

name: creamy veg and mozzarella orzo
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 head of broccoli', '1 unit 4 garlic cloves', '1 unit 1 tablespoon red wine vinegar', '1 unit 2 tablespoons extra-virgin mustard oil', '1 unit 1 onion', '1 unit 1 tablespoon mustard oil', '1 unit 2 cups cherry tomatoes', '1 unit ½ bunch of basil (20g)', '1 unit 300g whole wheat orzo pasta', '1 unit 1 litre vegetable stock', '1 unit 1/2 cup mozzarella', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['place a pan on a high heat. cut the stalk off the broccoli and set aside. break up the florets and dry-fry in the hot casserole dish for 7 mins, turning regularly, until charred and slightly softened. peel the garlic and finely grate ½ a clove into a large bowl, add 1 tbsp each of red wine vinegar and extra-virgin olive oil, and mix well. toss with the hot broccoli, then set aside.', 'peel and finely chop the onion and remaining garlic; trim and finely chop the broccoli stalk. add everything to the pan with 1 tbsp of olive oil and cook for 10 mins until softened.', 'halve the cherry tomatoes and add to the pan, tear in half of the basil leaves, season with sea salt and black pepper, and stir well. cover and cook for 5 mins until the tomatoes are starting to burst.', 'stir in the orzo until it’s all coated in the sauce. add the vegetable stock and then simmer for 10 mins, stirring regularly, until the orzo is tender and the tomatoes are beautifully saucy. chop the mozzarella into 1cm cubes, scatter into the pasta, and leave to stand for 1 min until melty. stir through the mozzarella and the remaining basil, and drizzle with extra-virgin olive oil, if you like. serve with the charred broccoli.']

name: air-fried chicken and kale meatballs
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 3 tablespoons bulgur wheat', '1 unit 2 tablespoons boiling water', '1 unit 200g chicken mince', '1 unit 1 ½ cups chopped kale', '1 unit 1 egg', '1 unit 1 tablespoon garlic cloves', '1 unit 100g green pepper', '1 unit ½ medium onion', '1 unit 1 teaspoon fresh ajwain', '1 unit 1 teaspoon dried oregano', '1 unit 1 teaspoon cumin powder', '1 unit ½ teaspoon coriander powder', '1 unit 1 teaspoon paprika', '1 unit 1 teaspoon chilli', '1 unit ½ teaspoon salt', '1 unit 2 teaspoons oil', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']

name: brown rice salad with sesame dressing and roasted nuts
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 tablespoon low-sodium soy sauce', '1 unit 2 teaspoons extra-virgin mustard oil', '1 unit 2 teaspoons sesame oil', '1 unit 3 cups cooked brown rice', '1 unit 1 red onion', '1 unit 1 red and 1 yellow capsicum', '1 unit 1 cup chopped green beans', '1 unit 1 cup mixed crunchy sprouts (e.g. bean sprouts and sprouted peas and lentils) ·', '1 unit 1 cup fresh flat-leaf parsley', '1 unit 1 cup unsalted', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['in a small bowl, whisk soy sauce and oils together.', 'add cooked rice (ideally while still warm), dressing and red onion in a large bowl. using a fork, carefully mix to combine, not overworking the rice. add capsicum.', 'when rice is fully cool, add blanched beans, sprouts and nuts, and stir to combine. mix in parsley, if using, reserving a little to garnish. divide among bowls, garnish with remaining parsley and serve.']
nutrition_details: {'Saturated Fat': '2.5 g', 'Polyunsaturated Fat': '6 g', 'Monounsaturated Fat': '8 g', 'Trans Fat': '0 g', 'Cholesterol': '0 mg', 'Sodium': '100 mg', 'Potassium': '800 mg', 'Fiber': '8 g', 'Sugar': '5 g', 'Vitamin A': '20%', 'Vitamin C': '40%', 'Calcium': '10%', 'Iron': '15%'}

name: skillet lemon chicken & potatoes with kale
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 3 tablespoons extra-virgin mustard oil', '1 unit 1kg boneless', '1 unit ½ teaspoon salt', '1 unit ½ teaspoon ground pepper', '1 unit 1 kg potatoes', '1 unit ½ cup low-sodium chicken stock', '1 unit 1 large lemon', '1 unit 4 cloves garlic', '1 unit 1 tablespoon chopped fresh tarragon', '1 unit 6 cups baby kale', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat the tandoor or handi to 200°c. heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat. sprinkle chicken with 1/4 teaspoon each salt and pepper. cook, turning once, until browned on both sides, about 5 minutes total. transfer to a plate.', 'add the remaining 2 tablespoons oil, potatoes and the remaining 1/4 teaspoon each salt and pepper to the pan. cook the potatoes, cut-side down, until browned, about 3 minutes. stir in broth, lemon, garlic and tarragon. return the chicken to the pan.', 'transfer the pan to the tandoor or handi. roast until the chicken is cooked through and the potatoes are tender, about 15 minutes. stir kale into the mixture and roast until it has wilted, 3 to 4 minutes.']

name: italian turkey meatballs
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 cup mushrooms', '1 unit 1 small onion', '1 unit 1 stalk celery', '1 unit 4 cloves garlic', '1 unit 1 tablespoon extra-virgin mustard oil', '1 unit ½ cup breadcrumbs', '1 unit ½ cup finely chopped italian parsley', '1 unit ¼ cup grated paneer cheese', '1 unit 2 teaspoons italian seasoning', '1 unit ½ teaspoon salt', '1 unit ½ teaspoon ground pepper', '1 unit 500g lean ground turkey', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['finely chop mushrooms, onion, celery and garlic in a food processor. heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. add the vegetable mixture and cook, stirring occasionally, until the liquid has evaporated, 6 to 8 minutes. transfer to a large bowl and let cool for 10 minutes.', 'preheat tandoor or handi to 200°c. line a large rimmed baking sheet with foil and coat with cooking spray.', 'add breadcrumbs, parsley, cheese, italian seasoning, salt and pepper to the cooled vegetables; stir until combined. add turkey and mix gently to combine and form into 30 meatballs and place on the prepared baking sheet.', 'bake the meatballs for about 15 minutes.']

name: homemade barbecue sauce
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 2 cups tomato sauce', '1 unit ¼ cup apple cider vinegar', '1 unit ¼ cup low-sodium soy sauce', '1 unit 1 cup water', '1 unit 2 tablespoons honey', '1 unit 1 teaspoon dried chilli flakes', '1 unit a pinch of ground cinnamon', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['place all the ingredients in a medium saucepan over medium heat and slowly bring to a boil. reduce the heat and simmer until thick and glossy, 30-35 minutes.', 'remove from the heat, allow to cool and place in sterilized jars. store in the fridge for 1-2 weeks.']

name: mung dal khichdi
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 cup mung beans', '1 unit 1 cup brown rice', '1 unit ½ medium sized onion (chopped)', '1 unit 2 teaspoons turmeric', '1 unit 1 teaspoon mustard seeds', '1 unit 1 teaspoon fenugreek seeds', '1 unit 1 teaspoon cumin', '1 unit 1 teaspoon ginger &  garlic paste', '1 unit 1 cinnamon stick', '1 unit coriander leaves (for garnish)', '1 unit 1 teaspoon salt', '1 unit 3 tablespoons butter/oil', '1 unit 1 l hot water', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['soak the rice overnight, drain the water and bring it to boil until cooked.', 'clean the mung dal, soak it overnight, drain the water and bring it to boil until cooked. clean the mung dal, soak it overnight, drain the water and bring it to boil until cooked.', 'in a pot, heat the oil; add onion, turmeric, mustard seed, fenugreek, cumin, ginger-garlic paste and salt.', 'add precooked rice and mung beans.', 'add hot water and gently simmer on low heat.', 'stir occasionally to prevent settling at the bottom.', 'garnish with chopped coriander.']

name: pancakes with chickpea flour
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit pancakes:', '1 unit 2/3 cup chickpea flour', '1 unit 2/3 cup water', '1 unit 1 egg', '1 unit 1/2 tablespoon mustard oil', '1 unit filling:', '1 unit 1/2 teaspoon mustard oil', '1 unit 1 small red onion', '1 unit 2 cups white mushrooms', '1 unit 4 cups baby spinach', '1 unit 2 tablespoons basil pesto', '1 unit 2 tablespoons feta cheese', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['pancakes: place the chickpea flour in a bowl. whisk in half the broth and whisk vigorously. gradually add the rest of the water, then the egg, and mix well. season lightly with salt and pepper, if desired.  heat a little oil in a skillet over medium heat. pour a quarter of the pancake mixture into the pan and, without waiting, swirl to distribute the mixture in a thin layer. cook for about 2 minutes, or until the edges of the crepe begin to pull away and are lightly browned. set aside on a plate. repeat these steps 3 times with the remaining oil and pancake mix.', 'garnish: heat the oil in another pan. add the onion and mushrooms and sauté for 5 to 7 minutes, until golden brown. add spinach and cook for 2 minutes, or until spinach has wilted. remove from heat. divide the pesto, feta cheese and vegetable filling among half of each crepe. fold over the unstuffed side, then fold in half. serve two crêpes per plate, accompanied by a small mix of fresh vegetables.']
