name: roasted cauliflower salad
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 large head of cauliflower', '1 unit 1 shallot quartered', '1 unit 1 teaspoon chili powder', '1 unit 1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 unit 4 tablespoons extra-virgin mustard oil', '1 unit salt', '1 unit freshly ground black pepper', '1 unit 1 large avocado', '1 unit 1/4 cup water', '1 unit 2 tablespoons red wine vinegar', '1 unit juice of 1 lime', '1 unit 1/2 cup parsley leaves', '1 unit 1 large head of romaine', '1 unit 3 cups baby spinach', '1 unit 1 cup cherry tomatoes', '1 unit ½ cup shaved paneer', '1 unit 1/4 cup slivered almonds toasted', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat tandoor or handi to 220°. on a large baking sheet, toss cauliflower, shallots, chili powder, cumin, and 2 tablespoons oil until coated; season with salt and pepper.', 'bake until cauliflower is golden and crisp and shallots are tender for about 30 to 35 minutes. let cool slightly, then slice shallots into rings.', 'in a blender or food processor, blend avocado, water, vinegar, lime juice, 1/4 cup parsley, and remaining 2 tablespoons oil until smooth; season with salt and pepper. if needed, add more water, 1 tablespoon at a time, to make a thinner dressing. refrigerate until ready to use.', 'in a large bowl, combine romaine, spinach, and remaining 1/4 cup parsley. add cauliflower, shallots, tomatoes, parmesan, and almonds and toss to combine. add desired amount of dressing and toss again to coat.']
nutrition_details: {'Saturated Fat': '3.5 g', 'Polyunsaturated Fat': '4 g', 'Monounsaturated Fat': '10 g', 'Trans Fat': '0 g', 'Cholesterol': '10 mg', 'Sodium': '100 mg', 'Potassium': '800 mg', 'Fiber': '10 g', 'Sugar': '8 g', 'Vitamin A': '20%', 'Vitamin C': '40%', 'Calcium': '15%', 'Iron': '10%'}

name: chicken milanese with arugula –cherry tomato salad
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1/2 cup panko breadcrumbs', '1 unit 1/4 cup finely grated paneer cheese', '1 unit 1 teaspoon italian seasoning', '1 unit 1 teaspoon onion powder', '1 unit 1 large egg', '1 unit 1 lemon', '1 unit 4 skinless chicken breasts', '1 unit 1/4 teaspoon salt plus 1/8 teaspoon', '1 unit 1/4 teaspoon ground pepper plus 1/8 teaspoon', '1 unit cooking spray', '1 unit 1 tablespoon extra-virgin mustard oil', '1 unit 1 tablespoon white-wine vinegar', '1 unit 5 cups packed arugula/ rocket', '1 unit 1 cup cherry tomatoes', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['place a large rimmed baking sheet in the tandoor or handi. preheat to 180°c.', 'stir panko, parmesan, italian seasoning and onion powder together in a shallow dish. whisk egg and lemon zest together in another shallow dish. sprinkle chicken cutlets with 1/4 teaspoon each salt and pepper.', 'dip 1 cutlet in the egg mixture, coating both sides. transfer to the panko mixture, coating generously and pressing to adhere. repeat with the remaining cutlets. remove the hot baking sheet from the tandoor or handi; coat with cooking spray. coat the dredged cutlets with cooking spray; place on the pan, sprayed-side down. coat the tops with more cooking spray. bake, turning once, until browned.', 'meanwhile, whisk oil, vinegar and the remaining 1/8 teaspoon each salt and pepper in a large bowl. add arugula and tomatoes; toss to coat. serve the chicken with the salad and lemon wedges.']
nutrition_details: {'Saturated Fat': '4 g', 'Polyunsaturated Fat': '2 g', 'Monounsaturated Fat': '6 g', 'Trans Fat': '0 g', 'Cholesterol': '80 mg', 'Sodium': '250 mg', 'Potassium': '400 mg', 'Fiber': '4 g', 'Sugar': '5 g', 'Vitamin A': '20%', 'Vitamin C': '40%', 'Calcium': '15%', 'Iron': '20%'}

name: fresh chicken stir-fry
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1/4 cup coarsely chopped fresh basil', '1 unit 2 tablespoons chopped fresh mint', '1 unit 3/4 cup low-sodium chicken stock ', '1 unit 3 green (spring) onions ', '1 unit 2 cloves garlic', '1 unit 1 tablespoon peeled and chopped fresh ginger', '1 unit 2 tablespoons extra-virgin mustard oil', '1 unit 1 small eggplant', '1 unit 1 yellow onion', '1 unit 1 red bell pepper', '1 unit 1 yellow bell pepper', '1 unit 500g skinless', '1 unit 2 tablespoons low-sodium soy sauce', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['in a blender or food processor, combine the basil, mint, 1/4 cup stock, chopped green onions, garlic and ginger. pulse until the mixture is minced but not pureed. set aside.', 'in a large, nonstick frying pan, heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil over medium-high heat. add the eggplant, yellow onion and bell peppers and sauté until the vegetables are just tender, about 8 minutes. transfer to a bowl and cover with a kitchen towel to keep warm.', 'add the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil to the pan and heat over medium-high heat. add the basil mixture and sauté for about 1 minute, stirring constantly. add the chicken strips and soy sauce and sauté until the chicken is almost opaque throughout, about 2 minutes.', 'add the remaining 1/2 cup stock and bring to a boil. return the eggplant mixture to the pan and stir until heated through, about 3 minutes. transfer to a warmed serving dish and garnish with the sliced green onion. serve immediately.']
nutrition_details: {'Saturated Fat': '2 g', 'Polyunsaturated Fat': '4 g', 'Monounsaturated Fat': '6 g', 'Trans Fat': '0 g', 'Cholesterol': '60 mg', 'Sodium': '250 mg', 'Potassium': '400 mg', 'Fiber': '5 g', 'Sugar': '8 g', 'Vitamin A': '20%', 'Vitamin C': '40%', 'Calcium': '4%', 'Iron': '15%'}

name: lemon bread
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 cup whole wheat flour', '1 unit ½ cupcake flour', '1 unit ¾ cup brown sugar', '1 unit 2 teaspoons baking powder', '1 unit ¼ teaspoon salt', '1 unit 1 lightly beaten egg', '1 unit 1 cup fat-free milk', '1 unit ¼ cup canola oil', '1 unit 2 teaspoons finely shredded lemon peel', '1 unit 1 tablespoon lemon juice (optional)', '1 unit ½ cup chopped toasted almonds or walnuts', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat tandoor or handi to 180°c.grease a loaf pan; set aside. in a medium bowl stir together flour, sugar, the baking powder, and salt. make a well in center of flour e mixture; set aside.', 'in another medium bowl combine the egg, milk, oil, lemon peel, and the 1 tablespoon lemon juice. add egg mixture all at once to flour mixture. stir just until moistened (batter should be lumpy). fold in nuts. spoon batter into prepared pan.', 'bake for 45 to 55 minutes or until a wooden toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. if desired, stir together the 2 tablespoons lemon juice and the 1 tablespoon sugar. while bread is still in the pan, brush lemon-sugar mixture over the top of the loaf. cool in pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes. remove from pan. cool completely on a wire rack. wrap and store overnight before serving.']

name: spinach yoghurt dip
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 cup low fat cottage cheese', '1 unit 1 cup low fat plain yoghurt', '1 unit 1 cup frozen spinach (squeezed dry and chopped)', '1 unit ½ carrot grated', '1 unit 1 teaspoon lemon juice', '1 unit salt and pepper', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['in a food processor or blender, puree the cottage cheese. add to a medium bowl.', 'add the remaining ingredients and whisk together. refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, up to overnight.', 'serve with assorted veggies as a dip.']

name: black bean quesedillas
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 1/2 cups reduced  salt black beans', '1 unit 1 cup finely diced zucchini', '1 unit 1 cup frozen sweet corn kernels', '1 unit 2/3 cup finely diced red onion', '1 unit 1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese', '1 unit 1/4 cup chopped fresh coriander', '1 unit 1 teaspoon cumin', '1 unit 1/2 teaspoon salt', '1 unit pinch of black pepper', '1 unit 1/4 teaspoon tabasco sauce', '1 unit 2 whole wheat tortillas', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['heat tandoor or handi to 180°c. in a large bowl, combine the beans, zucchini, corn, red onion, cheese, coriander, cumin, salt, pepper and tabasco sauce.', 'heat a large, nonstick skillet to medium heat and coat with cooking spray. place one tortilla in the pan to warm. place half the bean mixture on one side of the tortilla and fold over to cover. cook for 1 to 2 minutes then flip the quesadilla and cook for another 1 to 2 minutes. remove from heat and place on a baking sheet. repeat with the other tortilla.', 'bake for 5 to 8 minutes or until cheese has completely melted. cut each quesadilla into 4 even slices and serve with your choice of condiments.']

name: balsamic chicken with mushrooms
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit ½ kg skinless chicken breasts', '1 unit 1 tablespoon mustard oil', '1 unit ¼ cup whole wheat flour', '1 unit 1 tablespoon butter', '1 unit ½ cup sliced mushrooms', '1 unit ½ teaspoon black pepper', '1 unit 1/3 cup  brown imli pulp', '1 unit ½ cup chicken stock', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['place the chicken on plastic wrap and pound with a mallet till thin.', 'heat olive oil over medium heat in a large non-stick pan.', 'coat the chicken on both sides with flour and add to the pan. cook for 5 minutes per side and set aside.', 'melt the butter in the pan and add the mushrooms and pepper. sauté for 5 minutes.', 'pour in the balsamic vinegar and bring to a boil.', 'allow the mixture to reduce before adding the chicken stock and simmering on low heat for 3-4 minutes.', 'add the chicken breasts and simmer for 4 minutes more.', 'remove from heat and serve over a bed of wild rice.']

name: mushroom tart
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit ¾ cup part-skim ricotta cheese', '1 unit 1/2 cup soft goat cheese', '1 unit 2 teaspoons chopped fresh rosemary', '1 unit freshly ground pepper', '1 unit 1 tablespoon butter', '1 unit 4 cups mixed wild mushrooms', '1 unit 1 large leek', '1 unit ½ teaspoon salt', '1 unit ¼ cup white wine', '1 unit 10 sheets phyllo pastry', '1 unit ¼ cup extra-virgin mustard oil', '1 unit ¼ cup breadcrumbs', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['combine ricotta, goat cheese, rosemary and pepper in a medium bowl. set aside.', 'heat butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. add mushrooms, leek and salt and cook, stirring, until the leek starts to soften and the mushrooms release their juices, about 3 minutes. pour in wine and simmer until the liquid has evaporated, about 2 minutes. set aside.', 'preheat tandoor or handi to 200°c. line a large baking sheet with parchment paper. lay one large sheet of phyllo on the prepared pan. keep the remaining phyllo covered with plastic wrap or wax paper and a damp kitchen towel.', 'lightly coat the phyllo with oil using a pastry brush. sprinkle with 1 teaspoon breadcrumbs. repeat this step, layering the remaining phyllo on top. carefully roll about 3/4 inch of each side toward the center to form the outer rim of the tart.', 'spread the reserved cheese mixture evenly over the phyllo. top with the reserved mushroom mixture.', 'bake the tart until the crust is brown and crispy, 25 to 30 minutes. let cool in the pan on a wire rack for 5 minutes. to serve, lift the parchment paper and slide the tart onto a cutting board or large platter. serve warm.']
nutrition_details: {'Saturated Fat': '8 g', 'Polyunsaturated Fat': '4 g', 'Monounsaturated Fat': '6 g', 'Trans Fat': '0 g', 'Cholesterol': '30 mg', 'Sodium': '250 mg', 'Potassium': '400 mg', 'Fiber': '2 g', 'Sugar': '4 g', 'Vitamin A': '10%', 'Vitamin C': '20%', 'Calcium': '15%', 'Iron': '10%'}

name: charred corn and halloumi pancakes
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 4 sweetcorn cobs', '1 unit 1 tablespoon mustard oil', '1 unit 200g plain flour', '1 unit 2 teaspoons baking powder', '1 unit 1 red chilli', '1 unit 20g fresh coriander', '1 unit 1 large egg', '1 unit 350ml milk', '1 unit 125g halloumi', '1 unit 125g low-fat greek-style yoghurt', '1 unit 1 teaspoon sriracha chilli sauce', '1 unit 1 lime', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['heat a griddle pan or barbecue until hot and brush the sweetcorn cobs with 1 tsp oil. cook for 15 mins, turning regularly, until charred all over. use a sharp knife to cut down the length of each cob to remove the kernels; transfer to a bowl.', 'mix the flour, baking powder, chilli and chopped coriander in a separate bowl. create a well in the centre; whisk the egg and milk to combine, then pour into the well. starting in the centre, whisk gently to gradually mix the flour into the egg mixture until combined and smooth. stir in the sweetcorn and halloumi; season.', 'heat a frying pan over a medium-high heat and brush with oil. working in batches, pour ladlefuls of batter into the pan to form 8cm pancakes. cook for 2 mins until golden; flip and cook for a further 2 mins. repeat to make 12 pancakes.', 'mix the yoghurt with the chilli sauce, then serve with the pancakes, remaining coriander and lime wedges for squeezing over.']
nutrition_details: {'Saturated Fat': '8 g', 'Polyunsaturated Fat': '2 g', 'Monounsaturated Fat': '4 g', 'Trans Fat': '0 g', 'Cholesterol': '60 mg', 'Sodium': '250 mg', 'Potassium': '400 mg', 'Fiber': '4 g', 'Sugar': '8 g', 'Vitamin A': '10%', 'Vitamin C': '20%', 'Calcium': '20%', 'Iron': '10%'}

name: millet salad recipe
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 cup millet', '1 unit 2 cups water', '1 unit 1 cup cherry tomatoes', '1 unit 1 cucumber', '1 unit 1 cup iceberg lettuce (chopped)', '1 unit 1 cup baby spinach', '1 unit ¼ cup mix bell peppers', '1 unit ¼ cup fresh mint leaves', '1 unit ¼ cup feta cheese', '1 unit ¼ cup green / black olives', '1 unit juice of 1 lemon', '1 unit 2 tablespoons mustard oil', '1 unit pepper to taste', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['in a saucepan, combine the millet and water. bring it to a boil.', 'reduce the heat, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until the millet is tender and water is absorbed.', 'fluff the millet with a fork and let it cool.', 'in a large bowl, combine the salad vegetables. add the cooked and cooled millet to the bowl of vegetables.', 'in a small bowl, whisk together the lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper. pour the dressing over the millet and vegetable mixture.', 'toss everything together until well combined.', 'if using, sprinkle crumbled feta cheese and sliced olives on top.', 'before serving, garnish with mint leaves and adjust the seasoning if needed.']

name: vegetable tom yum soup
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit ½ cup rice noodles', '1 unit 2 tablespoons canola oil', '1 unit 2 eggplants diced', '1 unit 2-3 tablespoons tom yum paste', '1 unit 3 cups water', '1 unit 1 cup low sodium vegetable stock', '1 unit 1/3 cup coconut milk', '1 unit 4 boy choy (coarsely chopped)', '1 unit 400g tofu (diced)', '1 unit 2 tablespoons lemon juice', '1 unit 2 cups bean sprouts', '1 unit 3 spring onions (sliced)', '1 unit ½ cup chopped fresh coriander', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['cook rice noodles in a pot of boiling water for 5-8 minutes or until tender, then drain and run under cold water.', 'heat oil in a large pot. add eggplant; cook, stirring for 5 minutes.', 'add tom yum paste, water, stock and coconut cream; bring to a boil then reduce heat and simmer covered for 10 minutes or until eggplant has softened.', 'stir bok choy and tofu into soup and bring back to a simmer.', 'remove from heat and stir juice into soup. divide noodles among serving bowls', 'ladle soup over noodles and sprinkle with combined sprouts, spring onion and coriander.']

name: best farmers quiche
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 cup whole wheat flour', '1 unit ¼ cup (75g) cold margarine', '1 unit 3 tablespoons cold water', '1 unit 1 cup spinach (blanched and chopped)', '1 unit ½ carrot (finely chopped)', '1 unit 1 cup mushrooms( finely chopped)', '1 unit 4 eggs', '1 unit 1 cup low-fat malai', '1 unit 2 teaspoons vegetable stock granules', '1 unit 2 teaspoons grated nutmeg', '1 unit 1 teaspoon dried herbs', '1 unit pepper', '1 unit ½ cup walnuts (roughly chopped)', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat the tandoor or handi to 200°c.', 'knead the flour and margarine with cold water to form a dough.', 'roll out onto a flat surface.', 'line a greased cake pan or pie plate (26cm diameter) with the dough. make an approximately 2 cm high edge. pierce the base several times with a fork. refrigerate for 30 minutes before blind baking for 10 minutes.', 'prepare the egg mixture by whisking the eggs, cream, and stock granules. season with nutmeg, herbs and pepper.', 'spread the vegetables on the base of the crust and then pour the egg mixture on the top. sprinkle with chopped walnuts.', 'bake the vegetable quiche on the second shelf from the bottom for 30 minutes.', 'remove from the tandoor or handi and allow to cool for 10-15 minutes before slicing.']

name: chicken lagaan
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit ¼ cup low-fat yoghurt', '1 unit ¼ cup  malai style corn (1/4 cup)', '1 unit 2 teaspoons  garlic', '1 unit ½ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '1 unit 2 teaspoons peppadew diced', '1 unit 2 tablespoons low-fat milk', '1 unit ½ white onion ', '1 unit 2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 unit 2 tablespoons chickpea flour', '1 unit ¼ cup maize meal', '1 unit 1 teaspoon baking powder', '1 unit pinch of salt', '1 unit 50g roughly chopped spinach', '1 unit 1 tablespoon sesame seeds', '1 unit ½ cup shredded chicken', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat tandoor or handi at 180˚c & line baking tray with parchment paper.', 'in a bowl add yoghurt, cream style corn, peppadew, minced garlic, cayenne pepper, milk, diced onion, oil and mix.', 'in a separate bowl sift dry ingredients then gently fold into the yoghurt mixture.', 'add the spinach and shredded chicken into the mixture and fold in until combined', 'pour mixture into baking tray and top with sesame seeds and bake for 15- 20 mins until golden brown.']

name: mini caprese pizza
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 4 mini whole wheat tortillas', '1 unit 20g tomato purée', '1 unit 2 x 125g pack mozzarella', '1 unit 250g cherry tomatoes', '1 unit 20g pine nuts', '1 unit 1 x 30g pack basil', '1 unit 1 garlic clove', '1 unit 20ml mustard oil', '1 unit 20g italian hard cheese', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat the tandoor or handi to 180°c. put the tortillas on 2 large baking sheets lined with nonstick baking paper and spread with the tomato purée.', 'arrange the mozzarella slices and tomatoes on top of the tortilla. bake in the tandoor or handi for 6-8 mins, until the cheese has melted, and the edges of the tortillas are golden.', 'meanwhile, blitz the pine nuts, most of the basil leaves, garlic, oil and hard cheese in a food processor to make a pesto.', 'remove the pizzas from the tandoor or handi, spoon over the pesto and garnish with the remaining basil leaves. serve immediately.']

name: persian pasta and bean soup
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1/2 cup dry green lentils', '1 unit 1/2 cup dry chickpeas', '1 unit 1/2 cup dry pinto beans', '1 unit 4 cups water', '1 unit 1/4 cup extra-virgin mustard oil plus 1 tablespoon', '1 unit 1 cup spring onions', '1 unit 3 cups spinach', '1 unit 2 cups finely chopped fresh coriander with soft stems (about 2 bunches)', '1 unit 2 cups finely chopped fresh parsley leaves (1-2 bunches)', '1 unit 1/2 teaspoon ground turmeric plus a pinch', '1 unit 1 teaspoon salt', '1 unit 1/2 teaspoon ground pepper', '1 unit 1 medium white onion', '1 unit topping', '1 unit 1 cup extra-virgin mustard oil', '1 unit 1 medium white onion', '1 unit pinch of ground turmeric', '1 unit 5 cloves garlic', '1 unit 3 tablespoons dried mint', '1 unit 2 1/2 tablespoons yoghurt', '1 unit 1 tablespoon water', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['to make soup: combine lentils, chickpeas and pinto beans in a large bowl and cover by  with water; soak overnight.', 'rinse and drain the beans. bring 4 cups of water to boil in a large pot. add the bean mixture, reduce heat to a simmer and cook until the beans are almost tender but still have a bit of a bite.', 'meanwhile, heat 1/4 cup oil in a large skillet over medium heat. add scallion whites; cook, stirring occasionally, until starting to brown, about 5 minutes. add scallion greens, spinach, corianderand parsley; cook, stirring occasionally, until the scallion whites are golden and the herbs are wilted, 5 to 7 minutes more.', 'when the beans are almost tender, add the spinach mixture to the pot along with 1/2 teaspoon turmeric, salt and pepper; stir to combine. adjust heat to maintain a simmer and cook, stirring occasionally, for 30 minutes.', 'meanwhile, heat 1 tablespoon oil in the skillet over medium-high heat. add chopped onion and a pinch of turmeric; cook, stirring occasionally, until golden brown, about 6 minutes. set aside.', 'after the soup has cooked for 30 minutes, add the browned onion. cook, stirring occasionally for about 15 minutes. remove from heat and cover to keep warm.', 'to prepare toppings: heat 1 cup oil in a medium skillet over medium-high heat. add sliced onion and pinch of turmeric. cook, stirring occasionally, until the onion is golden brown, about 12 minutes. transfer with a slotted spoon to a paper-towel-lined plate. add garlic to the oil left in the pan; cook, stirring often, until golden brown, about 2 minutes. transfer with a slotted spoon to a paper-towel-lined plate.', 'fine a sieve with a paper towel and place over a heatproof container next to the stove. add mint to the oil left in the pan; cook, stirring, until it turns dark green, about 1 minute. strain the mint and oil through the prepared sieve (discard the remaining oil). mix yoghurt  with 1 tablespoon water in a small bowl until combined.', 'ladle the soup into bowls. top each bowl with some of the fried onions, garlic and mint. dollop with the yoghurt  mixture.']
nutrition_details: {'Saturated Fat': '2 g', 'Polyunsaturated Fat': '4 g', 'Monounsaturated Fat': '8 g', 'Trans Fat': '0 g', 'Cholesterol': '5 mg', 'Sodium': '400 mg', 'Potassium': '1200 mg', 'Fiber': '10 g', 'Sugar': '8 g', 'Vitamin A': '20%', 'Vitamin C': '40%', 'Calcium': '15%', 'Iron': '25%'}

name: nectarine, mint and honey lollies
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 3 medium ripe nectarines', '1 unit ½ teaspoon crushed chillies (optional)', '1 unit 100g honey', '1 unit ½ lemon', '1 unit 8g fresh mint', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['slice ¼ of 1 nectarine into 10 thin slices and divide between 10 lolly moulds with the crushed chillies, if using.', 'cut crosses into the bases of the other 2 nectarines and put in a heatproof bowl with the remaining ¾ nectarine. cover with boiling water for 30 secs, then drain and run under cold water. gently press the skin to loosen, then peel away and discard (use a peeler or small knife to help if needed).', 'roughly chop the peeled nectarines, discarding the stones, then transfer to a powerful blender with the honey, lemon juice and 200ml water. blend until smooth. add the mint leaves and pulse to roughly chop. carefully divide the mixture between the lolly moulds. add the lolly sticks, then freeze for at least 6 hrs (ideally overnight) before serving.']
nutrition_details: {'Saturated Fat': '0 g', 'Polyunsaturated Fat': '0 g', 'Monounsaturated Fat': '0 g', 'Trans Fat': '0 g', 'Cholesterol': '0 mg', 'Sodium': '5 mg', 'Potassium': '150 mg', 'Fiber': '2 g', 'Sugar': '25 g', 'Vitamin A': '10%', 'Vitamin C': '20%', 'Calcium': '2%', 'Iron': '4%'}

name: feta and dill savoury muffins
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 175g plain flour', '1 unit 50g wholewheat flour', '1 unit 2½ teaspoons baking powder', '1 unit 1 teaspoon fine salt', '1 unit 275ml whole milk', '1 unit 1 medium egg', '1 unit 100g cottage cheese', '1 unit 75g unsalted butter', '1 unit 50g feta cheese', '1 unit ½ teaspoon wholegrain mustard', '1 unit 2 tablespoons dill', '1 unit 1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 unit 8 sundried tomatoes', '1 unit 25g pumpkin seeds', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat the tandoor or handi to 180°c. line a 12-hole muffin tin with cases.', 'put the flours, baking powder and salt in a bowl, and stir everything together.   dd the milk, egg, cottage cheese, melted butter, feta cheese, mustard, dill and black pepper.', 'mix it all together and spoon into muffin cases.', 'top each muffin with a little chopped sundried tomato and sprinkle with the pumpkin seeds.', 'bake for 20–25 minutes, or until a skewer inserted comes out clean.']

name: spaghetti bolognese
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 tablespoons mustard oil', '1 unit 200g extra lean mince', '1 unit 1 medium onion', '1 unit ¼ cup shiitake mushrooms', '1 unit 1 medium carrot (grated)', '1 unit 1 x 400g can chopped tomatoes', '1 unit 1 cup low salt vegetable stock', '1 unit 2 tablespoons sundried tomato paste', '1 unit 1 bay leaf', '1 unit 300g wholewheat spaghetti', '1 unit 2 tablespoons fresh parsley', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['heat the olive oil in a large saucepan and fry the onions and mince until the mince has browned.', 'add the mushrooms, carrot, canned tomatoes, stock, tomato paste and bay leaf. bring to the boil and then let  it simmer for 15-20mins or until the sauce has thickened.', 'place the spaghetti in a saucepan of boiling water and cook until the spaghetti is soft.', 'divide the spaghetti into four portions and serve with the bolognese sauce on top. sprinkle with the fresh parsley and serve.']

name: spiced cauliflower rice pie
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 2 onions', '1 unit 1 tablespoon mustard oil', '1 unit 1 head of cauliflower', '1 unit 3 tablespoons tikka curry paste', '1 unit 1 cup of basmati rice', '1 unit 3 fresh mixed-colour chillies', '1 unit 6 uncooked poppadoms', '1 unit 1 bunch of coriander', '1 unit 6 tablespoons natural yoghurt', '1 unit 4 tablespoons extra virgin mustard oil', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['peel and finely chop the onions, place in a 28cm non-stick frying pan on a medium heat with 1 tablespoon of olive oil and a splash of water, and cook for 10 minutes, or until golden, stirring regularly.', 'cut the cauliflower into 2cm florets, finely slicing the stalk and any nice leaves. stir into the pan with the curry paste and cook for 5 minutes. pour in 1 mug of rice and 2 mugs of boiling kettle water (600ml). prick and add the whole chillies, then roughly snap in the poppadoms and tear in most of the coriander leaves. stir well, season with sea salt and black pepper, cover, and cook for 15 minutes on medium-low heat.', 'after this time, the rice will have absorbed all the liquid. uncover the pan, drizzle 3 tablespoons of oil around the edge and press down with a masher.', 'reduce to low heat and cook for 5 more minutes to get a super-golden, thin, crispy crust. rest, covered, for 10 minutes, then loosen the edges with a spatula. carefully turn the whole thing out onto a board or platter, then pick over the remaining coriander leaves.', 'season the yoghurt with black pepper, drizzle it with a little extra virgin olive oil, and serve it on the side']
nutrition_details: {'Saturated Fat': '2 g', 'Polyunsaturated Fat': '4 g', 'Monounsaturated Fat': '6 g', 'Trans Fat': '0 g', 'Cholesterol': '10 mg', 'Sodium': '100 mg', 'Potassium': '400 mg', 'Fiber': '8 g', 'Sugar': '8 g', 'Vitamin A': '20%', 'Vitamin C': '40%', 'Calcium': '15%', 'Iron': '10%'}

name: chilli lemon chicken spaghetti
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 2 cups whole wheat spaghetti', '1 unit boiling water', '1 unit 1 teaspoon oil', '1 unit salt', '1 unit 2 tablespoons mustard oil', '1 unit 1 teaspoon  chili flakes', '1 unit 1 clove garlic(minced)', '1 unit 1 teaspoon oregano', '1 unit 1 cup cherry tomatoes (halved)', '1 unit 2 chicken breasts (diced)', '1 unit 2 tablespoons lemon juice', '1 unit 1 lemon zest', '1 unit 150 g rocket leaves', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['place the spaghetti in the boiling water and add oil and salt. cook for 8 minutes or until al dente.', 'in a pan, add the oil, chili flakes, garlic, oregano and baby tomatoes. cook till fragrant.', 'add the diced chicken breasts and cook well.', 'deglazed the pan with lemon juice and add the zest with a ladleful of pasta water.', 'allow to reduce, remove from heat.', 'strain the spaghetti and add to the chicken. mix well.', 'serve with rocket leaves.']

name: lentil bread
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 2 cups red lentils', '1 unit 200 g feta cheese made into crumbs', '1 unit 10 sprigs fresh dill', '1 unit 6 spring onions', '1 unit 1 cup low-fat yoghurt', '1 unit 1 handful olives chopped', '1 unit 1 medium egg', '1 unit 1 pinch chilli flakes', '1 unit 50 ml mustard oil', '1 unit ¼ teaspoon black pepper freshly ground', '1 unit 1 teaspoon baking soda', '1 unit 1 teaspoon baking powder', '1 unit 100 g cheddar cheese grated', '1 unit 2 tablespoons sesame seeds', '1 unit 1 medium red pepper (diced)', '1 unit pinch of salt', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['wash and soak the red lentils for at least one hour.', 'sieve the lentils once soaked (no need to rinse) and puree these in a food processor.', 'transfer the pureed lentils into a bowl and add the eggs, baking soda, baking powder, yoghurt, olive oil, black pepper, and salt. mix well', 'add the remaining ingredients, the chopped olives, spring onions, chopped pepper, crumbled feta, grated cheddar, dill, and chili flakes. add most of the sesame seeds and keep a few to sprinkle over.', 'prepare a loaf tin by greasing some butter or olive oil. pour the lentil mixture into the tin. sprinkle the remaining sesame seeds on the loaf.', 'transfer to the tandoor or handi and bake at 190°c for 35-40 minutes until golden brown.', 'serve warm or cold as a snack or a main with a salad as a side.']

name: korean bbq beef
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit ½ kg lean beef', '1 unit 1 ripe pear', '1 unit 2 cloves minced garlic', '1 unit 1 teaspoon minced ginger', '1 unit 2 chopped spring onions', '1 unit 3 tablespoons low sodium soy sauce or tamari', '1 unit 1 teaspoon brown sugar', '1 unit 2 teaspoons toasted sesame oil', '1 unit pinch freshly ground black pepper', '1 unit garnish', '1 unit 2 tsp toasted sesame seeds', '1 unit 2 sliced spring onions', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['grate the pear in a large bowl . add the garlic, ginger, green onions, soy sauce, brown sugar, toasted sesame oil, and black pepper.', 'stir to combine and add the beef, coating it completely. cover the bowl and let it marinate in the refrigerator for 1 to 2 hours. drain the beef from the marinade using a strainer or colander.', 'heat a large non-stick pan over medium-high heat until it is hot. add the beef and stir fry, for about 3 minutes.', 'garnish with sesame seeds and green onions before serving.']

name: caramelized pears
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 3 firm pears (sliced)', '1 unit 1 tablespoon lemon juice', '1 unit 2 tablespoons unsalted butter', '1 unit 3 teaspoons brown sugar', '1 unit ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '1 unit ½ teaspoon ground ginger', '1 unit ¼ teaspoon ground cloves', '1 unit pinch of salt', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['toss pears with lemon juice in a medium bowl.', 'melt butter in a pan over medium heat; stir in the pears. reduce heat to medium-low, cover and cook, stirring once halfway through, for 10 minutes.', 'meanwhile combine sugar, cinnamon, ginger, cloves and salt in a small bowl.', 'after 10 minutes, stir the sugar mixture into the pears. increase the heat to medium and cook, stirring often, until the pears are tender and glazed, 4 to 6 minutes, depending on the type and firmness of the pears. serve warm.']

name: chicken moussaka
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 kg brinjal/eggplant (sliced)', '1 unit salt', '1 unit oil', '1 unit meat sauce', '1 unit 1 large onion (chopped)', '1 unit 3 cloves crushed garlic', '1 unit 2 tablespoons oil', '1 unit 1 kg minced chicken', '1 unit 1 can peeled tomatoes', '1 unit ½ cup white wine', '1 unit 2 tablespoons chopped parsley', '1 unit 1 teaspoon sugar', '1 unit 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '1 unit salt and pepper', '1 unit malai sauce', '1 unit 3 tablespoons butter', '1 unit 4 tablespoons cake flour', '1 unit 2 cups low fat milk', '1 unit ¼ teaspoon nutmeg', '1 unit salt and pepper', '1 unit ½ cup grated paneer cheese', '1 unit 1 egg (lightly beaten)', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['sprinkle the sliced brinjal with salt and leave for 1 hour.', 'rinse and dry well. brush the brinjal with oil and tawa for 3-4 minutes per side.', 'meat sauce: heat a pan with oil and fry onion till golden brown. add the mince and garlic and fry for a further minute. add in the remaining meat sauce ingredients, season to taste. cover and simmer for 15 minutes.', 'cream sauce: melt the butter and add the flour. whisk well for 3-4 minutes till lightly golden brown   pour in the milk , slowly whilst whisking to incorporate.   remove from the heat and add the nutmeg and salt and pepper.   add half the cheese and stir in the egg.', 'to assemble: preheat the tandoor or handi to 180°c. add oil to a tandoor or handi proof casserole and layer the brinjal, meat sauce and white sauce.  top with remaining cheese and bake for 30 minutes.']

name: vegetarian lasagna
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 teaspoon mustard oil', '1 unit ¼ leek', '1 unit 20g rocket', '1 unit 2 tablespoons ricotta cheese', '1 unit 2 tablespoons low fat cottage cheese', '1 unit 1 eggplant', '1 unit 1 courgette', '1 unit 1/3 red bell peppers', '1 unit 1 cup pumpkin or butternut', '1 unit 1 can chopped tomato', '1 unit 1 teaspoon marjoram', '1 unit 1 teaspoon dried basil', '1 unit 1 box whole wheat lasagne sheets', '1 unit 2 teaspoons paneer cheese', '1 unit black pepper', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat the tandoor or handi to 190°c.', 'combine the oil and leek in a large, non-stick frying pan and season with pepper.  cook over moderate heat until the leek is golden brown.', 'add the rocket and cook a further 1 – 2 minutes, or until wilted.  stir in the cheese and set aside.', 'place all veg in a bowl and toss with olive oil, salt and pepper. add the chopped tomatoes and dried herbs.  place in the tandoor or handi to roast for 10-15 minutes.', 'bring a large pot of water to a boil.  cook the lasagna sheets for 2 minutes, drain and set aside.', 'layer the tomato and veg mixture and the leek and cheese mixture separating them with a lasagna sheet.', 'place the third sheet on the lasagna to create the third layer and spoon over the remaining tomato mixture and sprinkle with the grated parmesan cheese.', 'cover the dish with foil and bake for 30 minutes. remove the foil and cook a further 10 minutes or until the top is golden and the sauce is bubbling.']

summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 3 tablespoon mustard oil', '1 unit 2 yellow onions', '1 unit 1 cm ginger', '1 unit 5 cloves garlic', '1 unit 3 teaspoon coriander', '1 unit 2 teaspoon smoked paprika', '1 unit 1/2 teaspoon turmeric', '1 unit 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon', '1 unit 1/4 teaspoon cardamom', '1 unit 1/2 teaspoon cayenne', '1 unit 1 lime', '1 unit 1 cup mung beans', '1 unit 1 1/2 cups vegetable stock', '1 unit 1/2 a cabbage (5 cups chopped cabbage)', '1 unit salt and pepper to taste', '1 unit 2 teaspoons chopped parsley', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['peel the onions, ginger, and garlic and chop them up well.', 'add the olive oil to a pan and sauté the onions, ginger, garlic in the oil for about 10 minutes over a medium-high flame. stir occasionally so the onions, ginger, garlic do not burn.', 'while the onions, ginger, and garlic sauté, chop up the cabbage.', 'add the cabbage to the sautéed onions, ginger, and garlic.', 'also add in the mung beans, the smoked paprika, coriander, turmeric, cinnamon, cardamom, cayenne, and the vegetable stock and mix well.', 'cover this mixture and let cook about 20 minutes. uncover and stir well. then squeeze in the lime juice. stir well again.', 'season with salt and pepper to taste and stir well. then turn off the stove and remove the pan from the stovetop. sprinkle the fresh parsley over the mung bean and cabbage sauté.']

name: sweet potato bread pudding
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 2 cups diced peeled sweet potato (boiled and drained)', '1 unit 3 tablespoons granulated sugar plus 1/4 cup', '1 unit 1 tablespoon unsalted butter', '1 unit 1 ½ teaspoons orange zest', '1 unit ¼ cup orange juice', '1 unit ¾ teaspoon lemon zest', '1 unit 2 teaspoons lemon juice', '1 unit ¼ teaspoon salt', '1 unit 6 large eggs', '1 unit 1 ½ cups low-fat milk', '1 unit 1 ¼ teaspoons ground cinnamon', '1 unit ½ teaspoon vanilla essence', '1 unit ¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg', '1 unit 8 cups diced stale whole wheat bread', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['combine sweet potato, water, brown sugar, 1 tablespoon butter, orange zest, orange juice, lemon zest, lemon juice and salt in small saucepan.', 'bring to a boil over high heat. reduce heat to low, cover and simmer until the sweet potato is very tender, 15 to 25 minutes. let cool for 5 minutes.', 'whisk eggs in a large bowl. add 1 1/2 cups milk, cinnamon, vanilla, nutmeg, the sweet potato puree and the remaining 1/4 cup granulated sugar; whisk until blended. add bread and stir until well coated. pour the mixture into the prepared baking dish. transfer the mixture to a food processor and puree. transfer to a shallow pan and let cool completely, about 15 minutes in the refrigerator or 5 minutes in the freezer.', 'preheat tandoor or handi to 180°c and grease a baking dish. place the baking dish in a roasting pan. pour enough boiling water into the roasting pan to come 1 inch up the sides of the baking dish.', 'carefully transfer the roasting pan to the tandoor or handi. bake the pudding until the center is no longer runny, 45 minutes to 1 hour. serve warm.']

name: chipotle roasted potatoes
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 500g baby potatoes', '1 unit 2 teaspoons sunflower oil', '1 unit 2 tablespoons chipotle paste', '1 unit for the yogurt dip:', '1 unit ½ lime', '1 unit 1 small garlic clove', '1 unit 200g low fat greek-style yogurt', '1 unit ½ teaspoon toasted cumin seeds', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['in a roasting pan, add the potatoes, olive oil and chipotle paste. mix well.', 'roast the potatoes at 180°c for 20-25 minutes.', 'remove and set aside.', 'in a small bowl, mix together all ingredients for the yoghurt dip and serve with the roasted potatoes.']

name: jackfruit tortilla bowls
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 2 sweetcorn cobettes', '1 unit 1 red chilli', '1 unit 2 teaspoons mustard oil', '1 unit 1 lime', '1 unit 15g fresh coriander', '1 unit 150g pack shredded jackfruit', '1 unit 1 x 210g tin kidney beans', '1 unit 125g roasted red peppers (from a jar)', '1 unit 2 whole wheat tortilla wraps', '1 unit ½ round lettuce', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['heat a griddle pan over a high heat (or light a barbecue). griddle the cobettes for 10-12 mins, turning, until cooked and charred all over. remove from the pan and stand upright on a board. use a sharp knife to carefully cut down the length of the corn, staying close to the core, to remove the kernels. mix the kernels with the chilli, oil, half the lime juice and half the coriander.', 'heat the jackfruit and sauce in a saucepan with the beans, peppers, remaining lime juice and coriander over a medium-low heat for 3-4 mins until heated through; season.', 'toast the wraps for 10-20 secs each side to char. tear into pieces and serve with the jackfruit, lettuce and sweetcorn salsa.']

name: mushroom pizza bake
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 250g large flat mushrooms', '1 unit 4 garlic cloves', '1 unit 1 small red onion', '1 unit 2 tablespoon mustard oil', '1 unit 400g self-raising flour', '1 unit 320g frozen spinach', '1 unit 1 x 400g tin plum tomatoes', '1 unit 1/2 cup grated mozzarella', '1 unit 30g fresh basil', '1 unit imli pulp (optional)', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat the tandoor or handi to 200°c. peel and trim the mushrooms (save the stalks for soups) and place on a 35 x 25cm flameproof baking tray with the garlic. peel and quarter the onion, break into petals and scatter onto the tray. drizzle with 1 tbsp oil and bake for 20-25 mins until soft.', 'meanwhile, mix the flour, a pinch of sea salt and 240ml cold water into a dough, then knead on a flour-dusted surface for 2 mins, adding a little extra flour if needed. carefully place the mushrooms, onion and garlic on a board. squeeze any water from the spinach, then toss in the tray juices.', 'drizzle 1 tbsp oil onto the tray and lay in the dough, pressing and pulling it to fill the corners and up the sides. drain the tomatoes (reserving the juice) and scrunch them over the dough, season, then sprinkle over the spinach, onion and mozzarella.', 'leave whole, chop or tear the mushrooms, then scatter on top, squeezing over the roasted garlic, to taste. pour a little tomato juice around the mushrooms, then place the tray over a high heat until the base starts to sizzle. bake on the highest tandoor or handi shelf for 15 mins or until golden and crisp. pick over the basil leaves, drizzle with balsamic.']

name: one pot greek chicken rice
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 5 chicken thighs cutlets or fillets', '1 unit 1 tablespoon mustard oil', '1 unit 1 teaspoon dried oregano', '1 unit 1 lemon zest', '1 unit 2 clove garlic crushed', '1 unit 1 brown onion finely diced', '1 unit 3 clove garlic roughly chopped', '1 unit 1 cup brown basmati rice rice', '1 unit 500 ml reduced sodium chicken stock', '1 unit 1 lemon zest & juice', '1 unit 1 cup baby spinach leaves', '1 unit 400 g butter beans rinsed', '1 unit 1 cup fresh flat-leaf parsley', '1 unit 1 lemon to serve', '1 unit sea salt and ground black pepper', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat an tandoor or handi to 210°c.', 'place the chicken in a bowl and add the olive oil, oregano, paprika, and a little salt & pepper. leave to marinate for 10 minutes or overnight in the fridge.', 'preheat a large frying pan, over high heat that can go in the tandoor or handi (if possible) and add 2 tablespoons of olive oil. add the chicken, cooking to get it nice and golden. flip and remove the chicken, then return the pan to medium heat, keeping the oil in the pan, and add the onion and garlic.', 'cook this, stirring often for 2 minutes, then add the lemon zest and rice and cook the rice, stirring often, for 2 minutes, then add the stock and bring to the boil stirring. add the juice of 1 lemon and adjust the seasoning to taste before nestling in the chicken. cover & transfer this to the tandoor or handi to cook for 15 minutes before removing the lid and continue to cook for another 10 minutes.', 'remove the chicken from the rice & stir through the spinach, chopped parsley & half the butterbeans through the rice.', 'return the chicken to the pan, finishing with the remaining herbs butterbeans and lemon wedges to serve.']

name: smoky spinach shaksusha
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 3 tablespoons mustard oil', '1 unit 2 cloves of garlic', '1 unit 2 spring onions', '1 unit ½ teaspoon salt', '1 unit 1 tablespoon tomato purée', '1 unit 4 tomatoes', '1 unit 2 teaspoon cumin seeds', '1 unit 1 teaspoon smoked paprika', '1 unit 200g baby spinach leaves', '1 unit 4 medium eggs', '1 unit 1 teaspoon chilli flakes', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['place a large non-stick frying pan (preferably one with a lid) on a high heat. add the oil, and as soon as it is warm, add the garlic. turn the heat down and add the spring onions.', 'add the salt, tomato purée and chopped tomatoes and cook for about 5 minutes, until the tomatoes have softened, adding 2 tablespoons of water if they start catching on the bottom of the pan.', 'add the cumin seeds and smoked paprika and cook the spices through for a few minutes.', 'add the spinach, a handful at a time, and mix. put the lid on the pan and allow the spinach to wilt. this will only take a few minutes.', 'take off the lid and cook for another few minutes on a medium heat until all the moisture has dried up.', 'make 4 cavities in which to place the eggs. crack an egg into each cavity, then put the lid on top and leave on the heat until the whites are cooked and the yolks are still runny. this will take roughly 4 minutes. take off the lid and sprinkle over the chilli flakes.']

name: peach melba pots
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 100ml low fat milk', '1 unit 3 teaspoons gelatine powder', '1 unit 350g natural yogurt', '1 unit 2 teaspoons vanilla extract', '1 unit 2 x 410g tins peach slices in juice', '1 unit 350g frozen raspberries', '1 unit 1-2 tablespoons honey', '1 unit a few mint leaves', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['heat the milk in a small saucepan over a low heat until just hot and steaming, but not boiling. remove from the heat and whisk in 1 gelatine sachet to dissolve. return to a very low heat to warm through, stirring to make sure it’s smooth (you can strain it through a sieve, if you like). mix the yogurt and vanilla in a large bowl. stir in the milk mixture until thoroughly combined, then spoon into 6 medium (about 250ml) glasses. transfer to the fridge for 20 mins to chill and set.', 'meanwhile, drain the peach slices, reserving 100ml juice. put the slices in a food processor and blitz to a purée. heat the reserved peach juice in a small pan until just hot but not boiling, then remove from the heat. stir in another gelatine sachet and whisk until it has completely dissolved. stir through the peach purée, then spoon on top of the yogurt. chill for 1 hr to set.', 'when the peach layer has set, put 12 raspberries aside to defrost. put the remaining raspberries in a saucepan and heat gently over a low heat for 3-4 mins until broken down into a purée but still juicy (take care not to boil and reduce to a jam). stir in 1 tbsp honey, then strain through a sieve into a clean bowl to remove the seeds. taste and add another 1 tbsp honey if very tart. add the remaining gelatine sachet to the warm raspberry mix, mixing well until dissolved. divide between the pots and chill for 2-3 hrs until set but with a slight wobble when shaken. garnish with mint leaves (if using) and the reserved thawed raspberries to serve.']

name: basil and cashew pesto pasta
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 200g fresh greens', '1 unit 320g penne', '1 unit 1 small garlic clove', '1 unit 30g pack fresh basil', '1 unit 40g cashew nuts', '1 unit 50ml mustard oil', '1 unit 1 lemon', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['bring a large pan of water to the boil and cook the fresh greens in it for 7 mins, then remove with tongs (leaving the water in the pan) and rinse under cold water until cool. squeeze out the excess water.', 'cook the penne in the same pan for 10 mins, then drain, reserving 100ml of the pasta water.', 'meanwhile, put the greens, garlic, most of the basil, 30g cashews, the oil and most of the lemon zest in a food processor. blitz until smooth.', 'tip the drained pasta back into the pan and add the pesto along with the reserved pasta water. stir well to coat the pasta, then divide between 4 bowls. top with the remaining basil, lemon zest and cashews to serve.']
nutrition_details: {'Saturated Fat': '3.5 g', 'Polyunsaturated Fat': '4 g', 'Monounsaturated Fat': '10 g', 'Trans Fat': '0 g', 'Cholesterol': '0 mg', 'Sodium': '100 mg', 'Potassium': '400 mg', 'Fiber': '6 g', 'Sugar': '5 g', 'Vitamin A': '20%', 'Vitamin C': '40%', 'Calcium': '10%', 'Iron': '15%'}

name: spiced cauliflower chraime
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 small head cauliflower', '1 unit 2 tablespoons extra-virgin mustard oil', '1 unit 1/2 medium white onion', '1 unit 3 tablespoons tomato paste', '1 unit 3 cloves garlic', '1 unit 4 teaspoons smoked paprika', '1 unit 2 teaspoons ground turmeric', '1 unit 1 teaspoon ground coriander', '1 unit 1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 unit 1 teaspoon ground ginger', '1 unit 1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper', '1 unit 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '1 unit 1/4 teaspoon salt', '1 unit 1 1/4 cups low-sodium vegetable stock', '1 unit 1/2 cup canned diced tomatoes (undrained)', '1 unit 1/2 cup golden raisins', '1 unit 2 tablespoons lemon juice', '1 unit 1/2 cup chopped fresh coriander', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['remove leaves from cauliflower and trim stem. leaving core intact, cut the cauliflower into 6 wedges.', 'heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. add onion; cook, stirring occasionally, until it begins to soften, 5 to 6 minutes. add tomato paste, garlic, smoked paprika, turmeric, coriander, cumin, ginger, crushed red pepper, cinnamon and salt; stir until combined. cook, stirring occasionally, until the mixture has darkened and the spices are fragrant, 2 to 3 minutes. add stock, tomatoes, raisins and lemon juice; stir to combine.', 'arrange the cauliflower wedges in the pan in a single layer; bring to a boil. reduce heat to maintain a simmer; cover, and cook until the cauliflower is tender, 15 to 20 minutes. sprinkle with coriander.']
nutrition_details: {'Saturated Fat': '1 g', 'Polyunsaturated Fat': '2 g', 'Monounsaturated Fat': '4 g', 'Trans Fat': '0 g', 'Cholesterol': '0 mg', 'Sodium': '120 mg', 'Potassium': '400 mg', 'Fiber': '5 g', 'Sugar': '8 g', 'Vitamin A': '10%', 'Vitamin C': '40%', 'Calcium': '4%', 'Iron': '10%'}

name: thai chicken curry
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 small onion', '1 unit 1 stalk lemongrass', '1 unit 1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 unit 3-4 teaspoons red thai curry paste', '1 unit 4 x 110g chicken fillets', '1 unit 1 tablespoons fish sauce', '1 unit pinch sugar', '1 unit 4 freeze-dried kaffir lime', '1 unit 1 can reduced-fat coconut milk', '1 unit 1 tablespoon chopped fresh coriander', '1 unit salt to taste', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['finely slice the onion and lemongrass.', 'heat the oil in a wok or large saucepan and fry the shallots/onion until soft and translucent. stir in the curry paste and cook for 1 minute, stirring all the time.', 'add chicken pieces and stir until well coated. add the lemongrass, fish sauce, sugar, kaffir lime leaves and coconut milk. bring slowly to the boil, then reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, for 15 minutes until the chicken is cooked. stir the curry a few times while it cooks, to stop it sticking and to keep the chicken submerged.', 'check seasoning then stir in coriander and serve with brown basmati rice.']
nutrition_details: {'Saturated Fat': '12 g', 'Polyunsaturated Fat': '2 g', 'Monounsaturated Fat': '4 g', 'Trans Fat': '0 g', 'Cholesterol': '60 mg', 'Sodium': '350 mg', 'Potassium': '400 mg', 'Fiber': '2 g', 'Sugar': '6 g', 'Vitamin A': '10%', 'Vitamin C': '20%', 'Calcium': '10%', 'Iron': '15%'}

name: pumpkin seed and oat bread
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 300g gluten free bread flour', '1 unit 200 g rolled oats', '1 unit 50 g pumpkin seeds', '1 unit 2.5 g salt', '1 unit 2 tablespoons oil', '1 unit ½ cup low fat plain yoghurt', '1 unit 20 g active dry yeast', '1 unit 1 cup warm water', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat tandoor or handi to 180°c.', 'grease and line the baking tin with baking paper.', 'combine all dry ingredients in a bowl and mix well. dissolve the yeast in the warm water.', 'make a well in the center and place oil, yoghurt and yeast mix.', 'combine and mix vigorously for 2 minutes. spread evenly into the greased loaf tin.', 'cover with a piece of paper towel or dish cloth.', 'leave in a warm (e.g. warming drawer) until it has doubled in size. bake at 180°c until golden brown on top and cooked (30 – 40 minutes). if you knock the top with the back of knife, must sound hollow.', 'allow it to cool in the tin before turning it out.']
nutrition_details: {'Saturated Fat': '1 g', 'Polyunsaturated Fat': '2 g', 'Monounsaturated Fat': '4 g', 'Trans Fat': '0 g', 'Cholesterol': '5 mg', 'Sodium': '120 mg', 'Potassium': '250 mg', 'Fiber': '4 g', 'Sugar': '2 g', 'Vitamin A': '2%', 'Vitamin C': '0%', 'Calcium': '10%', 'Iron': '10%'}

name: smokey aubergine pearl barley
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 2 tablespoons mustard oil', '1 unit 1 large red onion', '1 unit 2 teaspoons smoked paprika', '1 unit 2 tablespoons tomato purée', '1 unit 30g pack fresh basil', '1 unit 300g pearl barley', '1 unit 1 x 400g tin chopped tomatoes', '1 unit 1 litre vegetable stock', '1 unit 1 dried bay leaf (optional)', '1 unit 2 aubergines (about 300g each)', '1 unit 8 whole large garlic cloves', '1 unit 300g pack whole cherry tomatoes', '1 unit 40g walnut halves', '1 unit 1/2 cup ricotta', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat the tandoor or handi to 180°c. heat ½ tbsp oil in a casserole dish or large pan. add the onion, partially cover, and cook for 10 mins, stirring occasionally, until softened. stir in the smoked paprika, tomato purée and the basil stalks, adding a splash of water if it’s dry. cook, stirring, for 2-3 mins.', 'stir in the pearl barley, cook for 1 min, then add the chopped tomatoes, stock and bay leaf, if using. season with black pepper and bring to the boil. reduce the heat and simmer for 30 mins, stirring occasionally (and adding 100-200ml just-boiled water to loosen if needed), until cooked.', 'meanwhile, in a large roasting tin, toss the aubergine in the remaining 1½ tbsp olive oil and season, ensuring the chunks are in a single layer – you may need two tins. add the garlic cloves. roast for 10 mins, then scatter the cherry tomatoes over. roast for 20 mins until the veg is tender.', 'for the final 5 mins of roasting, spread the walnuts out in another roasting tin and bake until toasted; cool slightly, then chop.', 'carefully, squeeze the roasted garlic from their skins, using the back of a knife onto a chopping board. stir into the barley, then fold in half the roasted veg.', 'season with black pepper. serve the risotto topped with the remaining veg, a spoonful of ricotta, the toasted walnuts and the basil leaves.']
nutrition_details: {'Saturated Fat': '2.5 g', 'Polyunsaturated Fat': '4 g', 'Monounsaturated Fat': '10 g', 'Trans Fat': '0 g', 'Cholesterol': '10 mg', 'Sodium': '250 mg', 'Potassium': '800 mg', 'Fiber': '8 g', 'Sugar': '8 g', 'Vitamin A': '20%', 'Vitamin C': '40%', 'Calcium': '15%', 'Iron': '20%'}

name: stuffed sweet potato with hummus dressing
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1 large sweet potato', '1 unit ¾ cup chopped kale', '1 unit 1 cup canned black beans', '1 unit ¼ cup hummus', '1 unit 2 tablespoons water', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['prick sweet potato all over with a fork. microwave on high until cooked through, 7 to 10 minutes.', 'meanwhile, wash kale and drain, allowing water to cling to the leaves. place in a medium saucepan; cover and cook over medium-high heat, stirring once or twice, until wilted. add beans; add a tablespoon or two of water if the pot is dry. continue cooking, uncovered, stirring occasionally, until the mixture is steaming hot, 1 to 2 minutes.', 'split the sweet potato open and top with the kale and bean mixture. combine hummus and 2 tablespoons water in a small dish. add additional water as needed to reach desired consistency. drizzle the hummus dressing over the stuffed sweet potato.']
nutrition_details: {'Saturated Fat': '2 g', 'Polyunsaturated Fat': '4 g', 'Monounsaturated Fat': '6 g', 'Trans Fat': '0 g', 'Cholesterol': '0 mg', 'Sodium': '100 mg', 'Potassium': '800 mg', 'Fiber': '8 g', 'Sugar': '8 g', 'Vitamin A': '20%', 'Vitamin C': '40%', 'Calcium': '10%', 'Iron': '15%'}

name: fruity oat bake
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 100g lower-fat spread', '1 unit 125g porridge oats', '1 unit 120g wholemeal flour', '1 unit 75g pitted prunes', '1 unit 65g sultanas', '1 unit 1 teaspoon mixed spice', '1 unit 1 teaspoon ginger', '1 unit 2 small eggs', '1 unit 1 -2 teaspoons granulated sugar', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat the tandoor or handi to 180°c. melt the spread in a pan on a low heat and set aside, reserving 2 teaspoons to oil the baking dish.', 'place the oats and flour in a bowl and mix together. add the prunes, sultanas, mixed spice and ginger. mix well.', 'add the melted spread and mix. add the beaten eggs and 100ml water. mix well.   4. grease a 20cm x 26cm baking tin, place the mixture in and gently press down to about 1cm thick.', 'dust lightly with sweetener and bake for 20-25 minutes. allow to cool, before cutting into 12 pieces and serving.']
nutrition_details: {'Saturated Fat': '2.5 g', 'Polyunsaturated Fat': '2 g', 'Monounsaturated Fat': '7 g', 'Trans Fat': '0 g', 'Cholesterol': '80 mg', 'Sodium': '100 mg', 'Potassium': '400 mg', 'Fiber': '6 g', 'Sugar': '20 g', 'Vitamin A': '10%', 'Vitamin C': '2%', 'Calcium': '10%', 'Iron': '15%'}

name: persian-style quinoa and beans with chicken
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 1/4 teaspoon ground saffron', '1 unit 3 ice cubes', '1 unit 1 tablespoon extra-virgin mustard oil', '1 unit 1 small onion', '1 unit 2 boneless', '1 unit 1 teaspoon salt', '1 unit 1 teaspoon ground turmeric', '1 unit 1/2 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 unit 1/4 teaspoon ground pepper', '1 unit 4 cups low-sodium chicken stock', '1 unit 2 cups quinoa', '1 unit 1 bunch fresh dill', '1 unit 1 bunch fresh parsley', '1 unit 1 bunch fresh chives', '1 unit 2 cloves garlic', '1 unit 2 cups frozen lima beans or shelled edamame', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['place saffron in a small bowl and add ice cubes. set aside until the ice melts, about 45 minutes.', 'heat a large pot over medium heat. add oil and onion; cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, 4 to 5 minutes. add chicken, salt, turmeric, cumin and pepper; mix well. cook, stirring occasionally, until the chicken is no longer pink on the outside, 5 to 6 minutes. add broth and 1 tablespoon of reserved saffron water. reduce heat to a simmer and cook until the liquid is reduced by one-third and the chicken is cooked through, 25 to 30 minutes', 'add quinoa, dill, parsley, chives and garlic to the pot. stir to combine, then stir in beans (or edamame). bring the mixture to a simmer and cook, stirring occasionally, until the liquid is mostly absorbed, and the quinoa is tender, 20 to 25 minutes.', 'cover tightly and let stand for 5 minutes. fluff with a fork. stir in the remaining saffron water before serving. garnish with more herbs, if desired.']
nutrition_details: {'Saturated Fat': '2.5 g', 'Polyunsaturated Fat': '4 g', 'Monounsaturated Fat': '8 g', 'Trans Fat': '0 g', 'Cholesterol': '60 mg', 'Sodium': '250 mg', 'Potassium': '800 mg', 'Fiber': '8 g', 'Sugar': '5 g', 'Vitamin A': '15%', 'Vitamin C': '20%', 'Calcium': '10%', 'Iron': '20%'}

name: chicken, courgette and spinach lasagna
summary: A diabetic-friendly recipe with a Pakistani twist.
ingredients: ['1 unit 280g spinach', '1 unit 1 tablespoon mustard oil', '1 unit 1 onion', '1 unit 500g low fat chicken mince', '1 unit 2 garlic cloves', '1 unit 3 large courgettes (about 350g)', '1 unit 10g fresh mint', '1 unit 250g ricotta cheese', '1 unit 50g paneer', '1 unit ½ lemon', '1 unit ¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg', '1 unit 6 whole wheat lasagna sheets', '1 tsp garam masala', '1 tsp red chili powder', '1 tsp cumin powder']
instructions: ['preheat the tandoor or handi to 180°c. put the spinach into a colander and pour over a full kettle of just-boiled water and allow to wilt. put the spinach into a muslin or tea towel and squeeze as much water out as possible, then roughly chop and set aside.', 'heat the oil in a large frying pan and fry the onion over a medium-high heat for 8-10 mins until soft, then add the chicken mince and fry for 6-7 mins until cooked through, browned and any liquid has evaporated. add the garlic and courgettes and cook for 3-4 mins until the courgette liquid has evaporated; season well and remove from the heat.', 'put the spinach, mint, ricotta, 40g parmesan, lemon and nutmeg into a clean bowl and mix together.', 'put a third of the courgette mixture into a 1.2ltr (15 x 25cm) baking dish and top with a third of the ricotta, then lay over a third of the pasta to cover. repeat twice more, ending in a layer of ricotta. season well with black pepper and sprinkle over the remaining 10g of parmesan.', 'bake for 25-30 mins until golden and bubbling on top and serve with the green salad on the side.']
nutrition_details: {'Saturated Fat': '8 g', 'Polyunsaturated Fat': '4 g', 'Monounsaturated Fat': '6 g', 'Trans Fat': '0 g', 'Cholesterol': '60 mg', 'Sodium': '250 mg', 'Potassium': '400 mg', 'Fiber': '5 g', 'Sugar': '8 g', 'Vitamin A': '20%', 'Vitamin C': '40%', 'Calcium': '25%', 'Iron': '15%'}
